Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As an enabler of business innovation and technology transfer, CNL is committed to a clean and prosperous Canada. A leader in environmental remediation at nuclear and radiologically contaminated sites, CNL is implementing the Port Hope Area Initiative on behalf of Atomic Energy of Canada Limited. The cleanup of historic Low Level Radioactive Waste by CNL in the communities of Port Hope and Port Granby in Ontario is a demonstration of Canada’s commitment to the safe, long-term storage and management of nuclear waste.
 The Data Analyst will support the various project teams at the Historic Waste Program. They will provide data analysis, aggregation and reporting expertise based on daily and weekly project updates. Their work will support project planning decisions and be used to inform various stakeholders so accuracy and attention to detail are key. They have an ability to implement best practices for data management and dashboard reporting in addition to supporting GIS and other management reporting systems as needed. They are an effective team member, easily able to juggle multiple deadlines and communicate technical issues into relevant business terms.
 RESPONSIBILITIES

    Aggregate data from multiple sources into management systems Aggregate data from multiple sources into management systems:
   

Perform quality checks and report issues to project teams
Perform data analysis and maintain data freshness
Present findings and suggest improvements on current data to improve reporting
Generate reports and/or data visualizations as requested by project teams and stakeholders.
Support project teams by ensuring report parameters are accurate and valuable for decision making processes
Perform quality checks on reports to ensure accurate data processing
Present reports to stakeholders/teams and communicate findings in a professional manner while explaining data processes/system capabilities


 Work closely with various HWP project teams to offer expertise and support on data and reporting needs. Support internal team on various business systems and be open to learning new skills and systems as well as teaching others.
 QUALIFICATIONS
 Education: Bachelor degree with focus on computer science, commerce, statistics, science or other similar subject where computations, excel and data are managed
 Experience: 5+ years in a data analyst role and 3+ years supporting project teams
 Abilities and Skills: Highly skilled in planning and prioritizing work to meet various deadlines Flexible work schedule to meet project demands and last minute requests Build cooperative relationships with professional and effective verbal and written communication skills Develop constructive relationships with project team members of all levels and be able to influence and/or educate Quick learner and highly adaptable to changes in processes, systems or technologies Strong questioning attitude with logical thinking Detail oriented, accurate and precise.
 Job/Industry Specific Knowledge: Knowledge of advanced tools and features in Excel for data management Knowledge of database design principles and SQL Well experienced in managing, manipulating and presenting large datasets Well experienced in data quality processes and data aggregation Experienced in dashboard reporting or data visualization Well experienced in administration of SharePoint and Microsoft Teams Experience with ESRI ArcGIS Online and/or Portal Experience with project management processes: schedule, cost, change control
 #LI-POST

Title: Group Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
At Equitable Life of Canada, we realize that your work life is not just about performing a job; it's about being part of a workplace that helps you grow and reach your full potential. Within our friendly and collaborative work environment, we recognize that the key to our growth and success is a dedicated, motivated and customer-responsive staff. Join Equitable Life today. 


Position Title: Group Data Reporting Analyst 

Reports To: Director, Group Actuary 

Department: Group Actuarial 

Term: Permanent, Full Time 

Band: 3M 


Work Arrangements: We are currently working remotely, and we will be moving to a hybrid model when our office renovation is complete (approximately June 2023), coming into the office 25% on designated days. 


The Opportunity: The Group Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for providing management reporting and data analysis support to the Group Division. This is accomplished by providing financial and business reporting, Salesforce compensation reporting (sales, profitability, retention, discounting), support for a multitude of data requests (internal or external), as well as technical solutions and expertise to improve efficiency of the tools used for pricing, planning, and reporting. 


What you’ll do:


Complete month, quarter, and year-end financial and management reports
Develop and maintain the complex tool complex tool to support the reporting of the profitability, retention, and discounting on our Group business
Calculate sales bonuses, guaranteed compensation, and qualifications for rewards programs
Develop and maintain the tool to support advisor conference qualification
Supports other areas (Sales, Claims, Underwriting, etc.) by providing meaningful and relevant data to drive business decisions
Responsible for the multitude of surveys the Group division participates in – Fraser Group, Benefits Canada, CIA, CLHIA, etc.
Develop and maintain ad hoc reports to support the ongoing financial understanding of our business
Responsible for following established processes and procedures, identifying potential gaps, omissions or activities that could expose the organization to unnecessary operational risk

What you’ll need:


Post secondary education in Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Computer Science or Business Administration
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, VBA
Knowledge in data management in transactional/relational databases - MS SQL preferred
Knowledge in Microsoft Power Platform applications, including Power BI is an asset
Strong understanding of BMS is an asset
Knowledge of how group insurance operates is an asset
Effective influencing skills – ability to influence customers on processes and applications
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Superior analytical and problem-solving skills
Process-oriented, high level of accuracy and attention to detail
Documentation, presentation, and effective communication skills
Adaptable to change
 To learn more about Equitable Life, we encourage you to explore our organization. 

 At Equitable Life, we are committed to providing equal access to employment opportunities across our organization. Please contact our HR team at careers@equitable.ca if you would like to receive our job postings in an alternative format or require an accommodation with the application process.

Title: Data Analyst (Canada)
Description:
Tiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Analysts to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership have been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.
 Position Overview:
 The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (Bureau) regulations require lenders to ensure that the issued billing statements and any tax information (to get federal tax benefits) shared with student loan customers are accurate. The Student Loans division and the candidates working for this team would work on redressing the impacted customers. This would be done through investigation, remediation, and execution for redressal.
 Responsibilities:

 Work through multiple data files (Excel or otherwise) to ensure the accuracy of the captured information - rates, balances, loan agreements, file name, extracted data from the company database, and other supporting files/customer data etc.
Enter data, fill out new data templates based on already collected data to create case packages
Create, maintain, and modify documentation for the followed processes

Requirements

 Bachelor's in quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, finance, economics, accounting or engineering
1-3 years of professional experience as Data analyst – data entering, data validation, working with Excel data files (pivots, vlookups etc.)
1-2 years of experience in writing SQL queries
Experience with documentation of operational process is desired but not mandatory

Benefits
 Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.

Title: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description:
Job Number:J0222-2134Job Title:Data Warehouse AnalystJob Type:Permanent FT SupportBargaining Unit:FT SupportSchool/Department:Finance & Business DevelopmentCampus/Location:Progress CampusPay Range:$41.96 - $48.66/HourPay Band:Support KHours/Week:40Shift Schedule:Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pmDate Posted:July 5, 2022Closing Date:July 28, 2022Centennial College recognizes and affirms Diversity, Equity and Inclusion and Indigenous ways of knowing as central to the vibrancy and uniqueness of its learning and working academic mission. We strongly encourage applications from members of Indigenous communities and all equity-deserving groups including Women, Racialized, Persons with Disabilities, and LGBTQ+ communities.
We also recognize that Centennial is situated on the Treaty Lands of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and pay tribute to their legacy as well as that of all First Peoples that have been and remain present here in Toronto. We recognize that First Peoples come from sovereign Nations and that part of understanding our responsibilities of residing on this territory are understanding the true history, circumstances and legacy of the Treaties signed here (such as the Toronto Purchase, Robinson-Huron Treaty and Williams Treaties) and including pre-contact Treaties and Agreements between sovereign Nations and that all peoples in this area are therefore Treaty people with obligations and responsibilities to all our relations.Position SummaryReporting to the DevOps Manager, the Data Warehouse Analyst will work with clients across the College to analyze, plan, organize, and optimize analytic databases and applications. They will work to improve the IT department’s understanding of what data would help the College meet business goals and plans. Consequently, the Data Warehouse Analyst will gather those requirements and engage in expanding the data warehouse and its capabilities by extending and/or improving the data warehouse architecture and other external data sources. The primary focus is to design and administer the ETL (Extract, Transform, Load).The incumbent is an expert in all aspects of BI starting with the collection and transformation of detailed data elements, through to helping users access and use the information in the data warehouse. The Data Warehouse Analyst will assist IT Analysts in developing the presentation layer(s) and providing specialized reporting views. In addition, the incumbent will provide support to data analytic clients by providing features/data elements for advanced analysis such as forecasting and predictions.The incumbent will keep up to date with the rapid advancements being made in BI systems and will help both ITS and business users understand how the new technologies can be applied to move the College forward in planning and monitoring goals and objectives.****ResponsibilitiesProject Leadership and Support

Leads the development and maintenance of data warehouses and Operational Data Stores (ODS), Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and creates new or expanded data stores to support new requirements.
Leads multifunctional teams to ensure data warehouse projects are aligned with other IT projects and meet user requirements.
Resolves issues related to service requests or production problems.
Collaborates with business users to understand and collect business requirements.
Supports the coaching and training of staff on processes, procedures, and appropriate work practices, as needed.
Provides both technical and general direction to junior team members.

Planning and Analysis

Plans projects to develop new data sources, new data feeds, new data stores and new tools for end users.
Analyzes current reporting applications and/or data warehouses through review of documentation and interviews with clients.
Follows and is compliant with company policies and procedures and the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.
Prepares or assists with feasibility studies, requirements definitions (e.g., Source to Target Mappings), conceptual design documents, work plans, systems design, implementation designs, system and program specifications, and system and client documentation.
Defines testing requirements.
Troubleshoots production systems.
Researches and has a deep understanding of sources of data.
Develops and manages implementation of data/code fixes for defects utilizing the Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) process.
Monitors data warehouses load performance and data quality on a regular basis or for month-end and works with Information Technology (IT) staff to improve both performance and quality.
Consults with managers in requesting business units to determine project timelines, and where necessary, develops project plans to complete data warehouse requests

Design, Development and Administration

Manage architecture, applications, systems and reporting services
Extract, Transfer Load (ETL): Design end to end processes to extract, transfer and load data from the Banner ERP solution and other sources into the custom and ODS data marts.
Co-ordinate the design and develop efficient workflow processes to automate ETL events
Identifying, troubleshooting and reporting application performance and outages
Fine tuning and performance enhancement throughout all ETL processes through data cleansing recommendations, coding and redesigning of data models
Performing general monitoring of core and external applications linked to the Decision Support and Reporting support systems.
Develops SQL queries, shell scripts, PL/SQL stored procedures, and reports, using customer requirements and documents, in accordance with established criteria and standards.
Designs, integrates, tests, maintains, and supports automated reports delivered through Cognos or other technologies, as required.
Designs and executes the moving of data from one environment to another by using Imports or SQL queries.
Prepares operational documentation for the system users and support teams according to established departmental and divisional standards.
Contributes to team effort by completing assigned tasks and supporting other team members.
Creates program design specifications in accordance with established criteria and standards
Provide the quality assurance on promoting applications and services received from program analysts through development environment and test to production server application according to college approved promotion policies, procedures and change management routines.

Qualifications/Experience

Minimum four (4) year Degree in Computer Science or a related field
Minimum five (5) years in Data Warehouse Design and Architecture, including extensive experience designing, implementing and supporting data model and data warehouse projects.
Strong understanding of the ERP product and the flow of information in context of data warehousing
Strong understanding of Oracle technologies including Oracle ODI and PL/SQL programming
Data Warehouse Design (Kimball and/or Inmon methodologies) or similar certification a plus
Demonstrated experience in:
Relational Database Management System (RDBMS).
A business analyst and/or systems analyst in IT role together with experience in managing customer relationships and project coordination/project management.
Technology process mapping, business process mapping and workflow.
Executing quality assurance best practice and procedures for information systems and services
Technical Project Leadership
Oracle PL/SQL programming
Extract-Transform-Load Tools and Techniques (Oracle Database Integrator or similar)
Data modeling toolsets such as ERWIN or ER Studio Data Architect
Internet Information Servers (IIS), WINDOWS, Linux/UNIX
Shell scripting
Additional assets:
Knowledge of Oracle database architecture
Hyper Text Mark-up Language (HTML), Dynamic Hyper Text Mark-up Language (DHTML)
JAVA, Extended Mark-up Language (XML), Groovy, Shell Scripting, Python
APACHE, Simple Mail Transfer
Protocol (SMTP)
Collaboration and facilitation skills to consult with diverse stakeholders and facilitate discussions among stakeholders with different interests
Demonstrated leadership skills
Strong judgement, organizational skills and ability to be flexible/adaptable,
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Title: BI analyst and data visualization
Description:
Primary Locations: Montreal, Quebec
Attendance: Hybrid

Employee Status: Regular


 Schedule: Full-time

 A career in data analysis at National Bank means being able to pursue your ambitions by contributing to the goal of becoming the most stimulating workplace in the country. Thanks to your talents as a BI Analyst and in data visualization, you are evolving the practices of the "Strategy and Governance of Compensation in Business Sectors" sectors. As an expert, you will work together on new trends with analytical partners, data analysts and data scientists in the realization of various mandates covering the entire Bank and its subsidiaries.
 Your role:

 Provide an overview of sector activities and EE KPIs by producing statistics and dashboards
 Design and develop data sets needed to develop key performance indicators in accordance with best practices
 Support and train users on the use and content of reports to maximize the adoption of solutions developed
 Promote data analysis as part of the Bank’s mandates by suggesting ideas to Analytics Partner to increase the quality or efficiency of mandates, in keeping with the standards of the profession and changing practices
 Acting as a data management and mining expert and working closely with analytics partners, data analysts and data scientists to carry out various mandates that cover the entire Bank and its subsidiaries.
 Leveraging employee data to help improve the client experience and deliver a personalized employee experience.
 Applying rigorous analysis methods to large databases to understand trends and identify faults.

 In this position, you participate as a key partner in the implementation of a major compensation transformation project.
 This team reports to the Senior Manager, Compensation Strategy and Governance for The Business Sectors. It is made up of about thirty passionate advisors and is a strategic partner to the business sectors. Collaboration and partnership are key to succeeding with a hybrid work model that the Bank favours for greater flexibility.
 Required competencies:

 Bachelor’s degree (or academic equivalent) in a related field and 5 years of relevant experience or master’s degree in a related field and 3 years of experience
 Excellent knowledge of Power BI
 Experience in project management
 Good communication skills and ability to influence

 Desired competencies:

 Advanced knowledge of Tableau
 Experience in the field of employee experience and compensation
 Knowledge of several data environments
 Be agile and know how to navigate ambiguity
 Strong collaborative spirit

 Your benefits
 Upon hiring, you will be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family:

 Health and wellness program, including many benefits
 Flexible group insurance
 Defined benefit pension plan
 Employee Share Ownership Plan
 Employee and family assistance program
 Preferred banking services
 Volunteer program
 Telemedicine
 Virtual sleep clinic

 These are just a few of the many benefits we offer. We've rolled out a number of additional measures to ensure your health, safety and wellbeing during the pandemic.
 We're putting people first
 We're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Our mission is to have a positive impact on peoples' lives.
 Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that is accessible to all employees.
 We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodations, feel free to let us know during your first conversations with us.
 We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team?

 Ready to live your ambitions?

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 151215  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team Oversees Finance Data Management & Data Services within Global Finance & Risk Technology (GFRT) provides analytics and support services for Global Finance Initiatives. The Finance Data Management Data Services team supports Financial Close Processes and provide Financial Data Management, Data Analysis, Data Quality and Data Governance services for Toronto/Canada. The team is heavily involved in business transformation projects and equivalency testing during migrations.

 The Role As a Data Engineer you are required to participate in multiple finance transformation projects, liaise with stakeholders on new business initiatives, delivering solutions to meet the needs of multiple lines of business, and interfaces extensively with business clients. The incumbent will have a minimum of 2 to 3 years of strong expertise querying data from ledgers, data models, database design and an understanding of the Bank's financial data. The individual must thrive on challenge, be proactive, and demonstrate initiative, coaching the data engineers and eagerness to learn.
 Some of the key accountabilities include:

Work with senior team members (architects, developers, testers) to develop and implement data solutions for finance reporting systems
Analyze data in both Financial Systems and Big Data environments
Support senior team members through research assignments and proof of concepts
Demonstrate a passion for problem solving and data presentation technologies
Facilitate UAT testing for system migration and new initiatives
Report development and support for internal customers; including executives analytical minded skillset
Provide analytical support to company leadership by providing ad-hoc analysis and data trouble shooting support
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Builds a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment and using a coaching mindset and behaviors; communicating vison/values/business strategy; and managing succession and development planning for the team.



 What You Will Bring to Succeed


Advanced level SQL design / reporting / data mining experience or familiar with using ACL
CPA/CA or Accounting/finance knowledge with computer science/data sciences certification is preferred.
Data Modeling experience with Agile methodology and familiar with scrum meetings and sprint planning.
Analytical and Detail-oriented
Report development and support for internal and external customers; including executives analytical minded skillset.




 The Workplace


We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation

Title: Data Analyst (Student)
Description:
Job Description: 
 
 We are Canada Life



 Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.
 




  You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.
 

 


  Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.
 


 Be your best at Canada Life.
 


 We are looking for a Data Analyst, Co-Op
 

 Advisor Monitoring is a team of data analysts in Market Conduct (part of Corporate Compliance) that perform descriptive analytics looking for insights into advisor behaviour and market conduct risk while performing second line oversight of Advisory Network. 
Reporting into the Manager – Advisor Monitoring, the Data Analyst role contributes to the execution of the Advisor Monitoring team by combining advanced analytical skills with strong industry knowledge. The ideal candidate is able to combine these abilities to efficiently and effectively draw conclusions and make recommendations to mitigate risk in Advisory Network. This includes detecting anomalous data patterns, analyzing these patterns using knowledge of Distribution processes and products and projecting the results across the rest of the business to recommend control changes where appropriate.




What you will do


 Provide valuable data analytics to influence effective change:
   
 Combine expert industry knowledge with advanced data analytics skills to enhance predictive capabilities of Advisor Monitoring team while detecting emerging trends. 
Collaborate with data scientists and other IT partners to continuously enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the Advisor Monitoring program.
 This includes tying trends identified during advisor case assessments to population studies to determine the prevalence of trends and recommend next steps.

 Assist with the execution of advisor monitoring program:
   
 Analyze large volumes of transactional data to identify key risks with a focus on advisor misconduct. This includes ongoing advisor case assessment work.
 Apply industry knowledge to assess potential advisor misconduct and resolve findings. This may require contacting advisors and/or customers where appropriate.
 Conduct root cause analysis of market conduct complaints and use findings to set business requirements and execute upgrades to existing data analytics program.

 Provide effective oversight of Advisory Network:
   
 Leverage program findings and understand controls framework and leverage program findings to provide effective challenge for upstream controls.
 Share analytical best practices with business partners to drive the continuous improvement of business processes across Risk & Compliance.
 Follow up on referred cases to ensure successful achievement of advisor outcomes.



 What you will bring


 Advanced data analytics skills with ability to work effectively in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Power BI and Tableau Software.
 Creative thinker with the ability to understand the root cause of an issue and use data to establish detective controls for the issue.
 Strong interpersonal skills and a demonstrated experience working effectively in a team environment as well as independently.
 Well-developed planning and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks while meeting tight deadlines.
 Excellent verbal and written communication/documentation skills.
 Strong influencer with the ability to provide effective challenge to legacy processes.
 Advanced knowledge of insurance and wealth products, particularly for Individual Customer.
 Understanding of advisor compensation is an asset.
 Knowledge of internal admin systems an asset (ie. Univeris, legacy systems, OnBase, etc.)
 Post-secondary education in a related field.
 Professional designation or diploma (ie. CPA, CFA, CSC, IFIC) an asset.


 Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today



 We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!



 Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.



 We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee 
has the opportunity to
 reach their potential.



 Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

Title: Data Analyst - Remote
Description:
About KOHO



 KOHO’s purpose is to empower Canadians to build a great financial foundation with products that are radically transparent and easy to manage. Our journey began in 2014, and we have since built a community of over 600,000 users. Leading investors around the globe believe in our vision, and we’ve successfully raised over $320M to make our vision a reality.
 


 The KOHO collective has grown to 300+ employees to date. Discover our culture here and get the inside scoop from our team here!
 


 About the Role



 KOHO is looking for a Data Analyst to work with the User Success team to make data-driven decisions. This is the role for you if you love automating reports, developing dashboards, and analyzing financial data to derive actionable insights. You’ll spend a lot of your time writing SQL queries, developing Python scripts, and consulting with business-side team members. We have a few positions so we're open to junior and senior levels of experience!
 
 What You'll Do

 You will study current data sources to develop accurate reporting
 You will develop and present dashboards that highlight results and trends
 You will conduct deep-dive analysis into financial and risk data
 You will scope and prioritize incoming data requests within your workflow
 You will coordinate with other data team members on team projects and preserving our data warehouse as the source of truth at KOHO

 Who You Are

 You have experience in a data or financial analyst role
 You are comfortable manipulating datasets with SQL (familiar with self-joins, window functions, parameters), and have intermediate Python knowledge (user-defined functions, creating API requests, writing efficient loops)
 You have strong quantitative and analytical competency combined with data gathering skills
 You are a quick study on business concepts, metrics, and KPIs
 You have the ability to multitask and prioritize multiple assignments
 You are well organized and have effective time management skills

 A bonus if you have experience or an interest in any of the following!

 Git
 Financial industry experience


 What’s In It For You?



 We invest time and resources into making sure KOHO is as good as the people we hire. Here are some of the reasons we attract and keep the best people:
 


 Balance Your Life - Company-wide Summer wellness days, Winter holiday closure, unlimited Personal Days, a wellness spending account, and maternity & parental leave top-up.
Remote First - Work from anywhere in Canada with a budget to set up your home office
Level Up - Access to 3 in-house certified performance coaches and an annual training budget.
Reach Your Goals - Salary assessments twice per year, GRSP matching.
The KOHO Culture - We have won 7 "Great Place to Work ®" awards since 2019.



 The KOHO culture is one of collaboration, creativity, and diverse perspectives. We are committed to building and fostering an inclusive, accessible environment for everyone. If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding accessibility needs, please contact peopleaccessibility@koho.ca and the People and Culture team will be happy to help.

Title: Junior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Vovia is different. We think you’ll feel those differences in a few key ways - the people you’ll work with, our focus on continual innovation and development, and our commitment to support you on the path that works for you.
We are looking for a results-oriented, data-driven Analyst for our Marketing Intelligence team to help plan and execute integrated analytic strategies for our clients. You will use leading-edge data tools and will be given opportunities to test and expand your inquisitive, technical, analytical, and communication skills.
About Us
Vovia is a leading marketing, media, and data analysis agency. We believe that success comes from focusing on our people, creating an environment where everyone is free to be themselves, feels supported, and is doing meaningful work together.
What We Offer
- To be part of a dynamic team in a highly collaborative environment- Recognition – everyone is a contributor- To be part of a culture that focuses on continuous improvement and innovation – it really is embedded in everything we do- Other benefits designed to help you be the best you can be in life and at work including team builders, benefits and health spending account, ongoing training and professional development, and performance-based bonus plan- Flexible work from home options
Our Commitment to Diversity
We all benefit from being exposed to different ideas, perspectives, and viewpoints. Innovation requires diversity of thought and challenging our assumptions and beliefs. We support and encourage team members to share their opinions and thoughts in a way that is comfortable for each person. Vovia is committed to diversity and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals.
What We’re Looking For
About You
A problem solver with excellent analytical skills and the ability to turn data into meaningful insights. You are always learning and love a challenge. You are motivated and work well independently, but also enjoy working with awesome people in a team setting. Your previous manager or mentor would describe you as a strategic thinker that is dependable, inquisitive, detail-oriented and constantly looking to innovate. You’re always learning how the latest analytics techniques and technologies can help drive results for our clients.
About the Role
The Analyst strategizes, develops and delivers analytic solutions for Vovia’s wide client roster. You’ll work collaboratively with other Analysts, Media specialists, Digital specialists and Client Service team members to define and implement analytic strategies designed to track, measure, and deliver actionable insights.
What You’ll Be Doing
- Technical understanding of digital analytics implementation strategies & tagging methodology- Developing client metric and KPI strategies- Monitoring campaign performance against performance goals- Periodic and ad hoc report construction for stakeholders- Analyze and interpret data and external research in order to communicate actionable insights and data-driven recommendations- Work collaboratively with team members- Thought leadership, problem solving with an eye to future opportunities
What You’ll Need to Be Successful
Must Have’s
- BComm, BSc, or BA Degree and/or appropriate combination of experience- Experience with web analytics solutions, such as Google Analytics (GA certification is a plus), and/or Adobe Analytics- Has a passion for data, spreadsheets, and analysis- Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain findings in a digestible manner for both technical and non-technical audiences- Extreme attention to detail- High level of organization and efficiency
Nice to Have’s
- Experience with managing and debugging analytics implementations on websites preferred- Experience with tag management systems such as Google Tag Manager and an understanding of campaign UTMs is preferred- Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Google DataStudio preferred- Experience with digital marketing and web usability technologies/platforms, such as Google AdWords, Bing Ads, LinkedIn Ads and Facebook Ads is considered an asset- Experience with SQL for querying and reporting against large scale data sets is considered an asset- Experience coding in JavaScript, R, or Python is considered an asset- Knowledge of digital advertising industry, including current trends and best practices
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Senior Data Analyst 


Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.). Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 1000, and the Fortune 500 and we are among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. 



Please note, this role is not able to offer visa transfer or sponsorship now or in the future*
 Practice - AIA - Artificial Intelligence and Analytics 


About AI & Analytics: Artificial intelligence (AI) and the data it collects and analyzes will soon sit at the core of all intelligent, human-centric businesses. By decoding customer needs, preferences, and behaviors, our clients can understand exactly what services, products, and experiences their consumers need. Within AI & Analytics, we work to design the future—a future in which trial-and-error business decisions have been replaced by informed choices and data-supported strategies. 

 By applying AI and data science, we help leading companies to prototype, refine, validate, and scale their AI and analytics products and delivery models. Cognizant’s AIA practice takes insights that are buried in data, and provides businesses a clear way to transform how they source, interpret and consume their information. Our clients need flexible data structures and a streamlined data architecture that quickly turns data resources into informative, meaningful intelligence. 


Job description:
 Specializes in working with large and complex data sets to evaluate, recommend, and support the implementation of business strategies. 

 Identifies and compiles data sets using a variety of tools to help predict, improve, and measure the success of key business-to-business outcomes 

 Wrangle data using SQL for analysis and delivery purposes. Locate and explain data assets and connect them across different platforms and formats. 

 Understand and document complex data flows for business user stories and enterprise level data solutions for problem statements set before them, create complex mappings and specifications from mapping requirements identified in user stories, profile and review complex mapping requirements and business scenarios to flush out mapping requirement, and perform more complex data analysis. 

 Prepare, create and execute complex scenario test plans and scripts using SQL, Python or scripting to test complex user stories. 
Applies working knowledge of their business domain for their assigned sub business process and business operations in order to provide appropriate data to inform business decisions. 

 Cognizant is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. Cognizant is committed to ensuring that all current and prospective associates are afforded equal opportunities and treatment and a work environment free of harassment. 

 Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service. 


Employee Status : Full Time Employee 

Shift : Day Job 

Travel : No 

Job Posting : Jul 07 2022 


About Cognizant Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: The College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario
Description:
The College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario (CPSO) is seeking a dynamic and professional Data Analyst. This role is ideal for an independent thinker with a problem solving mindset focused on enhancing data management processes with accuracy, efficiency, timeliness and professionalism.
 This position focuses on data systems management, analysis and reporting to identify issues and trends in support of operational improvement of the CPSO.
 Contract Position (18-months)
 Responsibilities
 Data Management, Reporting and Analysis

 Creation of automated operational reports related to key performance indicators and operational benchmarks.
 Building and maintenance of a user-friendly interface for the extraction and querying of operational data
 Develop strategies to generate and automate better reports
 Evaluates and verifies the accuracy, consistency and completeness of the data via a standardized auditing program
 Carries out detailed analysis of College-wide data to evaluate operational performance
 Use operational data to generate ideas related to improving the efficiency of processes
 Presents results of analyses to internal and external stakeholders, such as management, Medical Advisors, Council and Committees
 Respond to ad-hoc data queries from internal and external sources
 Design and develop expansions and modifications to data querying tools developed in Python and SQL, as necessary
 Develops and maintains standard operating procedures and detailed manuals outlining reporting requirements
 Audit the College’s Enterprise System to ensure consistency, accuracy and completeness of data
 Creation and maintenance of Power BI reports for operational data and key performance indicators

 Qualifications

 University degree in engineering, statistics or related field
 Master’s degree considered an asset
 2+ years of relevant work experience
 Knowledge of database management is required
 Proficient computer programming skills in SQL, Python
 Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and Visio, Power BI, SharePoint
 Demonstrated ability to be self-directed and contribute to a team environment
 Exceptional organizational and time management skills with meticulous attention to detail, ability to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities, and adherence to deadlines
 Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, with the public and the profession
 Flexibility is necessary as this position is constantly changing and growing
 Equity/diversity/inclusion training would be an asset

 Note: It is a fundamental requirement of employment with CPSO that employees reside in Ontario and can attend the College office as required. Must be able to provide proof of double vaccination.
 Please apply with cover letter and resume by July 13, 2022 at 5:00pm.
 The College is committed to hiring practices that support accessibility for people with disabilities, employment equity and diversity in the workplace. The College actively seeks to increase their diversity by welcoming applications from women, visible minorities, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. Applicants with a disability may request accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process by contacting the Human Resources Department.

Title: Data Analyst (Remote Canada)
Description:
Contentfly (YC W21) is building the content infrastructure that companies leverage to build, scale, and optimize their revenue engines. We're a fully remote and distributed team of high performers on a mission to help companies tell their stories. We're a Series A company backed by Khosla Ventures, YCombinator & other top-tier investors, we've grown to have an incredibly talented team of 50+ people and $8m in ARR in the last year and a half. With a world-class talent marketplace and a team that consistently raises the bar, we have an opportunity to build an all-in-one platform for exceptional content marketing.

 Reporting to the Head of Analytics, the Data Analyst is responsible for working across multiple teams to provide various reporting and insights to help guide decision making throughout the organization.
 You Are:

Data Driven, you love the problems data can solve and the story it can tell


A Self-Starter, you're skilled in your craft but eager to improve and find ways to keep optimizing


Detail Oriented, you have a high standard of data quality and integrity


Collaborative, you enjoy working with several cross functional teams on daily basis

Your Key Responsibilities:
 Here's what you'll be doing day to day…

Analysis/Reporting: Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely and accurate reports. Build key data sets to empower stakeholders to perform their own analysis. Develop dashboards, track metric progress and investigate changes.
Collaboration: Work across Product, Sales, Marketing and Success teams to define key metrics, monitor those metrics and propose next steps. Work with revenue ops to centralize data reporting. Advise engineering, product, and revenue teams on sound statistical practices
Continuous Improvement: scale the business by turning one-off analyses into automated processes via high-quality code. Manage various pipelines/automations.

Your Experience and Intangible Traits:
 The ideal candidate for the Data Analyst position will possess the following skills and competencies:

1- 2 years of hands-on experience in a Data Analysis function, ideally in a fast paced or startup environment
High proficiency with SQL and Python for data analysis.
High proficiency with Looker, Tableau, or a comparable BI tool.
Strong communication skills, ability to collaborate with non-technical users is essential.
Strong analytical skills; outstanding attention to detail gathering and analyzing data.


 Why you'll love working here:

Unlimited vacation/PTO + Stock Options
Fully remote and distributed teams
Full Health benefits
Paid Parental Leave
Free laptop and home office budget, we've also got your cellphone/internet covered too!
Ongoing training and education budgets
We'll fly you around the world multiple times a year to hang out with the team in interesting places

Like what you see and think you're a perfect fit? Apply today.
 Please be assured we'll treat any information you share with us with the utmost care, only use your information for recruitment purposes and will never sell it to other companies for marketing purposes. Please review our privacy policy for further information: https://help.contentfly.com/en/articles/4764042-privacy-policy
 Contentfly is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to creating a culture with a diversity of talented individuals who join, stay, and work in an environment that enables them to thrive. Contentfly is committed to providing accommodations. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CAREER OPPORTUNITY
Data Analyst (Full Time) – Toronto, ON
We are on the hunt for a data and analytical wizard. Reporting the Vice President of Sales, the data analyst will provide support and insight to the sales and programming teams. Using various analytical tools and dashboards, we look to provide our team with data-led insight to help develop initiatives, increase our online acquisition/retention, optimize our campaigns, and track client + station performance.
Evanov Communications is transitioning to enhance our technology portfolio and offerings by leveraging our digital audiences. The person in this role will be responsible for gathering various datasets from multiple platforms, collecting, and aggregating the data, track and report revenue, listeners and website metrics, and discover key data trends by channel.
THE TEAM – Join the family
- Evanov Communications is committed to being the best Canadian independent radio broadcaster and communications company that delivers exceptional results to its employees, listeners, clients, and community.
- We use our social platforms to connect clients with consumers by creating award winning productions, unique on air and online campaigns, and offer high quality programming to our audience. Our radio stations play the BEST music with stations catered to top 40, country, easy listening, multilingual and more!
- With daily content, innovative promotions, and growth within the digital space – Evanov Communications offers consumers 16 unique experiences as we work closely with our clients to help explore, elevate, and execute, one-of-a-kind campaigns.
- We are looking for an individual who possess the same core values that we believe in: teamwork, commitment, innovation, accountability, integrity, belonging, We LOVE people who LOVE music and pop trends.
THE CREATION – What you’ll do (includes but not limited to)
- Identify trends and validate information with data-led insight
- Translate data into actionable insights by performing analysis, making recommendations on improving strategy through data-driven decision making
- Acts as an expert for data best practices, aiding in the assessment of proposals and designs for alignment to our digital strategy
- Deliver timely campaigns and reports including segmentation, list requests, post campaign analyses and insights.
- Creation and management of ad hoc and scheduled reports for a variety of end users
- Perform quality control checks on data and work with external vendors to ensure data accuracy

Ensure data compliance with all provincial and federal legislation
Document data extraction procedures, identifying process enhancement and automation opportunities
Actively contribute to our overall digital strategy with campaign ideas

THE ENERGY – Bring your vibe
- 2+ years of experience in an analytical role
- Post-secondary degree in information management, computer science, or related field of study
- Experience using analytics tools and dashboards, such as Google Analytics, Google Ad Manager, LeanStream and others.
- Experience conducting marketing campaign segmentation and analysis
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail and ability to solve difficult problems in a timely manner
- Good interpersonal and communication skills
- Bilingual (English and French) would be considered an asset
THE PERKS – We value you
- Competitive Compensation Package including salary + benefits
- Paid time off – Paid holidays, Holiday break, Summer Fridays
- Merchandise, access to concerts + events
- Training with opportunities for growth and development
- Networking in the community and working as part of a team that trusts and wants to win together

Title: Data & Program Analyst (Contract - Up to 12 Months)
Company: The Corporation of the City of Brantford
Description:
Position Summary
Reporting to the Manager, Children's Services and Early Years, the Data and Program Analyst is responsible for data analysis, program evaluation, managing contracts, research projects and reporting to support service system planning decisions within the Community Programs and Social Development Commission. The position supports performance management and evaluation of contracted agencies and staff, as well as providing data packages and briefs that inform strategic directions for the Commission.The Data & Program Analyst will be responsible for the following:

Maintains a thorough knowledge of government policy, programs, and legislation relevant to all Human
Services program areas including Childcare, Housing and Ontario Works.
Maintains a high level of knowledge regarding barriers to self-sufficiency experienced by Ontario Works recipients, including health, mental health, addiction, cognitive impairment, and learning disabilities.
Develops and maintains cooperative, collaborative and strategic relationships with internal and external partners.
Collaborates with corporate staff and federal, provincial and regional colleagues.
Works with Manager, Policy and Procedure Coordinator, Learning and Development Coordinator and Customer to evaluate current reporting methods and tracking tools for key metrics to determine the effectiveness of the data analysis and impact to business outcomes.
Stays current with best practices/research related to data analysis and program evaluation.

Qualifications

Successful completion of a post-secondary degree in Social Sciences, Business Administration, Data Science Analytics or related field, with focus on research, analytical data collection, managing contracts and program evaluation.
Completion of a research-based post-graduate degree is preferred.
Up to three (3) years' experience in statistical data collection, analysis, research, database design and reporting, coupled with a demonstrated ability to conduct training.
Knowledge of Microsoft computer software applications and operating systems including a strong working ability in Excel, Access, Microsoft Word and Power Point.
Knowledge of the Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS) and GIS is an asset.
Knowledge of current practices and program evaluation in the areas of child care, early learning, income support, housing, community development and employment services is considered an asset.
Ability to analyze all requirements and provisions in contracts, including terms and conditions, to ensure compliance with all regulations and company policies and procedures and compliance with provincial and federal ministry guidelines.
Ability to work in a team-based setting and possess consensus building skills to effectively work with multi- disciplinary working groups and a variety of agency partners.
Superior analytical, communication, technological and program-solving abilities; ability to exercise a high level of independence, integrity and confidentiality.

Apply For This Job Online at: www.brantford.ca/careers 
Qualified candidates please attach one PDF formatted resume & cover letter.
Information gathered relative to this position will only be used for candidate selection.
We thank each applicant for taking the time and effort to submit your resume, however, only candidates to be interviewed will be contacted.
The City of Brantford is committed to diversity and inclusivity in our employment practices. We promote the independence, dignity, integration, and equality of opportunity with persons with disabilities by ensuring the accessibility of our facilities and services. Accommodations, including alternative formats, are available for all parts of the recruitment and selection process. For more information or to request an accommodation please contact the Human Resources Department at 519-759-4150.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $36.26-$45.32 per hour
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-07-14

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Data Management Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 Reporting to the Manager of New Accounts North America, this position plays a key role in developing and executing upon the Client Management Group’s overall strategy and goals within Capital Markets.
 As part of wider Client Management function, this role is primarily responsible for supporting the Global Sales and Trading businesses in the coordination of opening, closing & maintaining trading and settlement accounts across the various product processing systems within Capital Markets.
 Supporting our data governance and quality controls, as well as actively participating in business and regulatory initiatives that have a significant impact to the firm and our clients. The role is aimed at developing an operational management of data, focused on improving efficiencies, reducing costs whilst also minimizing risk.  Working collaboratively with CMG partners, BCS, Risk, IT and Front office businesses partners throughout the bank, to understand their requirements and relevant business processes in order to deliver change and ultimately improve client service.

 What will you do?

 Maintain client and account level data in Capital Markets front and back office systems.
 Manage requests from multiple business areas; understand end to end process and trade flows.
 Be consistent, accurate and efficient in setting up, amending, cancelling and managing settlement instructions in the Front and Back Office system
 Ensure that all accounts are cross referenced into the supporting CMG repositories
 Use appropriate tools and exception management processes to ensure data quality.
 Management of data attributes related to regulatory data initiatives
 Proactively escalate issues as they arise and coordinate with the leadership team to ensure that we are able to manage expectations.
 Engagement with CMG globally regarding initiatives that relate to account management
 Review of CDR to source system reconciliations – perform root cause analysis
 Review of exception queues - perform root cause analysis

 Relationship Management 

Work collaboratively with business partners, IT and CMG alike.
 Strive to proactively seek out efficiencies in processes.
 Proactively escalate issues as they arise and coordinate with the leadership team to ensure that we are able to manage expectations.
 Optimize Account Management processes in order to reduce cycle time, manual effort and improve both end user experiences and realize cost savings.
 Linking multiple Functions and processes to a common source of data, reducing operational costs associated with maintaining multiple data silos through a single integrated reference point for trade processing and reporting.
 Maintain documentation outlining data lineage pertaining to all account related reference data in order to support the expansion of operational capabilities across Capital Markets, aiding in the prioritization of process and system enhancements.

 Projects

 Work closely with CMG management and supporting teams, providing input on all initiatives impacting reference data applications and/or expansion of reference data consumption by downstream users in order to meet ongoing and evolving business, risk, and regulatory requirements.
 Support delivery of data remediation activities, finding innovative ways to both remediate and implement stronger data quality controls around data environments
 Develop and oversee data quality reporting and ensure senior management is informed of data quality issues and operational risks that are identified as impactful to downstream processes or the business operations.
 Maintain documentation outlining data lineage pertaining to all account related reference data in order to support the expansion of operational capabilities across Capital Markets, aiding in the prioritization of process and system enhancements.
 Act as a subject matter expert on CMG projects.


 What you need to succeed?

 Bachelor’s degree
 1 – 2 years of prior related experience.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills.
 Excellent team working capabilities.
 Ability to network and build strong relationships.
 Working knowledge of SSIs
 Ability to multi-task and quickly adapt to new processes
 Ability to be flexible, innovative, organized
 Firm understanding of how Capital Markets operates and familiarity with traditional Capital Markets product offerings.
 Previous experience of party data management in trading and settlement systems
 Experience of working in a data management function within an Investment Bank.
 Strong ability to prioritize under both normal and pressure situations
 MS Office - should be highly proficient, primarily in the use of Excel and Access

 Nice-to-have

 Working Knowledge of Sequel and SQL.
 Working knowledge of regulatory reporting


 What’s in it for you? 
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Flexible work/life balance options







































 Job Summary










































































 Address:




































 HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, Canada
