Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Jane is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst who will be responsible for delivering consistent, meaningful insights across the team. You will have strong experience with Looker and preferably experience in a fast-growing software company. You are excited about the opportunity to be responsible for analytics across multiple subject areas and looking forward to the prospect of mentoring junior analysts.
   




   Our small, collaborative team is responsible for delivering actionable insights across the entirety of Jane, so you are interested in championing a data informed culture across all areas of the business, from marketing to product and everything in between. You are passionate about transparency, accuracy, creating delightful experiences with data, and digging deep in to the "why." 
   We want every team at Jane to have the ability to make decisions inspired by data and you will have the opportunity to help make this happen from the ground up.
   




   Like with all positions at Jane, this position is a remote position, allowing you to work anywhere you want across Canada. Building a delighted team who can delight our customers is part of Jane’s DNA, so even though we’re not a strict 9 to 5 environment, we’re working hard to ensure that you also have a life outside of work. We pride ourselves on flexibility & autonomy, and when it comes to decision making, we take a decentralized approach ensuring that our teams' voices aren't just heard, but are acted upon. We're building something special at Jane, and we back that up with an employee stock option plan that ensures that everyone has a chance to share in Jane’s success.
  


 We really want the people who work at Jane to love being here, so it's important that we start off with a bit about what makes our company unique. Here are some specifics about what Jane is all about, and with these, hopefully, you have a better idea if this might be the kind of company you want to be part of.
  


 We’re a North Vancouver-born SaaS company with a distributed remote team across Canada, and our platform is modernizing the world of practice management software. We enable the likes of physiotherapists, mental health counsellors, chiropractors, and other allied health practitioners to run their practices in a digital-first way through features such as online booking, charting, scheduling, secure video, and billing along with an evolving library of features.
  


 Tens of thousands of healthcare practices globally are now running on Jane. In 2021, we processed over 73 million patient appointments, and our scheduling application alone handles more than 10 million API calls per day. Jane is now the number one choice for Allied Healthcare practitioners in Canada. We’re growing quicker in the US than we were here in Canada 3 years ago, and we’re now helping run clinics in 44 countries.
  


 We’re profitable, product-led, and growing organically to the point where 85% of our customer growth is either from customer referrals or word of mouth. Growth like this is unique, especially in the world of SaaS, and it doesn’t happen by chance. We have a brilliant team of over 250 employees who all do an amazing job of listening to our customers, building what they need, and providing industry-leading support.
  


 Last year alone we’ve grown our development team from 36 to 70, and the product team has doubled as a whole. 2022 is going to be a big year for Jane as we’re investing heavily into patient experience with our first patient-facing mobile app, enhancing our telehealth experience, building our own (J)analytics platform, working on global insurance integrations, and introducing new features like HIPAA compliant chat.
  


 Of course, it's not all about the numbers, but this puts into perspective the scale of Jane, from the thousands of practitioners whose lives are made easier each day to the millions of patients receiving treatment. If you’re the type of person excited by this growth, we’d love to speak with you.
  



What you’ll be doing…


 Own several areas of analysis including product and customer lifecycle while working directly with product managers, dev managers and senior leadership to encourage a data-informed culture
 Helping our team build out our new Looker instance, including supporting with documentation, onboarding, training and best practices
 Creating and improving existing metrics, models, dimensions and documentation through collaboration with the team and stakeholders across multiple subject areas
 Championing data-informed decision making, building trust with stakeholders across Jane, and developing policies to uphold our standards
 Testing hypotheses that drive product roadmap decisions by designing purpose-built experiments and performing statistical analysis
 Own analysis from concept to implementation, managing backlog and prioritization of incoming and existing work
 Proactively seek feedback and opportunities to improve our processes, engage stakeholders






To be successful in this role...


 Experience as a data analyst in a high-growth environment
 Familiarity with common SaaS metrics and experience defining, implementing and measuring them
 Experience with Looker development and as a Looker admin
 Desire to mentor other analysts and continue to flex and grow that muscle
 Excellent communication skills and empathy
 The ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical audiences
 Experience running a/b tests
 Proficient in excel, SQL, LookML, and possibly another programming language like Python or R
 Familiarity with ETL (extract, transform, load) concepts and tools
 An extremely detail-oriented mindset and commitment to accuracy






Bonus points


 Experience building out a new BI platform from the ground up
 Experience or an interest in administering Snowflake or Redshift databases






Benefits


 Extended healthcare from day one.
 Parental top-up.
 Participation in Jane’s employee stock option plan (JSOP).
 Investment in your career development & growth.
 $500 annual health spending account.
 Generous vacation policy along with your birthday off!
 Three annual Jane-cation days: additional days off.






   At Jane, we’re committed to fostering an environment that allows you to come to work as your truest self. We believe it’s important to actively recognize, embrace, and celebrate our differences in order to make Jane an inclusive, equitable, and diverse workplace.
   




   We want to build a team of people who make conversations rich with perspective and experience. We are committed to listening to every voice in order to learn and grow because doing this will allow us to meet the needs of the diverse community of helpers that Jane serves.
   




   We do not tolerate discrimination, prejudice, or oppressive isms of any kind. Employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, experience, and the needs of the Jane community. We encourage anyone who requires accommodation or adjustments throughout the interview process to let us know, and we will do our best to support you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Facility Location- Toronto
 Work Location -
 Posting Locations - Toronto (GTA)
 Department - Anaplan Solutions
 Job Function - Finance and Accounting
 Employee Type - Regular Employee FT Salaried
 Shift/Hours –



 About Us


 Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!
 Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

 We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love. We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

 Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.




 About This Opportunity


 We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our Finance team. This is a great opportunity to learn and develop your skills within the Anaplan ERP system and work toward becoming an Anaplan Certified Model Builder! Our aim to is give you hands on Anaplan implementation experience in developing, Planning, Budgeting and Forecasting solutions. Experienced Anaplan Model Builders are also very welcomed to apply!

 Some of the experience we are looking for:
     

Proficiency in designing and maintaining data hub mapping and conversions, system configuration and integration, calculations, models build, reporting
Modify existing models as part of a connected solution, optimization or to incorporate new functionality.






 Responsibilities




 Collect business requirements and current-state process mapping required to build a user story associated with a new or enhanced capability
Articulate design and documentation for Anaplan models (process map, user guide, solution design document)
Translate business requirements in the form of excel models and/or user stories into efficient and scalable high-functioning Anaplan models.
Support the creation of test scripts and lead the User Acceptance Testing process.
Troubleshoot model bugs, and continuously enhance and support existing models.
Optimize calculation models and business logic.






 Qualifications



1- 3 years in data analysis and model building
Anaplan L2 L3 Model Builder Certification (L3 is a plus) is nice to have but not mandatory however, willingness to learn and achieve certification is required
Strong knowledge around financial systems and processes
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to develop and communicate new ideas and conceptualize innovative approaches and solutions
Knowledgeable of full range of solution catalog
Knowledge in supporting operational stability through various life cycle phases (planning, implementation, steady state)





 Important


 All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.
 Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.



 For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 
As a member of the GWAM Data Engineering team within the Global Wealth and Asset Management division, the Senior Data Analyst role is responsible for working with the Data Management and Delivery team, as well as other project teams, to ensure the data components of solutions provide the appropriate value to the business users, and are aligned with the organization’s Information Management Program: 

Responsibilities for this role include: 

Deliver flexible, reusable and well-maintained core data repositories 
Use accelerated delivery methodologies to ensure data initiatives provide timely business value 
Develop and maintain expertise in the Investment domain, as well as expertise in accessing, querying, testing and validating data content to drive quality and consistency within solutions 
Partner with the Data Governance group to establish appropriate standards and methodologies, template and tools related to documenting, analyzing and testing data - work with management to implement these standards within the IS and Data Governance organizations 
Developing templates and methodologies to ensure data requirements are accurately and completely captured and can be effectively communicated to other data stakeholders, including Business Users, Business Architects, Business Analysts, Solutions Architects, Solutions Developers, Quality Assurance Analysts, Data Governance and Data Management Staff 
Ensuring the proposed technical solutions effectively meet the business need 
Conducting data profiling to analyze quality of incoming data and advising on any data cleansing rules 
Assisting in the creation of business glossaries (data dictionaries) 
Collaborating with the QA group to develop methods to test data components 
Evaluating existing and proposed data models and how to best access and query them 
Evaluating existing and proposed data interfaces and how to clearly document them, including specification of data flow models, data flow timing, source-to-target mapping, and data transformation rules including data validations and controls 
Keeping current on evolving Investment business knowledge domains to accurately assess the quality of the data 
Providing guidance to project teams via peer reviews 

 Qualifications: 


5-10 years related experience in working with Investment domain data and Data Management solutions 
Experience with data-centric projects delivering the following (within a capital markets or investment banking domain): Master data management, Data integration, Data warehousing and reporting. Big Data environment for analytics 
Significant experience in major trading platforms, book of record systems, performance management platforms, such as Bloomberg Polar Lake, SimCorp Dimension, Findur, Apex, Eagle, Charles River, Sylvan, Calypso 
Experience delivering data documentation artifacts in organizations of similar size and complexity within project deadlines 
Experienced writing complex SQL queries to analyze data and provide results to business users or project team members 
Able to communicate clearly, both verbally and in written form at various levels within the project teams 
Strong work ethic, results oriented, and accuracy / attention to detail are critical 
Demonstrated initiative, able to work both independently and as a team member 
Able to clearly communicate complex methodologies and approaches to stakeholders, peers and management 
Able to work in agile or scrum delivery environments 
Good understanding of techniques and tools pertaining to the planning, analysis, design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance of technology solutions 
Some Exposure to Azure 


What about Perks? 
Manulife has lots of perks including, but not limited to: 

Competitive compensation 
Retirement Savings Accounts including a RPP (Pension Plan), RRSP (Retirement Savings Plan), and TFSA (Tax Free Savings account) 
Manulife Share Ownership Program with employer matching 
Customizable Benefits Package including Health, Dental, Vision, and 100% of Mental Health expenses 
Financial support for ongoing training, learning, and education 
Monthly Innovation Days (Hackathons) 
Wearing jeans to work every day 
An abundance of career paths and opportunities to advance 

This is a full-time permanent role located in Toronto, Ontario. 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 

About Manulife 
Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2017, we had approximately 34,000 employees, 73,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 26 million customers. As of December 31, 2017, we had over $1.04 trillion (US$829.4 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.7 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong 

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com . 

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

Title: Business Data Analyst
System Analyst Data and Reporting - Education Centre - 35hr, 12 months/year
Company: Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board
Description:
System Analyst - Data and Reporting 


Start Date: TBD 


Salary: $66,410 - $77,255 

 12 months/year, 35 hours/week 

 Non-Union position 

 We offer eligible employees a comprehensive employee pension (OMERS) and benefit package upon start date, a commitment to ongoing learning, and an exceptional work environment. 

 The Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board (KPR) offers a world-class education for approximately 34,000 students in 87 schools. Spanning over 7,000 square kilometers, across diverse rural and urban communities in southeastern Ontario, KPR serves the Municipality of Clarington, Northumberland and Peterborough Counties, and City of Quinte West/Murray Ward. 

 The Board is situated on the traditional territory of the Michi Saagiig Anishinaabeg people, serving three vibrant First Nation communities which include Alderville First Nation, Curve Lake First Nation and Hiawatha First Nation. Today, this gathering place is home to many First Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples and we acknowledge the contributions and accomplishments of all Indigenous people across Turtle Island, current and through history. 

 All positions in the Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board support the school’s priority of student achievement and the Boards mission to educate our students to excel in learning, to succeed in life and to enrich our communities. 

 Employees demonstrate empathy and respect in all interactions, are committed to service excellence, and embrace change through innovation. 

 As part of our strategy to provide on-going support for our schools, the Board is now accepting resumes from qualified applicants for the full-time position of System Analyst – Data and Reporting. 

 The purpose of the Systems Analyst - Data and Reporting position is to design, maintain, support and troubleshoot issues with reporting services. This will include collaborating with stakeholders to ensure their data requirements are being met, and collaborating with Information and Communication Technology (ICT) staff to ensure the systems we have provide the data required. 

 This position requires the highest degree of confidentiality and discretion as the duties involved working directly with various stakeholders and information, both internal and external to the Board, regarding highly sensitive and personal matters 


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Work directly with Senior Administration, the Analyst will be developing dashboards to support the assessment and monitoring of the Boards Multi-Year Strategic Plan (MYSP) and the Board Action Plan (BAP). 

 Work with all departments and the data requirement steering committee to determine the data requirements to improve processes within all areas of the board. 

 Create reports/dashboards within Power BI to efficiently provide the data required. 

 Transition various data sources into a supported/standardized system, to allow required reporting. 

 Lead the design of data, application and technology elements to support school administrative requirements. 

 Provide technical guidance and leadership in the development of school and business applications and respective technology, monitoring the data involved and advise improvements on data captured by the applications. 

 Assures compliance with requirements relating to privacy and information protection; 

 Leads business improvement initiatives and designs process improvements cooperatively with administrative departments through electronic forms and life cycle work flows; trains others to design electronic forms; creates end-to-end forms solutions from initiation to final record disposition and works with system analysts and data modeler to develop solutions 

 Participate on provincial committees to look at common applications delivered through the Educational Computing Network of Ontario (ECNO), ensuring alignment with Ministry and board objectives; and maintain a role on the product advisory committees provincially for business applications. 

 Other duties as assigned. 


SUPERVISION:

Direct supervision of:
 Technical Services Specialist 


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
 Post-secondary degree or certificate (i.e. university, college or technical training) completed in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Computer Security, Wireless Information Networking or equivalent. 

 Minimum three years of related experience working in a progressive environment (public sector experience is preferred). 

 Experience using a variety of data/reporting systems (eg. SQL, Power BI, SSRS, Crystal Reports). 


SPECIALIZED SKILLS REQUIRED:
 Superior written, presentation and verbal skills 

 Strong SQL programming skills. 

 Knowledge of programming languages and analytic tools. 

 Experience in document management and electronic records management (schoolboard environment preferred). 

 A commitment to service excellence. 

 Contributes solutions to complex situations. 

 Effective coaching, mentoring, conflict resolution and relationship management skills 

 Valid driver’s license and use of own vehicle. 


WORKING CONDITIONS:
 Office building working environment. 

 Moderate amounts of concentration, attention to details, visual exertion, and keyboarding. 

 Frequent pressure to meet deadlines, interruptions and distractions. 

 Some after-duty calls. 

 Occasional overnight travel. 

 A police records check, with a Vulnerable Sector Search and Pardoned Sexual Offenders Database Search , dated within 6 months prior to the date of hire , is a requirement for employment with this Board. Please note that there have been reports that it has taken some candidates up to 6 weeks to obtain a police check. With that in mind, we strongly recommend that you go about obtaining this search at your earliest convenience. 

 KPRDSB is committed to a qualified workforce that is representative of the diversity of the people of Ontario and across the communities we serve. We welcome applications from candidates with diverse background and lived experiences as a member of a marginalized group, including but not limited to: 

 First Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples, and all other Indigenous peoples; 

 members of groups that commonly experience discrimination due to race, ancestry, colour, religion and/or spiritual beliefs, or place of origin; 

 persons with visible and/or invisible (physical and/or mental) disabilities; 

 persons who identify as women; and 

 persons of marginalized sexual orientations, gender identities, and gender expressions. 

 KPRDSB is committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. 

 Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics & Business Insights, the analyst will be responsible for interpreting data into consumable business insights and providing recommendations to the business. They will perform advanced reporting/business analysis and upgrading/migrating reporting to new and more efficient technologies. They will be responsible for the regular running, verifying and delivery of standard reporting, as well as being the primary provider of analytical information to members of senior management. They will work with all areas of the business to provide analysis and present recommendations to assist with new initiatives, day to day business, or to solve pressing business problems. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do 

Support the business with an analytical service offering. 
Perform data analysis to support ad-hoc requests. 
Resolve data issues and report inconsistencies. 
Convert data into business insights and recommendations. 
Use data visualization techniques where possible for quicker insight & improved user experience. 
Create unified datasets to support business needs by connecting and transforming data from different sources. 
Design data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights. 
Create and maintain dashboards and interactive visual reports using Power BI. 
Support of any departmental teams with analysis and consultation for their new initiatives, day to day business and problem solving. 
Continuously improve and upgrade current reporting/process quality by developing and identifying enhancements and migrating/developing reports using the most appropriate technology available. 
Continuously improve and upgrade on the team’s internal processes, including documentation of code and operating procedures, ease of storing/retrieving/sharing knowledge, identifying and eliminating waste, etc. 

What you bring 

2+ years of experience with visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, ThoughtSpot. 
2+ years of experience in SQL, Power Query, Knime, Synapse or other similar data modeling tools. 
2+ years of experience in A/B testing or hypothesis testing with the primary focus to provide decision support, project validation and data insights into key business metrics. 
Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud platform would an asset. 
Ability to translate technical processes into business language. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Understanding how to best leverage data to improve business process. 
Ability to formulate or quickly understand business problems, find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data. 
Ability to clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences. 
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources. 
Have a good eye for and an understanding of visual report design principles. 
Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines. 
Self-starter attitude with willingness to learn and master new technologies. 
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment. 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
#LI-TK1 


  Mark's - Corporate 
 

  Alberta-Calgary 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Pricing Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity? Shared Services - Data Service Delivery (DSD) provides security Masterfile as well as pricing data to RBC Investor & Treasury Services (I&TS) core business systems globally. The activity is covered on a 24/5 basis through a Follow The Sun model with a presence in Asia, Europe, and North America. In this role, responsible for global price delivery for North America, Continental European, and Asian clients (Global pricing model) and developing the center of excellence, CPS in Canada. You will support America’s offshore model through CPS and take on a critical role in assisting and facilitating the Target Operating Model (TOM) for DSD Canada. In addition, you will be accountable for the quality of the services delivered, as well as promote quality client service with client-focus and client-first mentality

 What will you do?

 Provide a high level of service by responding to all client inquiries within a reasonable timeframe in order to maintain the company’s image and strengthen client retention
 Ensure that all securities are priced at month-end in order to produce complete and accurate client statements from custody platforms
 Responsible for verifying and confirming with pricing suppliers and other pricing sources all pricing data not meeting the required tolerance levels of the entire database
 Establish communication networks with all business units for the receipt of pricing data
 Ensure existing procedures are followed and kept informed on all policies and compliance issues
 Responsible for analyzing and approving all reports generated for all pricing activities from a centralized database as well as individual custody platforms
 Research, review, and analyze alternate sources other than the existing pricing suppliers for price data on non-exchange and thinly traded securities residing on the database
 Ensure that all new securities and all inactive securities are transmitted successfully to the Pricing Systems in order for the pricing suppliers to initiate or deactivate a price feed for the said securities


 What do you need to succeed? Must-have

 University degree/College Diploma, preferably in Business or Finance
 Strong knowledge of markets and securities
 Knowledge of compliance and industry requirements
 Understanding of domestic and global investment markets
 Excellent organizational skills
 Strong written and verbal communication skills
 Client-focused
 Good operational skills


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate
 Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
 Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
 Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
 Excellent career development and progression opportunities
 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
 Competitive compensation







































 Job Summary










































































 Address:




































 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
 




































 City:




































 CAN-ON-TORONTO
 




































 Country:




































 Canada

 Full time

 Investor and Treasury Services

 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities. Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Pricing Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity? Shared Services - Data Service Delivery (DSD) provides security Masterfile as well as pricing data to RBC Investor & Treasury Services (I&TS) core business systems globally. The activity is covered on a 24/5 basis through a Follow The Sun model with a presence in Asia, Europe, and North America. In this role, responsible for global price delivery for North America, Continental European, and Asian clients (Global pricing model) and developing the center of excellence, CPS in Canada. You will support America’s offshore model through CPS and take on a critical role in assisting and facilitating the Target Operating Model (TOM) for DSD Canada. In addition, you will be accountable for the quality of the services delivered, as well as promote quality client service with client-focus and client-first mentality

 What will you do?

 Provide a high level of service by responding to all client inquiries within a reasonable timeframe in order to maintain the company’s image and strengthen client retention
 Ensure that all securities are priced at month-end in order to produce complete and accurate client statements from custody platforms
 Responsible for verifying and confirming with pricing suppliers and other pricing sources all pricing data not meeting the required tolerance levels of the entire database
 Establish communication networks with all business units for the receipt of pricing data
 Ensure existing procedures are followed and kept informed on all policies and compliance issues
 Responsible for analyzing and approving all reports generated for all pricing activities from a centralized database as well as individual custody platforms
 Research, review, and analyze alternate sources other than the existing pricing suppliers for price data on non-exchange and thinly traded securities residing on the database
 Ensure that all new securities and all inactive securities are transmitted successfully to the Pricing Systems in order for the pricing suppliers to initiate or deactivate a price feed for the said securities


 What do you need to succeed? Must-have

 University degree/College Diploma, preferably in Business or Finance
 Strong knowledge of markets and securities
 Knowledge of compliance and industry requirements
 Understanding of domestic and global investment markets
 Excellent organizational skills
 Strong written and verbal communication skills
 Client-focused
 Good operational skills


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate
 Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
 Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
 Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
 Excellent career development and progression opportunities
 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
 Competitive compensation

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview: 
 
 Who are we?



 Vubiquity, an Amdocs company (NASDAQ: DOX), 
is a global media and entertainment technologies, products, and services provider. 
Vubiquity provides established expertise and innovation across the whole media supply chain from content processing and distribution; direct-to-consumer streaming and monetization; through to systems integration and professional services. 
With an extensive range of core competencies that can
 be rapidly and flexibly deployed, the world’s leading content owners and service providers trust Vubiquity to power their consumer-facing, entertainment experiences.



 Overview:



 A data analytics professional which serves as a focal point for data queries, reporting and insight, providing data analysis and drawing insights on different aspects, based on his/her domain of expertise.
 

   The ideal candidate works well in a team and is responsible for internal and customer facing outputs for multiple stakeholders within the business.
 

 Responsibilities: 
 
 Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):





 Data focal point for any data query, reporting and insight.
 Provide data analysis on different aspects, based on his/her domain of expertise.
 Extract major insights and conclusions from data analysis, build models and identify trends.
 Perform end-to-end operation checks and validation.
 Provide relevant stakeholders with main takeaways and recommendation and support decision making.
 Power BI Report development for both customer-facing and internal stakeholders.
 Building Analysis Services reporting models.
 Developing visual reports, KPI scorecards, and dashboards using Power BI desktop.
 Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business intelligence.
 Responsible for design methodology and project documentation.


 Qualifications: 
 
 Skills


 Analytical thinking for translating data into informative reports and visuals.
 Very good communication skills must be able to discuss the requirements effectively with the client teams, and with internal teams.
 Making DAX queries, advanced-level calculations, and visualizations in Power BI desktop.
 Able to develop tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with data warehouse standards.
 Capable of implementing row-level security on data along with an understanding of application security layer models in Power BI.



 Experience


 Experience with BI tools and systems such as Power BI, Tableau, and SAP.
 Excellence Standards
 Results & Customer Value
 Professional Capabilities
 Teamwork & Collaboration
 Learning & Versatility
 Change & Agility
 Engagement & Positive Attitude



 DISCLAIMER:
 

   The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.
 


 Why You Will Love This Job


 We are a company built on positive relationships and collaboration, and you will have the opportunity to build strong business relationships.
 You will manage multiple business relationships and collaborate with people from both corporate and field.
 This is an opportunity to work independently, in a fast-paced environment, and lead projects.



 Vubiquity, an Amdocs Company, is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Title: Product Content Analyst
Description:
The Product Content Analyst plays a pivotal role in research, data analysis & data entry and execution of new travel suppliers for sale wherever the Porter package product is displayed. This individual should possess strong product knowledge and understand the systems (TTS and dynamic connectivity, API) that Porter package product utilizes to leverage product positioning on the website to maximize conversion. The ability to create relationships with vendors, suppliers is an asset. Highly analytical and attentive to detail are key skill sets required for the data entry responsibilities of this role. Organized and able to multi-task, escalating any roadblocks or issues. The role takes on the task of product review and implementation, support and enhancement while following TICO regulation guidelines. This individual will need to be fully proficient in all product operations functions for dynamic property connections and static contracts using the systems and platform where the Porter package product is housed.


 DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


Plan the integration and operational support of new suppliers alongside the Director of Porter package product
Ensure all product components and pricing are fed through the Application Program Interface API from the businses partners
Verification of the accuracy in costs, sale prices, promotions, inventory, system coding, commission structure(s), supplier information, and all other pertinent data and/or changes for the effective sale of all product
Creation of the web pages linked to each product in RCM. (dashboard to display static content and images)
Review inventory levels and communicate with suppliers where additional inventory is needed
Ongoing competitive analysis to ensure we are maximizing conversion
Follow up with suppliers on extended releases, product updates, and contract extensions to ensure all product data is available, up to date and accurate on TTS and the website
Review tableau reports to ensure accuracy and use reports for measurement of number of properties connected, forecasting and noting booking trends and pace to suggest any modification that will increase conversion and improve customer experience
Responsible for assisting other team members with the day to day product testing in order to keep skills sharp and able to resolve loading issues quickly
Build hotel shells in TTS
Troubleshoot issues related to connectivity and all suppliers as it pertains to pricing
Actively participate in Porter's Safety Management System (SMS) including, reporting hazards and incidents encountered in daily opertations; understand, comply and promote the Company's safety policy.


BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES:

Concern for Safety: Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others
Teamwork: Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals
Passenger/Customer Service: Providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers)
Initiative: Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise
Results Focus: Focusing efforts on achieving high quality results consistent with the organization’s standards
Fostering Communication: Listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus



QUALIFICATIONS:

University Graduate 
Bilingual English/French and asset 
Experience in an analytical role
Excellent computer skills
Must have the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks concurrently in a fast paced environment
Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

 Job Description:
 Do you have a passion for data? Do you like analyzing numbers to provide meaningful insights? Do you like making an impact on the business around you? A role as Data Analyst at Sun Life Financial might be right for you!

 We are looking for a Data Analyst in the Business Intelligence team. The Data Analyst will support the development of new reports/tools, recurring report generation, analysis of key results, and ad hoc investigation for the Client Engagement teams, providing actionable insights to drive the business forward.

 The incumbent will also provide project support, acting as an advocate for data issues as well as representing the business needs for our stakeholders. The Business Intelligence team comprises of business data analysts at various levels of increasing responsibility and scope, providing a great career path for the right candidate

 What will you do:

 Work closely with business stakeholders to transform complex business problems into addressable analytical questions and queries
 Operationalize reporting processes and synthesize key metrics into impactful and insightful dashboards to monitor and assess the success of the business initiatives
 Ensure the accurate and timely completion of all baseline reporting, ad-hoc requests and project initiatives.
 Prioritize projects on a monthly basis and align with leaders of the business team
 Stay abreast of Client Engagement processes and results, raising emerging trends and continuous improvement ideas to Management
 Enable leaders to make timely data-driven product, market-development, and distribution decisions.


 What do you need to succeed?

 3+ years’ experience in a Data Analyst or Performance Analyst role
 Advanced SAS Enterprise Guide or SQL Server/ MySQL
 Advanced experience with visual analytics tools e.g. Tableau
 Advanced Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, Visual Basic
 Experience/exposure to Big Data tools (i.e. Hive, Python)
 Customer and results focused, with an ability to work with stakeholders to understand and act based on their needs, assess risks, and achieve a valued result
 Comfortable with ambiguity and able to operate in a matrix environment with complex tasks
 Proven problem solving skills with the ability to break down high-level data into easily communicated information
 In-depth prioritization, planning, and change management skills to stay within time/scope of a task in a fast-paced environment
 Comfortable learning new applications and processes quickly with minimal direction
 Proven client orientation, strong interpersonal skills
 Undergraduate in Business, Statistics, Computer Science (or equivalent university degree or college diploma)
 Experience in assessing marketing campaigns in various channels (establishing control, measuring ROI)
 Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)


 What's in it for you?

 Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US. 
Named 2021 “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor 
Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021 
Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer. 
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security 
Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives 
A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture 
Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience. 
#LI-Remote


 The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

 Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

 Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

 At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

 Sun Life is committed to the health and safety of all those in our workplaces and our communities. In accordance with Sun Life’s Vaccination Policy (Canada):

 Employees permitted to work remotely are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location where activity related to Sun Life business occurs.
 Employees whose job duties require them to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location for Sun Life business must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective May 1st.
 Employees whose regular workplace is a Financial Centre and SLFD field leaders must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or participate in Sun Life’s Rapid Screening Program to attend a Financial Centre or an offsite event.


 We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst, Recruiting Data Solutions | Analyste de données, solutions des données de recrutement
Description:
Meta’s People Data Solutions team is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to provide technical solutions for the People and Recruiting Analytics data ecosystems. You’ll be developing data products such as statistical models and forecasts, complex queries and Tableau dashboards. You will also play a consultative role in which you will guide partners and stakeholders in defining metrics and interpreting data visualizations and results of analysis. You will also be responsible for upkeep and maintenance which may require deep dive analysis to validate data quality and integrity and accuracy of data solutions. To be successful in this role, you'll have a passion for data, the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently, and enjoy a fast-moving organization. You’ll identify ways to tell a compelling story with data and strong design principles. You will thrive within cross-functional teams, excel at building and managing relationships with internal partners and stakeholders, and exhibit excellent organizational and presentation skills. Creativity, optimism, and out-of-the-box thinking are most welcome.-------L'équipe de solutions de données sur les personnes de Meta recherche un(e) analyste de données expérimenté(e) pour fournir des solutions techniques aux écosystèmes de données d'analyse des personnes et des recrutements. Vous développerez des produits de données tels que des modèles et prévisions statistiques, des requêtes complexes et des tableaux de bord Tableau. Vous jouerez également un rôle consultatif dans lequel vous guiderez les partenaires et les parties prenantes afin de définir des paramètres et d'interpréter les visualisations de données et les résultats d'analyse. Vous serez responsable de l'entretien et de la maintenance, lesquels peuvent impliquer des analyses approfondies pour valider la qualité et l'intégrité des données et l'exactitude des solutions de données. Pour mener à bien cette mission, vous devez être passionné(e) par les données, pouvoir gérer plusieurs projets simultanément et vous sentir à l'aise dans une organisation qui évolue rapidement. Vous identifierez les moyens de présenter une histoire convaincante à l'aide des données et de solides principes de conception. La créativité, l'optimisme et les idées novatrices sont particulièrement appréciés.

Build rich and dynamic dashboards using out-of-the-box features, customizations, and visualizations using Tableau and SQL | Élaborer des tableaux de bord sophistiqués et dynamiques au moyen de fonctionnalités prêtes à l'emploi, de personnalisations et de visualisations à l'aide de Tableau et de SQL

 Leverage tools, such as SQL, Tableau, Workday, Visier, and Excel to drive analytics and enable client self-service on routine queries | Exploiter les outils, tels que SQL, Tableau, Workday, Visier et Excel, pour générer des analyses et permettre aux clients d'effectuer des requêtes de routine en libre-service
 Act as an internal consultant by understanding business needs, scoping data requests, synthesizing insights, and recommending solutions to key business partners | Agir en tant que consultant interne en comprenant les besoins commerciaux, en délimitant les demandes de données, en synthétisant les informations et en recommandant des solutions aux partenaires commerciaux clés
 Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and help inform, influence, support, and execute our business decisions | Mettre en œuvre l'expertise en matière d'analyse quantitative et de présentation des données afin de voir au-delà des chiffres et de contribuer à informer, influencer, soutenir et exécuter nos décisions opérationnelles

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Data Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 The Client Data Services team (CDS) is responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the static reference data for Capital Markets clients, counterparties, and other entities of interest. This data includes names, addresses, identifiers, classifications, hierarchies, and other attributes that are required for business and operational processes, regulatory monitoring and reporting, revenue reporting and client analytics, and Risk and Finance purposes. CDS maintains this information in the Client Data Repository (CDR) system, which acts as a central repository for master client records that are linked to accounts in trading and settlement systems, eliminating the operational overhead of needing multiple teams manage this information across multiple systems, ensuring consistency of this information across all consuming areas, and enabling the aggregation of client activity across different lines of business.
 As a Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the data in CDR by leveraging advanced analytics techniques, and for providing insight into CDR client data through reporting and analytics.

 what will you do?

 Support complex data query requests to provide insight into the coverage and nature of client reference data
 Be responsible for large scale multi-way comparisons of CDR data against various internal and external sources to identify trends and to measure overall data quality
 Develop and implement reporting and data visualization dashboards to articulate trends and data quality measurements
 Develop monitoring to proactively identify data quality gaps
 Assess data requirements of new consumers and project initiatives to determine where CDR’s data is fit for purpose, and where gaps exist
 Support the root cause analysis of data issues relating to client data, and perform complex remediation requiring advanced pattern recognition and machine learning
 Identify and coordinate system and process enhancements and improvements


 What you need to succeed?

 Completion of an applicable university degree and/or relevant professional designation.
 A minimum of two years of experience in Python, R and or other programming languages.
 Advanced Excel Skills
   
 Analyze large data sets using pivot tables and pivot reporting
 Ability to write and create advanced formulas using VLOOKUP, Arrays, Index and Match functions; debug and audit
 Build macros using VBA (Visual Basic for Applications)
 Ability to structure and present data for reporting using conditional formatting, tables and charting

 Intermediate SQL skills
   
 Understanding and usage of SQL keywords, data types, constraints, pivots, sub queries, logical and comparison operators, and advanced joins (inner, outer) and unions
 Understanding and usage of update and insertion statements and syntax for altering and creating structures
 Can generate complex data reports using GROUP BY and aggregate functions
 Understands SQL concepts of foreign keys, transactions, triggers, and stored procedures

 Excellent communication skills – written and oral
 Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills

 Nice-to-have

 Degree in Computer Science


 What’s in it for you? 
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Flexible work/life balance options

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Oppy
Grow Our Tomorrow. Oppy is a leading grower, marketer and distributor of fresh produce from around the world. As one of North America’s top produce companies for nearly 165 years, we bring over 100 varieties of produce from 27 countries to 1,300+ retailers in North America and throughout the world. As much as agriculture has shaped the past for humankind, Oppy’s efforts shape its future by sustainably providing families with healthy, safe and fresh produce to create a better quality of life for all. Our progressive team is called to a higher purpose that raises the economic wellbeing of families and communities who work the land.
Recognized as one Canada’s Best Managed Companies (for the last 20 years!) and a Top 100 Employer, our diverse team of dedicated professionals collaborate and make connections across our locations throughout North and South America. We owe our success to our adaptability, innovative and entrepreneurial approach, our commitment to our people, and the incredible relationships we build. We are looking for talented people who love a fast-paced, dynamic environment where you can grow your skills and career in a sector with abundant opportunity. Grow your tomorrow with us, today.
The Opportunity
We are looking for a motivated individual with a keen attention to detail and an interest in learning about an exciting and dynamic industry. Dive deep into the data that drives our business and provide insights to decision makers to propel results. Join a global team that is passionate about what they do in an industry that offers diverse opportunities.
If you enjoy a challenge and would love to contribute your sharp analytical and organizational skills to a dedicated and dynamic team, this is the opportunity for you!
What You Will Be Doing
The Marketing Data Analyst produces market-focused reports and analysis for assigned categories in order to enable sound business management and decision making, providing commercially focused recommendations to internal and external stakeholders. Reporting to the Insights Lead, the Marketing Data Analyst liaises with category leaders and other departments to develop appropriate analytics and presentation materials that provide insight and foster constructive dialogue.
You will: 

Complete timely analyses for sales, business development, category and marketing teams using such diverse data resources as: Nielsen, IRI, USDA, Stats Canada, 84.51 (Kroger), Google Analytics and others
Participate in pre-season planning and post-season reviews with in-depth analyses for assigned categories.
Uncover opportunities for business growth at retail by analyzing product performance, including velocity, pricing and the impact of promotions.
Closely track the changes in the wider industry and trade conditions so the teams stay well-informed – e.g. imports and exports, demand, growth, etc. of the products in Oppy’s current portfolio as well as those of interest.
Periodically design and conduct consumer research via external platforms.
Produces charts, reports and dashboards to ensure that the teams have continuous access to market insights.
Format analyses into power point slides in a concise, easily interpreted manner for those who present the data, including key takeaways and fact-based suggestions for internal and external stakeholders.
Conduct other ad hoc business analyses as assigned.
Promote a customer-focused, collaborative culture in alignment with the company’s core values.

Who You Are

Results-Focused. You have passion and desire to make a difference and tenacity to dig in, figure it out and keep trying until you get results.
Proactive. Not one to sit and wait, you proactively and systematically work to improve your skills and learn the business. Resourcefulness and tenacity are in your DNA.


Impactful. You have passion and the confidence to be an extraordinary networker and will keep trying until you get results. You have a way with words, relish the opportunity to pitch something to an audience and never shy away from the difficult conversations.
Schooled. Your degree or diploma in marketing will give you a foundation to build your experience. If you have retail or agri-business experience, that rocks too!
Experienced. You ideally have 1 – 2 years experience in retail marketing/sales-focused analytics and presentations; previous produce-related experience considered an asset.


A Team Player. You have been recognized as a go-to person; bridging and building positive relationships with a diverse range of people and experience levels.


Resilient. You remain positive and poised in all situations, you understand that the world is a dynamic place. Multi-tasking comes naturally and you find keeping busy invigorating. Overcoming obstacles is your forte.


Incredibly Organized. You can work independently, make appropriate decisions and liaise with numerous parties, leaving them impressed with your follow up and attention to detail.

Why Work for Oppy?

We are an established leader in the fresh produce industry, continuously working to improve, innovate and disrupt the norm. Oppy is a place where you are encouraged to contribute and can have a meaningful impact.
We have a strong culture with terrific people that care about the business and each other. We want our people to grow and succeed.
We offer a hybrid work model with a mix of in-office and at-home.
A competitive total compensation package that includes a full benefits package, lifestyle spending account, and more!

We extend our sincere appreciation for your interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Database Analyst
Research Data Analyst
Description:
Date Posted: 07/11/2022 Req ID: 24123 Faculty/Division: Faculty of Nursing Department: Lawrence S. Bloomberg Faculty of Nursing Campus: St. George (Downtown Toronto) Position Number: 00038270

 Description:
 About us:  The University of Toronto’s Lawrence S. Bloomberg Faculty of Nursing ranks among the premier nursing programs in the world and is a global leader in ground-breaking research and education.  Your opportunity:  The Research Data Analyst works as part of a team in the Research Office at the Lawrence S. Bloomberg Faculty of Nursing reporting to the Associate Dean Research. Responsibilities include: developing overall project design and research project protocols, participating in research project planning meetings, planning and coordinating data collection, managing administrative and survey data, conducting complex analyses in order to support the research initiatives of various Faculty members’ research projects, conducting critical appraisal of research literature, writing research summaries for reporting, writing grant proposals and manuscripts, ensuring study records are maintained, filed and stored appropriately, and providing input into overall Faculty research project goals. Other duties include providing methodological and analytic support to Principal Investigators, Co-Investigators, PhD Students and other team members in completion of their roles and providing work direction to Research Officers and/or other research assistant(s).  Your responsibilities will include:


 Developing overall project design
 Developing research project protocols
 Determining qualitative and/or quantitative research methods according toresearch objectives
 Overseeing the data collection and analysis processes
 Producing complex statistical information
 Analyzing results and preparing statistical reports for research papers
 Writing research summaries for reporting purposes
 Analyzing detailed statistical information to inform project direction


 Essential Qualifications:


 Master’s Degree in health sciences (nursing, medicine, psychology, etc.), public health, statistics or social sciences is required
 Minimum four (4) years of experience in research methodology and statistics
 Experience with data manipulation (e.g., coding for data entry, recording of variable for complex data, merging data), research design, data collection, and statistical analysis of databases
 Experience supervising staff
 Demonstrated experience in project planning and design using considerable judgment, initiative, and innovativeness
 Demonstrated experience in the writing and preparation of quantitative and/or qualitative manuscripts, presentations, reports, briefs and scientific abstracts for peer-reviewed journals
 Extensive computer skills with MS Office, data management and analysis (SAS, SPSS, Excel, Access), and presentation packages (Power Point)
 Excellent analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills
 Excellent written and oralcommunication skills
 Impeccable attention-to-detail and deadlines and the ability to work under pressure
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team

 Assets (Nonessential):


 Knowledge of Canadian/provincial health service databases and/or population health survey data

 To be successful in this role you will be:


 Articulate
 Assertive
 Multi-tasker
 Organized
 Problem solver
 Self-directed


 Notes: Please note that this is a term position from the date of hire until July 10, 2023.

 Closing Date: 07/13/2022, 11:59PM ET Employee Group: USW Appointment Type: Budget - Term Schedule: Full-Time Pay Scale Group & Hiring Zone: USW Pay Band 16 - $91,328 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $116,794. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol. Job Category: Research Administration & Teaching Recruiter: Grace Joo
 Lived Experience Statement Candidates who are members of Indigenous, Black, racialized and 2SLGBTQ+ communities, person with disabilities, and other equity deserving groups are encourage to apply, and their lived experience shall be taken into consideration as applicable to the posted position.

Title: Data and Evaluation Analyst
Description:
Data and Evaluation Analyst
Position Reports to: Manager of Coaching & Evaluation
The Data and Evaluation Analyst works closely with QuitNow Managers on diverse tasks related to capturing, managing, and interpreting program data. The incumbent will analyze and interpret data to meet various program needs, e.g., refinement of the program’s performance monitoring and evaluation plan and to support strategic decision-making. The Data and Evaluation Analyst will also prepare reports and assist in the development of the program’s data governance strategy.
Responsibilities:

Routine reporting to QuitNow’s select systematic referrers
Extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes of QuitNow’s data holdings
Clean and document data from multiple sources; with harmonization
Execute requisite data collection and analysis relating to program evaluation
Present findings in various formats (e.g., narrative, tables and/or graphs)
Maintain databases and other archival data according to established protocols
Advise on and help execute data improvement strategies
Other duties as required

Education and Experience:

Undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline
At least 3 years of experience in the analysis and interpretation of health-related data ·
Demonstrated experience in data acquisition, documentation, and analysis ·
Demonstrated ability using software programs for data management, statistical analysis, and reporting/visualization (i.e., SPSS, R, SAS, Tableau) ·
Familiarity with data manipulation in spreadsheet and relational databases ·
Knowledge of program planning and evaluation an asset ·
Knowledge of tobacco and vaping an asset

Core Competencies:

Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Great verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work in a flexible, fast paced, changing environment

The BC Lung Foundation operates on a 4-day work week. Our office is open Monday-Thursday, 8am-5pm. We are currently working in a hybrid model of in-office and at-home days.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $60,000.00-$65,000.00 per year
Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:We continue to require masks to be worn in the common areas of our office. There is an expectation that all of our staff are up to date on their vaccinations.
