Title: Data Analyst II (Data Science/ML)
Description:
The mission of the Data Science team is to enhance Cvent’s products with AI and machine learning driven features, and to enable the company to make data-informed decisions at all levels. Cvent has a vast amount of data, and significant domain expertise, which we are using to design intelligent features that deliver value to our customers. We are on AWS, use Tableau as a reporting & dashboarding tool, and have recently started using Snowflake as an enterprise data warehouse.
 



   We are hiring a Data Analyst II to work on statistical analysis of data, creating dashboards, and building and maintaining documentation on data. You must be highly collaborative and used to taking initiatives: you will work with data scientists, software developers and product managers on a daily basis. You will be an integral part of a fast-growing team, strongly committed to impacting the company via industry-leading machine learning, data products and data analytics.
 



 What you will do:




Perform statistical analysis of data.
Design randomized controlled trials (A/B tests), and analyze results.
Build and maintain dashboards for the Data Science team, using Tableau, Amazon QuickSight, and possibly other tools.
Understand Cvent's data: for example, what data points are captured from a particular product line and how specific data tables were created.
Use this understanding of data to create and maintain data dictionaries relevant to the Data Science team.
Communicate relevant findings and results to the team.




 Basic qualifications:


A Bachelor's degree in statistics or another quantitative field.
At least 2 years of experience working as a data analyst in industry.
Proficiency working with relational (SQL) databases.
Proven skills in data visualization and dashboard creation.
Deep experience with Tableau.
Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests.
Critical thinking and strong problem-solving ability.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.




 Advanced qualifications:


Master's or higher degree in statistics or another quantitative field.
Proficiency in the Python language.
Experience with noSQL data stores.
Familiarity with AWS services, especially QuickSight as a dashboarding tool.
Familiarity with Snowflake.
Understanding of data modeling and data store management.
Conceptual understanding of machine learning.
Proven ability for proactive, independent work with minimal supervision.




   If you are a good fit for the role, please apply! Your resume should be no more than two pages in length.

Title: Application and Data Analyst
Description:
If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary . City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance, promote physical and psychological safety, and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits . Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.
           





           The City is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and equitable workplace which is representative of the community we serve. We welcome those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, inclusion, anti-racism and reconciliation. Applications are encouraged from members of groups that are historically disadvantaged and underrepresented. Accommodations are available during the hiring process, upon request. 
         










          As an Application and Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the coordination, maintenance, upgrades and life cycling of the technology underpinning the external data access of The City’s data and intellectual property. This is primarily achieved through managing the work section’s digital access portals, including City Online (cityonline.calgary.ca) and Open Data Portal (data.calgary.ca). You will be the liaison between business and internal user needs and technical resources in the IT support groups. This role is the technical subject matter expert for section stewarded system and interfaces with internal City staff to develop solutions related to products offered through the systems. Primary duties include:
         

Coordinate tasks related to managing the technology, software development life cycle and system enhancement initiatives of the section technology architecture.
Document application expectations, current behaviour, defects encountered and design functionality. 
Build test plans to capture new system functionality. Perform testing cycles and document project defects. Review introduced and core functionality, web integrations and regression testing.
Manage system configurations and integrations to allow data access. Use extraction, transformation, and load methodology to transform data for distribution. Develop workflows.
Design and implement technology strategies and controls to ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data. Collaborate with data stewards, system stakeholders, business leads and project teams. 
Deliver data-driven analysis of system performance, usage, and data/integration flows. Identify and implement improvements to data access portal processes and software. Conduct structured data analysis, create visualizations, and present data. Incorporate best practices.
Understand reporting requirements, develop and automate reporting.
Research and review technology plans and road maps as related to section technology and evolving standards. Develop implementation plans to address data access challenges and troubleshoot usability of data access portals. Collaborate with team members to identify trends in business, data, and intellectual property.










Qualifications





          A completed 2 year diploma in Computer Science, Business, Science or related field with at least 7 years of related experience in areas such as, but not limited to, software/application development, application support, data management, data manipulation, data structuring or quality assurance/quality control. OR
          


          A degree in Computer Science, Business, Science or related field plus at least 5 years of related experience in areas such as, but not limited to, software/application development, application support, data management, data manipulation, data structuring or quality assurance/quality control.
          


          Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics suite of applications is required, ideally with an in-depth knowledge of Finance and Operations, Commerce, Power BI, Power Automate.
          


          Knowledge of eCommerce solutions and experience in business analysis & market planning.
          


          Knowledge of ETL (Extract Transform Load) technologies for data manipulation and processing.
          


          Strong organizational, interpersonal, communication and project management skills.
          


          A highly motivated self-starter, with a demonstrated ability to work with minimum supervision, and effectively within a team.
          


Pre-employment Requirements 





           Applicants may be tested for appropriate skills.
           


           Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.
           
 



















                 Union: CUPE Local 38
                













       Business Unit: Corporate Analytics & Innovation
      

       Position Type: 1 Temporary (up to 12 months)
      

       Location: 800 Macleod Trail SE (Hybrid/Remote work possible)
      

       Compensation: Pay Grade 10 $38.14 - 50.98 per hour
      

       Days of Work: This position works a 5 day
      

       work week with 1 day off in a 3 week cycle.
      

       Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week
      

       Audience: Internal/External
      

       Apply By: July 13, 2022
      


       Job ID #: 305922

Title: DATA AND SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description:
About Us

 The Data Collection and Decision Support Solutions Branch with the Community Services I&IT Cluster, partners with ministries and internal/external stakeholders for effective stewardship, use and management of data by providing business consulting and advice, data-collection and decision-support solutions.
  
 It provides design and delivery, and coordinated project management, architecture, quality assurance and data management functions for the entire cluster to ensure solutions meet Ontario Public Service (OPS) quality standards.
  
 The branch fosters an outcomes-based culture for achieving government priorities, balancing the needs of delivering solutions with the imperatives of innovation in policy and program design through evidence-based policy and decision-making.
  

Why work for the Ontario Public Service (OPS)?

 The OPS support career and leadership development, invest in learning opportunities, recognize team and individual achievements, and support flexible work arrangements.
  
 We are re-thinking how we deliver our services. Through various modernization initiatives, we are now accessing and delivering critical services remotely. We are striving to enable a future-ready OPS workforce through enterprise-wide strategies.
  

About the Opportunity

 We are seeking a self-motivated individual for the role of Data and Systems Analyst. The successful candidate for this challenging opportunity will be curious and energetic. They will bring a fresh perspective and provide new insights into how we deliver our analytics initiatives with their data science and data analytics experience. Join our innovative, inclusive and cross-disciplinary team that develops new technology solutions and uses data to its full potential to advance our ministry partner outcomes.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role? As a Data and Systems Analyst, you will:
  

develop ministerial insights through reports, dashboards, and analysis on various ministry data assets
analyze ministry data related needs and work with cross-functional teams to provide technical expertise and advice in solutioning complex data analytic applications and advanced analytics solutions
conduct feasibility studies, options analyses, and cost/benefit analyses on advanced analytics systems initiatives
work with a diverse team to contribute to the analysis of business processes and recommend process improvements to effectively and efficiently harness the benefits of digital workflows
prepare project plans with realistic work breakdown structures, estimates of costs, risks, issues, and mitigation strategies 
oversee the testing and implementation of systems initiatives and coordinate the development of all systems documentation
develop strategic and operational frameworks to help ministry partners and internal projects make lasting improvements to their performance and realize outcomes

 How do I qualify?
 Technical Knowledge and Experience: You have:
  

technical knowledge to identify and evaluate information technology options, and to conduct complex systems analysis and design for the development of new systems or systems modifications
experience and knowledge working with data in some or all of these technologies: Excel, SQL, R, Python and/or other scripting languages
experience working with business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Cognos, and/or Tableau
experience of software development lifecycle methodologies and applying them to the development of data analytic products
knowledge of emerging technologies in data analytics to recommend research, evaluation, and data management tools/techniques 
knowledge of data processing/warehousing and statistical analysis techniques
knowledge of theories, practices and techniques of economic, mathematical and statistical theory/analysis, research methods, and procedures to conduct analytical studies and surveys
knowledge of metrics development methodologies for measuring effectiveness and efficiency of solutions 
knowledge of regulatory guidelines, policies, practices and protocols to ensure appropriate reporting and protection of privacy and security of personal information
experience in evaluating and analyzing existing web applications and business intelligence tools for the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) compliance

 Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills:

You can assess information technology needs and lead the development of information technology solutions which are cost-effective and improve client program and service delivery.
You can conduct feasibility studies, cost and benefit analyses on complex business and systems initiatives, and recommend systems development solutions.
You have experience conducting data analysis to support research and project teams and prepare data analysis reports.
You can conduct and provide technical expertise in complex systems analysis and design, coordinate development of all systems documentation, and develop and oversee testing and implementation of systems and applications.
You can identify and evaluate sources of data for research purposes, assess and select mathematical/statistical methods, investigate and assess new technologies, and prepare statistical analysis. 
You can synthesize insights from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods.
You can conduct analysis on business/systems initiatives and recommend solutions to meet business
 needs and promote overall ministry IT strategies and objectives.
  
 Communication Skills: You can:
  

discuss client requirements, lead discussions and explain technical issues in clear, non-technical terms
prepare project reports, business cases, systems documentation and manuals
make recommendations to clients and negotiate contracts with vendors
work with users at all levels of familiarity with technology
develop material, including presentations, that are relevant to stakeholders and executives

 OPS Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Anti-Racism: We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful, and equitable workplace.
  
 We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions. 
  
 Visit the 
  OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the 
  OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.
  
 We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's 
  Human Rights Code. Refer to the application instructions below if you require a disability-related accommodation.
  


Additional Information:



Address:



1 Temporary, duration up to 12 months, 777 Bay St, Toronto, Toronto Region

     Ontario Public Service Employees Union

These positions may be of various tenures, including short-term assignments. Your information and the results from this competition will be retained for the purpose of filling vacancies in accordance with the applicable collective agreement or policy provisions.

Title: Procurement Analyst (Remote, North America)
Description:
who we are 

 At lululemon, we work together to elevate the world. We set audacious goals, nurture big growth and engineer innovative products that allow people to feel—and perform—their best. To us, leadership is more than a role or title—it’s a way of being. We are all leaders, committed to growth and results. 

 Together, we’re co-creating a future that otherwise wouldn’t exist. To do that, we’re looking for people who unite diverse perspectives to lean into bold visions. Who strive to be better than they were yesterday. Who are all in, in everything they do. 

 We’re looking for you. Join us. 

 about the role 
The Procurement Analyst will be focused on identifying and addressing cost savings opportunities across Lululemon through spend analytics and benchmarking, sourcing strategy development, and strategic sourcing/supplier negotiations activities. The Procurement Analyst explores spend opportunities as identified by the Procurement/Category Manager but is expected to pro-actively analyze spend as well. This position will have an active role in managing and delivering strong results that support the category strategy and provide significant value to the Department/Company. A successful candidate will be adept at analyzing data and developing insights that inform and support fact-based decision-making. As the Procurement Analyst will work on several different initiatives simultaneously, strong personal organizational skills with the ability to manage competing priorities are also important. 
The Procurement Analyst will frequently work with individuals from business units across the Company and will also be responsible for communicating and building relationships with suppliers. Strong relationship skills and the ability to communicate with all levels will help this person to be successful in the role. 

 As the Procurement Analyst will interact with and develop an understanding of various areas of the business, experience in the Indirect Procurement organization will likely be a valuable asset for future opportunities that arise in other business units. 


Core Accountabilities:


Leading strategic sourcing events and supplier negotiations, with the support of others in the Procurement organization as needed
Analyzing spend data and other resources to identify savings opportunities and uncover additional insights
Participating in conversations with business unit leadership to highlight potential savings opportunities, understand the requirements of the business, and support decision-making
Managing supplier performance and relationships to ensure the organization’s expectations are met
Use strategic tools to inform category strategies
Conducting ongoing reviews of categories to inform future category strategies and activities
Participating in development of category strategies and sourcing approaches
Tracking performance of the procurement organization against established metrics and providing reporting to Company leadership
Validating projected savings from sourcing events and other sources
Identifying needs of the business units regarding procurement-related education and supporting development of training sessions/materials
Supporting creation and communication of standardized procurement policies and processes
Executing other procurement-related special projects as needed
 Required Skills, Experience and Academic/Educational Requirements: 



3+ years in procurement related role
Bachelor’s degree required
Strong ability to communicate and build relationships with both internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
Able to effectively manage competing priorities while ensuring that all expectations are met or exceeded.
Develop and continue to broaden understanding of commodities and industry cost drivers to determine implications on Lululemon Supply base and sourcing strategy
Experience in analyzing complex data to develop insights and quickly learning and adopting new methods and processes.
International experience is a plus
Capable of balancing workload and prioritizing tasks
Excellent PC skills (Microsoft Office), knowledge of P2P/Oracle a plus
Be decisive when presented with limited data (decision-making) and result-orientation.

Our "must haves":


Proven work ethic with utmost integrity
Desire to excel and succeed
Actively live and breathe the lululemon culture and lifestyle
Self-awareness, with a desire for constant self improvement (goal -oriented)
Entrepreneurial spirit and an egoless nature
Self motivated, passionate, empathetic, approachable
Outgoing, energetic, upbeat and fun!
 #LI-CC1

Title: Data Analyst, Revenue Assurance
Description:
Req Id: 383289

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 The Finance Team manages the performance and risk profile of Bell, ensuring the needs of customers, investors and employees are balanced with long-term business success. We work closely with internal and external stakeholders to develop and execute plans that help the company achieve its strategic objectives and ensure financial sustainability.
 The Revenue Assurance (“RA”) Team is part of Finance, and its mandate is to identify, recover and prevent revenue leakage across the Wireless Market. The Revenue Assurance team is focused on improving profitability by maximizing revenues and minimizing costs. The Service Revenue team focuses on service revenue reporting and forecasting. This role will be cross functional with both the RA and Service Revenue team; collaborating with a wide variety of stakeholders such as Product Management, Marketing, Finance, IT, Operations, Customer Care, etc…
 The objectives of the role are:

 Develop scripts and queries to extract data from our various systems and manipulate into a meaningful format
 Identify and assess potential revenue leakage opportunities and perform diagnostics/process mapping to determine project feasibility
 Act as a change agent to improve billing accuracy and participate in new service/feature introduction to mitigate revenue leakage
 Review business processes and workflows. Documenting these with the objective of pinpointing gaps.
 Extract Elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of stakeholders, customers and end users.
 Collaborate with Project Sponsors to determine project scope, vision and improve operational processes.
 Conduct interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
 Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team 
Influence the development and implementation of business processes/infrastructure from Sales to Collection.
 Lead cross-functional resources on multiple, concurrent revenue recovery projects.


 Critical Qualifications/ Competencies:

 Expertise in SAS/SQL, Teradata, COGNOS and Microstrategy with the ability to create queries in each of these databases and experience handling large datasets (50M+ rows)
 Predictive modelling in R or other statistical packages
 Proven Project Management skills (3+ years experience)
 Established track record in the co-ordination of cross functional and virtual teams

 Business analysis and analytics experience
 Strong documentation skills and attention to detail.
 Demonstrated ability to conduct effective research, analyze data and communicate results
 Strong communication/presentation skills
 Indepth knowledge of Order and Billing systems (SingleView, NM1, OneBill, UsageView)
 Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills
 Results oriented, curious and pro-active
 Strong sense of urgency and willingness to take initiative

 Educational level required: 

University degree in business, Computer Science, Statistics, Analytics or IT

 Years of experience required: 

3 years Project Management, Business Analyst, experience analyzing revenue and related drivers


 Specific experience: 

Knowledge of SAS/SQL
 PMP Certification or Business Analyst Certificate an asset
 Expertise in Microsoft Office Suite
 Previous experience working as a Business Analyst for software development projects
 Finance exposure

Title: Procurement Analyst, Functions Supplier Management Office (Fall 2022 Student)
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































 Job Title




































 Procurement Analyst, Functions Supplier Management Office (Fall 2022 Student)
 





































 Job Description









































 Please note: This posting is for a 4-month Fall 2022 Student placement with a start date of September 2022, and end date of December 2022. In order to be eligible for this 4-month Student position, you must either:

 Be returning back to school after the work term end-date of December 2022; or
 If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating in December 2022), you must require the full 4-month work term as a mandatory component to in order to graduate successfully.

 Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered.





 What is the opportunity?

 RBC is a highly complex global organization with significant supplier spend and vendor complexity. Effective sourcing and management of suppliers are critical contributors to RBC's operational efficiency. Managing these complex relationships can be risky and require effective execution of supplier risk management activities.

 The purpose of this position is support the Senior Manager on the execution of the Supplier Management processes and methodologies according to the Third Party Policy and standards. The Summer Internship role is responsible for proactive support, including anticipating issues and initiating appropriate actions to ensure the most effective use of time during the internship

 What will you do?

 Work with various procurement applications, data analysis tools and resources providing support to teams and key stakeholders
 Prioritize incoming requests and project assignments to support execution of the required risk management activities under the Functions Supplier Management (FSMO) team
 Establish relationships with teams in other platforms to share and discuss best practices outside RBC Functions
 Build and manage effective relationships with key stakeholders, Supplier Management, and other support groups including Center of governances


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

 Microsoft Office Suite
 Organization skills: identifies and prioritized information
 Analytical thinking: Identifies relationships between data and information.
 Detail oriented: Locating and collecting data from appropriate sources and analyzing it to prepare meaningful and concise reports that summarize the information
 Providing advice: Provides suggestions based on established information and precedent
 Teamwork: Work better with others to achieve mutual goals
 Problem solving: Work through issues critically and creatively to develop innovative solutions


 Nice-to-have

 Understanding of risk management
 Supply chain knowledge
 Data analytics capabilities


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
 Opportunities to building close relationships


 We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is 18th July 2022. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

 RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. The successful candidate for this role will be required to be located within Ontario for the duration of the work term. Details regarding the specific virtual, hybrid, and in-office arrangements for this Integrated Learning/ Co-op position are to be discussed with the Hiring Manager.






































 Job Summary











































































 Address:




































 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
 




































 City:




































 CAN-ON-TORONTO
 




































 Country:




































 Canada
 




































 Work hours/week:




































 37.5
 




































 Employment Type:




































 Full time
 




































 Platform:




































 Strategy and Administration
 




































 Job Type:




































 Student/Coop (Fixed Term)
 




































 Pay Type:




































 Salaried
 




































 Posted Date:





































2022-07-11-07:00
 




































 Application Deadline:




































 2022-07-19-07:00
 








































































 Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.  We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.














































































































 Join our Talent Community  Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.  Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: IT Data Analyst III
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Job Description




KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES


CUSTOMER: Provide a broad range of data analysis and assess data management requirements for specific data platforms, applications systems, servers aligned to business or enterprise technology needs
    

Develop and maintain knowledge of data available from upstream sources and data within relevant platform / applications, including through the means of data profiling and data quality reporting tools and via the capture of technical and business metadata
Ensure data is maintained in compliance with enterprise data standards, policies and guidelines
Collaborate with business and technology partners to elicit information / data requirements and articulate requirements
Contribute to data deliverables including contribution to the overall project business requirements and data requirements documents
Develop and maintain data models using industry standard modeling tools
Implement and support ETL jobs, using the Bank's standard tools
Provide support to the development and testing teams to resolve data issues
Build and supports reports using a combination of BI tools and SQL
Support the user community by helping users interpret the data
Provide data governance and data availability support to technology teams and business users and ensure requirements regarding privacy and security of data, data governance and access controls are appropriately captured
Assist with the testing of the technical information systems in regards to implementation, upgrades, and/or patches to ensure data integrity and systems functionality


 SHAREHOLDER: Coordinate with other technology work teams such as, ITS, Architecture, TRMIS etc. to ensure project success
    

Build subject matter knowledge in specific subject areas across multiple lines of business
Define, build and manage data dictionary / catalog for respective data platforms, systems / servers / applications
Ensure metadata and data lineage is captured and compatible with enterprise metadata and data management tools and processes
Runs quality assurance reports and resolves data integrity issues to ensure accurate reporting and data records
Gather, review, analyze, profile, validate, and map system data into the data warehouse to meet reporting and analytical business needs
Develop solutions and recommendations for improving data integrity issues, analyze data issues and works with development teams for problem resolutions
Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data, identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex datasets
Determine and analyze line of business requirements, use system data, and provide input needed by various departments and senior management to produce business reports
Understand data initiatives and capabilities, data governance principles and how they apply across the organization
Comply with well-defined enterprise technology delivery practices and standards and project management disciplines





Job Requirements

EMPLOYEE / TEAM: Work effectively as a team, supporting other members of the team in resolving critical service issues
    

Prioritize and manage own workload in order to deliver quality results and meet timelines
Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest.
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units
Continuously enhance knowledge / expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends
Identify and recommend opportunities to enhance productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency of the business unit and/or team


 BREADTH & DEPTH: Strong analytical and problem solving skills
    

Collaborative and strong team player
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas and results to a varied audience
Ability to work with minimal direction in fast-paced energetic environment, managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
Ability to learn and apply new concepts quickly
Participates in the development of small-scale datamarts or changes to enterprise data warehouses
Accountabilities are moderately complex, varied in scope and performed under direct management guidance
Generally reports to a Manager or Senior Manager


 EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION: Undergraduate degree or Technical Certificate
    

3-5 years relevant experience




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Analyst (Co-op)
Description:
Posting ID:



     23542
   




 Position Type:



     Temporary
   




 City:



     Vancouver, BC, Canada
   




 Location:



     Vancouver H/O - Canfor/CWPM_1000 (BC13)
   



 You’re an analytical self-starter who is inquisitive and resourceful. You ask the “why questions” to get a definitive answer and have excellent communication skills. Detail-oriented, you give tasks your undivided attention and catch errors or mistakes before they develop into serious problems. You have the drive to deal with situations quickly and efficiently and set SMART goals. You are keen to show up each day with your learning cap on, ready to “seize the data”!

 As the Data Analyst Co-op, you will have the opportunity to learn and expand your knowledge to shape analytic models to identify patterns and trends that provide insight into key business issues. You will develop skills to support the creation and sustainment of dashboards in PowerBI, assemble and clean data and assist in the development and maintenance of documentation in the form of business and functional requirements. 
Proficient to communicate in both “technology” and “business”, you are the rare analyst unicorn who isn’t just great at evaluating data, you enjoy it!

 To qualify for this role, you are currently enrolled in a co-op program focusing on IT, Computer Science, or Software Engineering and you are fluent in Microsoft Office. Familiarity with database management, data warehousing, and/or machine learning would be considered an asset. 
If you can work both independently and as a team member and have the willingness, eagerness, and capacity to learn new technologies, click that “apply” button today!

 Every year, Canfor hires students in a dedicated Co-op program for our operations to get hands-on experience and training. During a Co-op placement, you will learn why Canfor is a global leader in sustainable lumber, pulp and paper and a North American leader in green energy production. You will gain exposure to different operations of the business, work with a diverse workforce, network and make valuable connections, and learn more about your potential career. Take that knowledge you learned in the classroom and apply it during your Co-op placement with Canfor!

 At Canfor, diversity means understanding, recognizing and valuing the differences that make each person unique. We see inclusion and diversity as an essential part of our productivity, creativity, innovation and competitive advantage. We strive for a fair and equitable recruitment process, where hiring decisions are based on the individual qualifications and experience of each applicant.

 We are not your run of the mill forest products company, join us and find out why. #canfortalent

Title: Learning Analyst
Description:
Application Restrictions 
    

     Open to both Internal and external 
    



     Job Type 
    

     Support Staff (CUPE) 
    



     Posting In effect from 
    

     8/7/2022 
    



     Closing Application Date 
    

     22/7/2022 
    



     Closing date for internal CUPE applicants 
    

     22/7/2022 
    



     Internal CUPE applicants must submit their application by 4pm on the “closing date for internal CUPE applicants” for their Seniority to be recognized. If the position is still open after that date they will be considered alongside external applicants. 
      Applications will be reviewed commencing the “closing date for internal CUPE applicants” and may continue until the position is filled 
    




     Full/Part Time 
    

     Full Time 
    



     Support Type 
    

     Auxiliary (Over 4 Months) 
    



     Anticipated Start Date 
    

     22/8/2022 
    



     Position End Date (If Applicable) 
    

     25/8/2023 
    



     The Hours of work are subject to change depending upon departmental requirements 
    




     Schedule 
    

     The hours of work will be Monday to Friday, 7 hours a day, 8:30 am to 4:30 pm 
    



     Schedule Description 
    




     DUTIES 
    


Reporting to the Manager, Integrated Planning & Effectiveness, the Learning Analyst ensures successful planning, development and implementation of new decision support solutions at the divisional and institutional level. This includes identifying the needs of multiple administrative groups, OLFMs, on campus faculty and students, proposing data analysis and other needs-based solutions that will meet those needs, developing project plans that include end-to-end project support and ensuring the successful implementation of those plans.
MAJOR DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


Independently designs, develops and applies solutions in consultation with key stakeholders to improve student success and/or institutional effectiveness.


Identifies, integrates and validates appropriate data and other information sources to respond to requests.


Develops and manages detailed project plans and documentation that define overall project schedules.


Arranges and conducts frequent collaborative work sessions that require sustained periods of focus from all parties in order to achieve acceptable solutions.


Manipulates databases and other data sources including queries required to meet institutional research and reporting needs.


Researches, recommends and implements business intelligence tools and processes including data mining, modeling and visualization techniques to identify trends, patterns and connections within the data.


Designs and integrates the data in meaningful visualizations/dashboards to empower data-supported decision-making.


Designs and implements communication strategies to ensure regular communication and transparency with faculty, leadership and staff through the use of tools including wikis, websites, meetings and emails.


Uses discretion when responding to requests and resolves conflicts among stakeholders as they arise.


Establishes, documents and communicates processes and procedures to ensure new solution implementation is successful.


Reviews existing research related to learning analytics, data-supported learning design, student persistence and uses that information to recommend next steps for implementation for the institution.


Participates in special projects and development of analysis.


 REPORTS TO Manager, Integrated Planning & Effectiveness





     QUALIFICATIONS 
    


EDUCATION:

Bachelor's degree in an appropriate analytical discipline plus post-graduation education leading to a certificate or certification in a field related to data visualization, business analysis, decision support or predictive analytics

 EXPERIENCE:

Five years of experience including: 
        
Two years' experience gathering, synthesizing, evaluating and interpreting data to produce actionable information
One year experience using data visualization tools (e.g.: Tableau) to build dashboards and user friendly reports
One year leading collaborative work group in the completion of tasks that require high levels of concentration
 

 REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITIES & KNOWLEDGE

Analytical ability in order to collect, analyze and report data; analyze and interpret discrepancies, issues or problems to ensure data accuracy and integrity
Ability to manipulate data to produce meaningful reports and obtain advice when precedents are unclear or unavailable and determine methods for ensuring compliance with functional/ organizational policies and procedures
Acute attention to detail and ability to maintain accuracy
Demonstrated advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point in a Windows environment including, but not limited to, experience making mathematical and statistical calculations, pivot tables, graphs, etc.
Advanced knowledge of data visualization and applicable software such as SAS, SPSS and Tableau
Knowledge of SQL scripting language
Exceptionally high level of initiative to solve complex problems
Independent ability to plan, develop and apply solutions, with or without technological requirements
Ability to plan, organize and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines

 WORKING CONDITIONS

Sitting at desk and computer for long periods of time; general office conditions






     The salary for the above position is determined by the Collective Agreement with the Canadian Union of Public Employees, Local 4879, as it presently exists. 
    




     Pay Band 
    

     CUPE Grade 11 $35.75 
    



     Salary rate 
    

     Please Note: This position may be subject to a 90% salary for the first 560 hours of employment. 
    



     Location 
    

     Kamloops, BC CA (Primary)
     




     # of Hires Needed 
    

     1 
    



     Organizational Unit 
    

     Thompson Rivers University -> Integrated Planning and Effectiveness 
    



     Diversity and Inclusion Commitment: 
    

     Thompson Rivers University is strongly committed to hiring based on merit with a focus on fostering diversity of thought within our community. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff, our faculty and its scholarship including, but not limited to, women, Indigenous, Black and People of Colour, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. Please note that all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply, however applications from Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority. 
    



     Please Note: If you are selected for interview, External Candidates will be required to bring a copy of their transcripts to the interview 
    




     NOTE: To learn more about Thompson Rivers University or living in Kamloops or Williams Lake please visit our Career website.

Title: Analyste de données/ Data Analyst
POLICY ANALYST
Description:
Are you interested in developing your policy and analytical skills? Do you want to make an impact on Ontario's postsecondary education sector and students? Are you looking to join a team that prioritizes a fun and positive workplace culture, with a supportive management team? 
  
 If so, we might be the right fit for you! Our branch is looking for an emerging policy professional to research and develop strategic policies, legislation, and initiatives for postsecondary learning and employment interventions to support the Ministry's goals and strengthen Ontario's labour market!
  

Why work for the Ontario Public Service?
 The Ontario Public Service (OPS) is one of the largest employers in the province, employing more than 60,000 people. We have a wide range of meaningful and rewarding career opportunities in communities across Ontario. We offer challenging work and 
  competitive compensation and benefits.
  
 OPS Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Anti-Racism: We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.
  
 We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.
  
 Visit the 
  OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the 
  OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.
  
 We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's 
  Human Rights Code. Refer to the "How to apply" section if you require a disability-related accommodation.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role? In this role, you will:
  

Undertake policy and issues analysis
Participate/lead assigned projects in support policy development initiatives
Contribute to the development of policy and program recommendations, consultations and implementation planning
Conduct environmental scans and trend analyses to identify key issues
Analyze data to identify trends and assess their implications for policy development
Coordinate the development of new projects/initiatives by collaborating with all levels of Branch and Division staff
Develop and maintain contacts with key internal and external stakeholders
Provide input into the development of communication strategies for the dissemination of information to other ministry and jurisdictional stakeholders
Prepare presentations and briefing materials for senior staff and senior levels of government

 How do I qualify?
 Policy and Program Development Skills:

You have knowledge and understanding of policy and program development principles and the government decision-making process
You have experience conducting program analysis and evaluation techniques to assess the effectiveness of new and changed policies and programs
You are familiar with or eager to learn more about postsecondary education policies, current issues, emerging trends and upcoming opportunities
You can provide policy and program options and recommendations

 Research and Analytical Skills:

You have knowledge and experience applying research and analytical techniques, including survey techniques and performance measures 
You have experience conducting environmental scans, trend analyses, quantitative and qualitative research from multi-jurisdictional sources and costing of policy and program changes

 Communication Skills:

You have communication skills to draft policy documents and correspondences including policy papers, reports, briefing notes and materials for cabinet submissions
You have presentation skills to present research findings to senior staff on branch related policy and program development projects

 Issues Management Skills:

You have experience applying issues management techniques to address and resolve issues related to projects, initiatives and programs
You can identify potential issues and problems and develop solutions to mitigate




Additional Information:



Address:



1 Temporary, duration up to 18 months, 315 Front St W, Toronto, Toronto Region








Compensation Group:


     Association of Management, Administrative and Professional Crown Employees of Ontario 
    







      Understanding the job ad - definitions
     
Schedule:


     6 
    






Category:


     Policy and Analysis 
    






Posted on:


     Monday, July 4, 2022 
    





Note:


W-TU-181840/22  The information that you provide for the purpose of this competition and the results from this competition may be used to fill other positions. These positions may be of various tenures including short-term assignments. Your information and the results from this competition will be retained for the purpose of filling vacancies in accordance with the applicable collective agreement or policy provisions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Clickatell is a digital commerce leader. We enable brands to connect, interact, and transact with their customers inside of the chat platforms they already use.
 For over 20 years, we have built a global culture rooted in our 4 core values - Curious, Creative, Collaborative, Champion. While every company has them, few truly live by them, and use them as guide posts for how we run our company. It's something you can feel in your everyday interactions with fellow employees.
 We take smart risks, we ask why, we involve others, and we find a way - always.
 As a Data Analyst, you will join a cross-functional, scrum-based data team, that’s transforming the way we do data at Clickatell. This role is the bridge between Product and Data Insights! As such, expect a combination of executive and technology responsibilities from data mapping to reporting. You will play a critical role in strengthening our analytical presence in the Chat Commerce market. 
Typical Duties of the Role

Support the development of scalable and robust pipelines by means of completing and maintaining source to target mappings templates and associated metadata
Support the advancement of Analytical models by working in collaboration with Data Modelers and BI Analyst in translating or anticipating business needs into actionable data solutions 
Create Data Visualization prototypes to support the elicitation of Business needs 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations.
Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.
Assist in the ongoing changes resulting from the roll out of Clickatell’s Data Strategy i.e. Change Management, Communication, Progress Updates, etc.




Requirements

3+ years experience as a Data Analyst, working in SaaS or cloud-based technology environments; Diploma, B-Tech or bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or informatics; or similar combination of skills and education
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets using tools such as Power BI, data ETL, data model and automation.
An analytical mindset with the ability to identify complex problems, and to discuss resolutions clearly and in nontechnical terms.
Exposure to Business Intelligence, data warehousing (dimensional modelling) will be advantageous.
Experience with data transformation tools such as Talend will be advantageous.
Well versed in Agile framework, specially Scrum and Lean Development

Benefits
 Being a Clickatell Champion means no 2 days are exactly the same. You'll have an opportunity to partner with passionate, smart people in a global organization obsessed with building simple, scalable solutions for our customers. We envision a world where delightful customer experiences are the norm and we're always looking for talented people to join the team and contribute to our mission of revolutionizing customer experiences through innovation and engagement. 


Perks of the Role 

Health, Dental and Vision benefits
RRSP with company match


Quarterly performance incentive bonus 
Reimbursable communications allowance for internet and mobile phone bills
Half-day off on your birthday 
5 personal days leave a year, over and above your PTO 


Remote-friendly working and access to office hubs as required. 
Home office set-up with laptop, monitor and other related items. 



Stronger Together 
Clickatell is unequivocally committed to Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging. We believe that we are stronger together and that sameness limits our thinking and our opportunities. You are welcome at Clickatell for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you choose to believe. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. But it isn’t just about a whole lot of different people working together all having their say – it is about us creating a place where we all feel that we belong. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world uses chat technology.

Title: Inventory Data Analyst, Mining
Description:
Come join our growing team! Our Mining Division is looking to bring on an Inventory Data Analyst. They will be responsible for monitoring inventory levels and ensuring that inventory KPI's can be achieved through the monitoring of inventory ordering and supply. The Inventory Systems Analyst will be responsible for communicating inventory concerns to the Parts Planner and providing prompt follow up to regions and other stakeholders should KPI's and or delivery times not be able to be met.

 Responsibilities


 Transferring inventory to warehouses and working with the customer support group to create strategies to remove non-moving – non allocated stock
 Analyze large sets of data and present data to management
 Work collaboratively with department to develop and implement effective seed stock strategy 
Drive inventory digitalization projects at Liebherr Canada - Mining 
Drive the continuous improvement program for inventory management 
Utilize the LEC MRP program to optimize & plan inventory and future orders (6-12 months)
 Initiate recommendations for improvement of the organization’s policies and processes 
Alerting the organization of potential or known problems that affect the quality of LCA Mining products and services
 Participate in budgeting and planning as it relates to inventory value 
Determining customer needs and establishing service solutions and forecasts 
Set, monitor and review inventory levels, stock turns and movements 
Other duties as directed


 Competencies


 1-3 years experience in inventory management/logistics environment
 Degree or diploma in supply chain/ logistics/inventory management
 Software experience and programming in MS SQL and Excel 
Sense of urgency, ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
 Strong analytical, ability to digest large sets of data, and problem solving skills
 Self motivated and results oriented


 Our Offer


 Competitive wages (premiums & allowances for select roles*)
 International training opportunities
 Challenging work opportunities
 Comprehensive benefits and employer paid premiums from day one
 Paid vacation & health and wellness days
 Generous employer RRSP matching
 And much more!


 Liebherr Canada Ltd. is committed to provide a diverse, inclusive, safe and dignified work environment for all employees, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or any other aspect of their identity.


 Have we awoken your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your online application. If you have any questions, please contact Mauricio Sanchez at: mauricio.sanchez@liebherr.com.
 One Passion. Many Opportunities.


 The company
 The Liebherr Group has represented leading-edge technical products and services for more than 70 years and has proudly serviced Canadian customers directly since 1973. Liebherr-Canada Ltd. has ten branch locations across Canada providing sales, service and product support for equipment in the construction, mining, material handling, crane, aerospace, transportation, and refrigeration industries.
 Location

 Liebherr-Canada Ltd.
 10440 267 ST
 T7X 6A2 Acheson, AB
 Canada (CA)

 Contact

 Mauricio Sanchez
 mauricio.sanchez@liebherr.com

 OPS Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Anti-Racism: We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.
  
 We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.
  
 Visit the

 We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's

 What can I expect to do in this role? In this role, you will:
  

Undertake policy and issues analysis
Participate/lead assigned projects in support policy development initiatives
Contribute to the development of policy and program recommendations, consultations and implementation planning
Conduct environmental scans and trend analyses to identify key issues
Analyze data to identify trends and assess their implications for policy development
Coordinate the development of new projects/initiatives by collaborating with all levels of Branch and Division staff
Develop and maintain contacts with key internal and external stakeholders
Provide input into the development of communication strategies for the dissemination of information to other ministry and jurisdictional stakeholders
Prepare presentations and briefing materials for senior staff and senior levels of government

 How do I qualify?
 Policy and Program Development Skills:

You have knowledge and understanding of policy and program development principles and the government decision-making process
You have experience conducting program analysis and evaluation techniques to assess the effectiveness of new and changed policies and programs
You are familiar with or eager to learn more about postsecondary education policies, current issues, emerging trends and upcoming opportunities
You can provide policy and program options and recommendations

You have knowledge and experience applying research and analytical techniques, including survey techniques and performance measures 
You have experience conducting environmental scans, trend analyses, quantitative and qualitative research from multi-jurisdictional sources and costing of policy and program changes

 Communication Skills:

You have communication skills to draft policy documents and correspondences including policy papers, reports, briefing notes and materials for cabinet submissions
You have presentation skills to present research findings to senior staff on branch related policy and program development projects

 Issues Management Skills:

You have experience applying issues management techniques to address and resolve issues related to projects, initiatives and programs
You can identify potential issues and problems and develop solutions to mitigate

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Clickatell is a digital commerce leader. We enable brands to connect, interact, and transact with their customers inside of the chat platforms they already use.
 For over 20 years, we have built a global culture rooted in our 4 core values - Curious, Creative, Collaborative, Champion. While every company has them, few truly live by them, and use them as guide posts for how we run our company. It's something you can feel in your everyday interactions with fellow employees.
 We take smart risks, we ask why, we involve others, and we find a way - always.
 As a Data Analyst, you will join a cross-functional, scrum-based data team, that’s transforming the way we do data at Clickatell. This role is the bridge between Product and Data Insights! As such, expect a combination of executive and technology responsibilities from data mapping to reporting. You will play a critical role in strengthening our analytical presence in the Chat Commerce market. 
Typical Duties of the Role

Support the development of scalable and robust pipelines by means of completing and maintaining source to target mappings templates and associated metadata
Support the advancement of Analytical models by working in collaboration with Data Modelers and BI Analyst in translating or anticipating business needs into actionable data solutions 
Create Data Visualization prototypes to support the elicitation of Business needs 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations.
Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.
Assist in the ongoing changes resulting from the roll out of Clickatell’s Data Strategy i.e. Change Management, Communication, Progress Updates, etc.




Requirements

3+ years experience as a Data Analyst, working in SaaS or cloud-based technology environments; Diploma, B-Tech or bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or informatics; or similar combination of skills and education
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets using tools such as Power BI, data ETL, data model and automation.
An analytical mindset with the ability to identify complex problems, and to discuss resolutions clearly and in nontechnical terms.
Exposure to Business Intelligence, data warehousing (dimensional modelling) will be advantageous.
Experience with data transformation tools such as Talend will be advantageous.
Well versed in Agile framework, specially Scrum and Lean Development

Benefits
 Being a Clickatell Champion means no 2 days are exactly the same. You'll have an opportunity to partner with passionate, smart people in a global organization obsessed with building simple, scalable solutions for our customers. We envision a world where delightful customer experiences are the norm and we're always looking for talented people to join the team and contribute to our mission of revolutionizing customer experiences through innovation and engagement. 


Perks of the Role 

Health, Dental and Vision benefits
RRSP with company match


Quarterly performance incentive bonus 
Reimbursable communications allowance for internet and mobile phone bills
Half-day off on your birthday 
5 personal days leave a year, over and above your PTO 


Remote-friendly working and access to office hubs as required. 
Home office set-up with laptop, monitor and other related items. 



Stronger Together 
Clickatell is unequivocally committed to Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging. We believe that we are stronger together and that sameness limits our thinking and our opportunities. You are welcome at Clickatell for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you choose to believe. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. But it isn’t just about a whole lot of different people working together all having their say – it is about us creating a place where we all feel that we belong. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world uses chat technology.

Title: Inventory Data Analyst, Mining
Description:
Come join our growing team! Our Mining Division is looking to bring on an Inventory Data Analyst. They will be responsible for monitoring inventory levels and ensuring that inventory KPI's can be achieved through the monitoring of inventory ordering and supply. The Inventory Systems Analyst will be responsible for communicating inventory concerns to the Parts Planner and providing prompt follow up to regions and other stakeholders should KPI's and or delivery times not be able to be met.

 Responsibilities


 Transferring inventory to warehouses and working with the customer support group to create strategies to remove non-moving – non allocated stock
 Analyze large sets of data and present data to management
 Work collaboratively with department to develop and implement effective seed stock strategy 
Drive inventory digitalization projects at Liebherr Canada - Mining 
Drive the continuous improvement program for inventory management 
Utilize the LEC MRP program to optimize & plan inventory and future orders (6-12 months)
 Initiate recommendations for improvement of the organization’s policies and processes 
Alerting the organization of potential or known problems that affect the quality of LCA Mining products and services
 Participate in budgeting and planning as it relates to inventory value 
Determining customer needs and establishing service solutions and forecasts 
Set, monitor and review inventory levels, stock turns and movements 
Other duties as directed


 Competencies


 1-3 years experience in inventory management/logistics environment
 Degree or diploma in supply chain/ logistics/inventory management
 Software experience and programming in MS SQL and Excel 
Sense of urgency, ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
 Strong analytical, ability to digest large sets of data, and problem solving skills
 Self motivated and results oriented


 Our Offer


 Competitive wages (premiums & allowances for select roles*)
 International training opportunities
 Challenging work opportunities
 Comprehensive benefits and employer paid premiums from day one
 Paid vacation & health and wellness days
 Generous employer RRSP matching
 And much more!


 Liebherr Canada Ltd. is committed to provide a diverse, inclusive, safe and dignified work environment for all employees, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or any other aspect of their identity.


 Have we awoken your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your online application. If you have any questions, please contact Mauricio Sanchez at: mauricio.sanchez@liebherr.com.
 One Passion. Many Opportunities.


 The company
 The Liebherr Group has represented leading-edge technical products and services for more than 70 years and has proudly serviced Canadian customers directly since 1973. Liebherr-Canada Ltd. has ten branch locations across Canada providing sales, service and product support for equipment in the construction, mining, material handling, crane, aerospace, transportation, and refrigeration industries.
 Location

 Liebherr-Canada Ltd.
 10440 267 ST
 T7X 6A2 Acheson, AB
 Canada (CA)

 Contact

 Mauricio Sanchez

Title: Senior Analyst, Innovation and Data Insights
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

    TD Securities (TDS) Finance is responsible for developing and delivering financial strategy, information, and management support on a segment-wide basis for TDS, consistent with TD's enterprise risk appetite.
    
 The Innovation and Data Insights team is the innovation hub in relation to data analytics, governance, and management for TDS Finance. The team plays an important strategic role, innovating by bringing in tools, technology, and methodologies to automate processes, drive efficiency, and add value by providing data insights to finance and front office partners that help with their decision making.
   


Job Description

    The qualified candidate will implement analytical approaches using advanced analytic techniques while working closely with stakeholders and teammates from non-technical disciplines. You will act as a consultant and take the lead on data engagements that focus on process improvement from start to finish. This may involve using large data analysis to deliver lasting measurable improvements. This position will require experience using industry leading BI platforms (Alteryx, Tableau, UiPath, etc) to build and support the need for ongoing data-driven work to enhance systems and processes across common teams as well as an ability to train non-technical teammates in tool adoption (Alteryx, Tableau, UiPath, etc)
    
 KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
    
 Timely completion of data mining, cleansing, and modeling of transactional and financial data from various data sources (i.e., Hyperion, Excel) that ties to/matches GL account/financial Statements.
 Create best-in-class/compelling visualization of data, dashboards, tools and reports that supports the interpretation that drives key decisions for stakeholders
 Evaluate existing templates and tools and participate in design, development and testing to enhance functionality and capabilities.
 Ensure and promote various forms of documentation for the purpose of project documentation, training and change management.
 Partner with technology and architecture colleagues and contacts to drive effective data related activities for LOB




Job Requirements

EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION

 Minimum of Bachelor's degree in business, accounting, finance, economics, mathematics or computer science
 Experience working within management consulting or banking industry experience with wholesale banking or finance with emphasis in business intelligence
 Experience with diagnosing, prescribing, planning, executing, and presenting small to medium analytics and BI projects
 MUST have experience in Alteryx Software and workflow design and Tableau Software and interactive dashboard design
 Proficiency or ability to understand macros developed with Microsoft Excel, Access, and VBA.
 Ability to perform/develop data mapping (data definitions and business rules, mapping requirements to source data, etc.), data profiling, and business process maps
 Programming languages such as Python, Java would be an asset (but not required)
 Web scraping/data extraction, database management, data mining and market research, data blending and wrangling and econometric modeling is also an asset
 Understanding of statistical analysis and applications (SAS, R) would be an asset

 SKILLS/ABILITIES

 Strong analytical and organization skills with respect to finance activities
 Passion for big data and advanced analytics
 Desire and tenacity to learn new skills and adapt to new challenges with an exceedingly fast learning curve
 Willingness to analyze complex or disparate customer financial and operational data
 Ability to interpret analysis results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining independently
 Extremely proactive self-starter that anticipates next tasks before it is assigned
 Ability and tenacity to develop creative solutions to complex problems and the ability to think way outside-the-box
 Strategic and tactical thinker
 Able to speak proficiently with technical and business audiences as it relates to project deliverables
 Ability to develop, sustain and proactively manage value-added customer relationships
 Capability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
 Ability to solve complex business issues
 Demonstrated ability to adapt quickly to changing customers and multi-task multiple projects
 Proven initiative, drive and focus on detail
 General knowledge of financial systems
 Ability to work effectively within and across teams
 At least 2 to 4 years of work experience




Additional Information

    #LI-Hybrid
   


Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
