Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
 


   Job Description
 


   Data Analyst - Market Data Operations - SS&C Technologies Canada
 

   Toronto, ON Canada
 


   SS&C Technologies Holdings, Inc. is a global provider of financial services software and software-enabled services. Founded in 1986, SS&C has built the most comprehensive powerhouse of software technology in the financial services industry – technology that complements our unrivaled expertise and professionalism in fund administration, insurance and pension funds, and asset and wealth management accounting and operations. Named by Forbes as one of America’s best midsize employers, SS&C has more than 20,000 employees and 15,000 clients worldwide, and is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut, with offices throughout North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa, and Australia.
 


   Primary Responsibilities:
 

   Essential responsibilities of the job include, but are not limited to:
 

 Establishing new and maintaining existing procedures in order to meet company requirements.
 Conducting research and providing information/answers to internal/external parties in regard to SVC’s data services, products, procedures, policies and documentation.
 Assisting in the research and resolution of department related problems.
 Creating and testing of change requests as required.
 Actively participating in regular team status meetings to ensure information is effectively and appropriately shared.
 Acting as a resource in areas of expertise for others in the team.
 Assisting team members as required to ensure daily operational requirements are met.
 Keeping informed of internal products, processes and initiatives.
 Ensuring department related documentation and training materials are kept current.
 Participating in the on-call rotation as requested by Team Leader or Manager.
 Developing and assisting in strategies for continued self and team development.



   Additional Functions
 

 Ensuring complete coverage of data operations during staff holidays or absences.
 Monitoring, analyzing and maintaining the quality and accuracy of data in SVC databases.
 Working closely with Sales and Client Support for new client implementations.
 Assisting in improving and developing SVC products and services.
 Working closely with required SVC and FMC departments to achieve common goal of customer satisfaction by providing superior support and service.
 Continuous interaction with data suppliers to stay informed of products and services and to ensure that data services SVC subscribes to are timely, accurate and reliable services.
 Ensuring the Client Support group is made aware of any SVC related activities or changes in data services that may affect clients.



   Position Requirements:
 

 College diploma in Business, Math, Economics, or Finance-related field, other financial service qualifications or equivalent experience.
 Securities data and/or investment-related experience is an asset as well as the completion of the Canadian Securities Course.
 A solid understanding of financial instruments and assets classes including fixed income, equities, corporate actions, reference data and security identifiers.
 Proficient in MS Office (with accent on Excel).
 Excellent knowledge of SQL, Mongo query tools and Jira are an asset.



   Organizational Relationships:
 

 Data Analyst reports to the Team Leader, who in turn reports to the Department Manager.
 Data Analyst has a support responsibility to all functional Directors and Managers within the organization.
 Data Analyst will have paralleled responsibility and accountability with other team members within the group.
 Data Analyst may be asked to assist in other areas of SVC as required.
 Data Analyst works with Team Leaders, Managers and FMC staff as needed to successfully complete assigned projects/tasks and resolve department related problems.



   Why SS&C?
 


   Working at SS&C is balanced and fair – especially in challenging times. We offer flexible work schedules, time off, and so much more to keep you healthy, safe, and productive. SS&C offers:
 


 Hybrid Schedule featuring 4-6 days in the office monthly combined with working from home
 Competitive base salary plus EXCELLENT benefits (including medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD and more)!
 RRSP Matching Program
 Global Flexible Time Off Policy (personal/vacation time)
 Sick Leave Policy
 Eligible for an annual performance-based bonus program
 Tuition Reimbursement up to 70% and Professional Development up to 100%
 Candidate Referral Program
 Business Casual dress code (includes jeans)



   SS&C Technologies Canada Corp. fosters a positive, equitable and progressive workforce and is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. We will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process. If you require any accommodation during the application and hiring process, please contact: tacanada@sscinc.com
 


   To further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at 
  
   www.ssctech.com/careers
  .No phone calls or email applications please. We thank all candidates for their interest, but only those under consideration will be contacted.
 

   #LI-LM1
 


   Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

Title: eHealth Data Analyst
Description:
RESPONSIBILITIES

Collects and monitors eLogs for Non-Insured Health Benefits (NIHB).
Provides a range of data collection and analyses to support the data needs of KO eHealth, partners and stakeholders.
Analyzes, interprets and reports telemedicine usage data using appropriate methods in response to inquiries from Clinical Services Coordinator, Assistant eHealth Director and KO eHealth Director.
Ensures data quality and validity by conducting data review on a daily basis.
Works closely with community telemedicine coordinators to ensure collection of valid data.
Prepares and disseminates community telemedicine usage surveillance information in various formats including charts, graphs, and community telemedicine usage profiles to be presented to community partners, if required presents the data in appropriate format to partners.
Works with computer programs and various databases to conduct data extraction, data set creation and analysis using spreadsheets and statistical software packages (e.g., Excel, OTN database).
Produce monthly and quarterly telemedicine usage reports based on health specialties.
Assist in annual performance report by providing statistical analysis of KO eHealth services.
Collects and processes confidential data and information according to PHIPA guidelines.
Perform other duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Post-secondary degree in health sciences with a background in statistical analysis or a college diploma in a related field supplemented with two years of experience in data collection, sorting, analysis and reporting.
Professional and responsible attitude towards work
Ability to speak English and/or Oji-cree,Cree, Objibway
Excellent computer skills such as M/S Office; Excel
Experience in working with various databases.
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills
Good oral and written communications skills
Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail
Ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Demonstrated ability to treat confidential information in a mature and professional manner.
Dedication to service excellence

Location: Balmertown, Ontario
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Analyst Billing & Collection
Description:
Posting End Date:
  July 25, 2022
 

   Employee Type:
  Regular-Full time
 

   Union/Non:
  This is a non-union position
 

   Are you interested in a great opportunity to learn about the services that Enbridge Gas provides to its largest commercial, industrial, storage and transportation customers? Are you looking to be part a dynamic team that will allow you to demonstrate your analytical and problem-solving skills while meeting our customers’ needs?
 


   We are looking for an Analyst Billing & Collection to join our team!
 

   As an Analyst Billing & Collection you will be responsible for the timely and accurate billing and collection of 1,600 accounts totaling ~$700M of receivables and ~$130M in remittances on a yearly basis.
 


   Apply today!
 


   What You Will Do:
 



     Analyze data and create invoices packages for large volume commercial, industrial, and storage and transportation customers.
   


     Enter and validate inputs into billing systems on a timely basis with high degree of accuracy.
   


     Main point of contact for internal and external customers to answer questions, resolve complaints and address payment related issues while maintaining positive relationships.
   


     Follow, document and identify improvements to processes and procedures
   


     Work with IT to identify & deliver system defects and improvements to internal systems.
   


     Create reports and data queries including providing data analysis as required.
   


     Identify, plan and implement projects that improve the departmental processes and systems.
   


     Assist with other tasks, as required, within the Large Volume Contracting & Policy group.
   



   Who You Are:
 

   You have the following education and experience:
 



     Related university degree or technical diploma with limited experience OR a combination of related certification and a minimum of 5 years directly related experience.
   


     Proficient to advanced knowledge of related office software; company databases; company structure and standard operating procedures; and/or office communications technology.
   


     Strong analytical skills with good attention to detail.
   


     Ability to work in a team environment with tight deadlines.
   


     Ability to learn new concepts and systems quickly.
   


     Experience in problem solving and process/procedure improvement.
   


     Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills required.
   


     Digital literacy, proficient in Excel would be an asset.
   



   Working Conditions :
 

   Occasional overtime may be required
 


   Flex Work Clause
 

   Enbridge provides competitive workplace programs that differentiate us and offer flexibility to our team members. Enbridge’s FlexWork (Hybrid Work Model) offers eligible employees the opportunity to work variable daily schedules with a flexible start and end time, to opt for a compressed workweek schedule, and the option to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays. Role requirements determine your eligibility for each option or combination of options.

  . We are committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to age, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, veteran status, Indigenous/Native American status, or disability. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats, communication supports, or other accessibility assistance by contacting 
  
   careers@enbridge.com
  .
 


   Information For Applicants:
 

 Applications can be submitted via our online recruiting system only.
 We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.
 Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Who is eHealth Saskatchewan? eHealth Saskatchewan is a Treasury Board Crown Corporation with a unique blend of healthcare, information technology, and citizen services. Our vision is “Connected healthcare, accessible to everyone, everywhere” with a mission to “Collaborate to transform healthcare through the use of information and innovative technology”. It is a complex environment, constantly evolving and quickly changing as we live our values of excellence, integrity, teamwork, courage, resilience and collaboration.
A large and complex organization, eHealth is comprised of 30+ clinical and non-clinical program (service) areas that all work together to support health care providers and teams across the province in delivering the best possible care to patients, providers, citizens, and health system users. Programs range from primary care to acute care, and includes laboratories, pharmaceuticals and diagnostics. Additional programs that also support patient care and information include Virtual Care, the MySaskHealthRecord, and the Provincial Electronic Health Record. eHealth is also responsible for the administration of various pieces of legislation to manage the registration of/changes to all vital event records (e.g. birth, marriage, death, etc.), registration of legal name changes, registration of adoptions, and for maintaining the provincial health registry for health services eligibility and distribution of health services cards.
The eHealth teams engage directly with health system partners and other stakeholders both provincially and federally to ensure all services are delivered efficiently and effectively.
About the Role
The Project Management Office requires a confident, motivated and results oriented individual with strong analytical, problem solving, and interpersonal skills for the position of Senior Business Analyst. The Senior Business Analyst provides the vital link between the business side of the solution and the technology side of the solution. The Senior Business Analyst takes the conceptual design bringing it to the physical implementation, while at the same time considering the impacts on the enterprise architecture. They will drive the project team to achieve consensus about the content and design of the solution among the demands of their other roles, and justify the approach to the project stakeholders. This role is responsible for providing business improvement services to eHealth Saskatchewan. A key role is to assist with translating eHealth’s corporate vision and needs into desired outcomes through the deployment of information technology.
The ideal candidate will be technically sound, with a broad base of knowledge, experience and the ability to relate the technical issues to the underlying needs of the business. They will provide guidance to the development team on the specific business requirements and processes requested in the solution and will be able to grasp the implications of technical details very rapidly and understand their inter-relationships and the impact on the environment into which the solution will be deployed. The Senior Business Analyst will also be able to discuss those impacts with the project stakeholders to quickly resolve any conflicts between the proposed solution and the enterprise architecture. 
In this challenging and exciting position, the Senior Business Analyst acts as a change agent that provides a lead role in business improvement activities to ensure client expectations, requirements, and government priorities are met. 
To qualify for this position you must have experience/knowledge in the following: 

Leading and managing changes to business processes and computer applications;
Conducting feasibility studies and developing business cases that review existing services or processes, determining future business needs or opportunities and recommending strategies that satisfy client needs and objectives;
Assisting clients in gathering business requirements and preparing requirements documents;
Monitoring current, new, and emerging services; 
Evaluating industry trends and analyzing similar service offerings in other jurisdictions to identify opportunities and develop strategies for continued business/service improvement;
Write a variety of detailed, accurate and clear technical material such as user and systems requirements;
Incorporate new technology and create new solutions within a constantly changing technological and business environment;
Communicate effectively, both written and verbal, with customers and team members
Work independently to meet the needs of clients and co-workers and to build productive, positive work relationships;
Provide excellent customer service through strong interpersonal skills;
Quickly gain understanding of key business processes and respond to changes within the business environment;
Have a passion for continual learning.

The knowledge and skills required for this position would be attained through the completion of a Degree / Diploma in Computer Science, Business Information Systems or related area of study; and/or applicants with an IIBA Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) Certification or PMI-PBA supplemented with experience. In addition to educational requirements; you will have 1-2 years of experience working within an integrated IT/Health support environment and a minimum of 5 years in a Business Analyst role. Completion of a recognized project management certificate or designation would be considered an asset. 
Knowledge of business needs analysis/business process improvement methodologies, tools and processes and an understanding of project management methodologies and process will significantly contribute to one's success in this position. 
You will have knowledge of:

Strategic and project planning techniques;
Database concepts, theories and principles;
Requirements analysis and solution design techniques; and
Computer hardware and architecture.

Competencies
Leadership 

Ability to constructively lead, advise and encourage others to achieve success in their work and contribute to the effectiveness of the work team
Ability to facilitate a group process to successfully implement technological change and business transition within the organization
Ability to research, develop, recommend and manage the implementation of new approaches and technological solutions for data, database security and integration services to assist clients in the selection of a “best fit” solution based upon business and technical requirements, cost and leveraging opportunities/government wide efficiencies

Communication

Ability to demonstrate and promote the use and value of new technology, programs and services in a manner that creates understanding and captures interest
Ability to write a variety of detailed, accurate and clear material at a level appropriate to the target groups

Problem Solving

Ability to independently interpret, comprehend and apply technical instructions and concepts to successfully acquire, install, modify, configure and maintain hardware and software components and administer networks
Ability to extract, recall, synthesize, conceptualize and apply ideas, processes and information to incorporate new technology and create new solutions in a constantly changing technological and business environment

Interpersonal

Ability to build cooperative working relationships with coworkers and clients to ensure credibility and confidence in services provided

Analytical 

Ability to identify, explore and evaluate options on data processes and methodologies, information technology and potential systems design to make feasible recommendations

Technical 

Ability to design new or adapt existing systems/applications taking into account design alternatives, business requirements, and cost, recourse and time constraints
Broad knowledge of all health system programs and policies in order to analyze and evaluate what applications/system changes are required; develop base testing criteria; analyze the implications of proposed changes; integrating various system changes with changes to policies and procedures
Current knowledge of emerging methods, procedures, tools, technology and techniques within the industry

If this role sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for to challenge yourself, make a difference in people’s lives, and showcase your abilities, then the Project Management Office wants to hear from you!

Grade: SGEU-SIT11

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why Work for Us?
 Innovation. Act with Integrity. Collaboration. Embrace Diversity. Care
 We come from many countries, cultures, races, ethnicities, abilities and nationalities. We bring our passions including singing, biking, swimming, dancing, cooking, volunteering, parenting, coaching and much more! We are proud of our nearly equal balance of men and women and strengthened by our non-binary and transgender team members. Every employee belongs.
 We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive benefits and an environment that recognizes and rewards performance.
 Company Description
 Zymeworks is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and commercialization of next-generation bispecific and multifunctional biotherapeutics, initially focused on the treatment of cancer. Zymeworks’ suite of complementary therapeutic platforms and its fully-integrated drug development engine provide the flexibility and compatibility to precisely engineer and develop highly-differentiated product candidates.
 Zymeworks is seeking a highly-motivated Data Analyst who is looking to grow their career with our company.
 This position will report to the Associate Director of Enterprise Applications and can be based either in our offices in Vancouver BC or Remote (Canada).
 As a condition of employment, Zymeworks requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 and provide verification of such.
 Key Responsibilities

 Develops tools for Zymeworks’ scientific data system’s integrations, and visualization of many forms of data including scientific R&D data.
 Participates in requirement analysis with our scientific R&D teams to understand the experimental data being produced, provides proposals to organize and formalize the data from these experiments, and works on developing tools to store this data in the system. 
Use multiple system API’s to extract and transform data to a standard format to be used by scientific staff/end users. 
Create workflows and visual dashboard for presentation of a variety of data. 
Manages and organizes the storage of our biological data (protein products, antibodies, small molecules, other molecular entities) in the LIMS/ELN/Inventory, along with associated metadata. 
Performs daily administrative tasks such as data administration and access control of the scientific software systems. 
Works with our in-house lab scientists, and external Contract Research Organizations to develop, document, and enforce standard operating procedures and protocols for our experiments and the associated data upload and management procedures. 
Works with the vendors and in-house scientific and software teams to implement and support best practices and optimal utilization of the informatics and data management resources. 
Documents and trains scientific staff/end users on best practices and compliance policies related to the scientific data system and data handling.

 Qualifications and Education

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Chemistry and a minimum of 2 years’ related experience working with data management software in the biopharmaceutical industry or similar data management software or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

 Skills and Abilities

 Working experience with programming languages (Python, C/C++, Java, Perl). 
Working experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Spotfire). 
Basic knowledge of databases like SQL, PostgreSQL. 
Working knowledge of ELN / LIMS / Molecule Registration systems.
 Demonstrated experience with Information Technology standards and practices such as Change Management, SDLC, ITIL. 
Strong drive to work in data management including capturing, refining, annotating, characterizing, and storing data. 
Self-starter, team player, problem solver who is highly flexible and responsive to evolving project needs. 
Familiarity with using different API tools. 
Fluent in written and spoken English.
 Familiarity with proteins, protein expression and purification methods is an asset, as well as basic knowledge of experiments like mass spectroscopy, DSC, SPR, FACS, ELISA or other cell-based assays. 
Experience in negotiating software requirements within and across research departments and translating those requirements to software solutions. 
Experience in the capture and management of high throughput experimental data. 
Experience working with / building ETL tools and familiarity with data warehousing concepts

 NOTE TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES: Zymeworks values our relationships with our Recruitment Partners. We will only accept resumes from those partners whom have been contracted by a member of our Human Resources team to collaborate with us. Zymeworks is not responsible for any fees related to resumes that are unsolicited or are received without contract.
 #LI-PT1

Title: Inventory Analyst, Returns
Description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.  Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

 What you will be doing:

 Perform analysis and transformation of various internal and external data sets with the aim of generating actionable insights,
 Execute inventory transactions, adjustments, and entry. Focus on Reverse Logistics Warehouse processes.
 Coordinate master data updates , Generate status update reports
 Collaborate with key stakeholders to define and continuously improve operational effectiveness , Develop close working relationships
 Identify opportunities to reduce costs and unnecessary transactions, support internal and external customers
 Ability to communicate effectively with product owners and other project team members.
 Work independently within tight deadlines.
 Analyze and develop business requirements, process documentation and process flows for ad-hoc, on demand, and standard reports.


 Job Qualifications:

 This is a dynamic and demanding role requiring commitment and energy and is appropriate for a high potential individual who has upward mobility aspirations.
 Must have 3-5 years relevant work experience.
 Strong time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and objectives.
 Excellent analytical, problem solving, planning and organizational skills are a must.
 Strong attention to detail and exacting quality standards.
 Highly effective communication skills (oral and written), coupled with strong presentation skills.
 Strong analytical capability with the ability to work with cross-functional teams to identify issues and implement corrective actions
 Excellent understanding of business professionalism and the ability to multi task and adapt to a dynamic environment is required.
 Advanced MS Excel, PowerPoint and Access.
 Experience building, maintaining and modifying scripts through Python or similar programming tools.
 Knowledge of Power BI, Tableau or other visualization tools an asset.



 Schedule: Full time
 

 Shift: Day
 

 Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
 

 Work Location: 855 York Mills Rd. (022), North York, ON
 

 Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
 

 Posting Category/Function: Supply Chain / Logistics & Logistics Management
 

 Requisition ID: 271434
 



 Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:




 Our people are at the heart of our success
 Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
 We do what’s right, each and every day
 We believe in the power of new ideas
 We work as one team, with one vision
 We give back to our communities and protect our environment



 What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.  Posting Notes: Corporate || Canada (CA) || ON || North York || [[mfield2]] ||

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Dept./Br.: Marketing Dept.
Job Title: Business Data Analyst
Reports to: Manager /Vice President
Job Summary

Analyze business related data to provide effective and efficient marketing insights
Establish and develop business related data dashboard
Respond to various types of data analysis needs from the management
Prepare and manage various data reports related to customer, products, services, etc.
Perform back-up tasks and other ad-hoc duties as assigned

Responsibilities And Duties

Conduct various data-work and analysis on business items (business volume, customers, products/services, etc.)
Establish, develop, and manage business-oriented data dashboard
Prepare the Bank’s performance analysis reports (periodic / ad-hoc)
Organize and manage marketing and business database
Provide stakeholders with applicable analysis data tools
Evaluate the branch KPIs and promotion/campaign performances
Participate in departmental occasions and activities
Perform back-up tasks and ad-hoc duties as assigned

Skills

Excellent knowledge of Excel (incl. VBA) and other analysis tools and/or programs
Ability to utilize SQL and Power BI is a strong asset
Strong analytical skills in business numbers
Ability to work independently or collaboratively as part of a team
Ability to manage and take ownership of numerous data handling simultaneously
Bi-lingual in Korean & English

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

Company pension
Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
Vision care

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

Marketing: 1 year (preferred)

Language:

Korean (required)

Application deadline: 2022-07-22

Title: Data Scientist/Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist/Analyst Intern 

Department: Workforce Management Team 

Work Term & Duration: Fall 4 or 8 months 

Location: Virtual 

 Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale. Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity. 


Benefits for Students:


Experience working for one of the fastest growing Human Capital Management technology companies in the world
Access to Ceridian’s development programs and resources
Ability to work with as well as create relationships with members across the globe
Autonomy to bring forth new ideas and optimize existing structures within the organization
Meaningful responsibilities, enabling you to obtain ‘real-world’ experience
Dynamic hands-on exposure to multiple business-units and stakeholders across Ceridian

Summary:
 The Dayforce Product Development team is looking for an intern data scientist or analyst to create the industry’s next generation Human Capital Management (HCM) solutions. 
This is an excellent opportunity to help shape, direct, and make your mark on a product that impacts thousands of clients and millions of people worldwide. If you're interested in data and algorithms, have vision to see possibilities, want to see your creation utilized by thousands of people all over the world, and possess one or more of the following qualifications, we want to talk to you. 


Primary Responsibilities:


As a scientist/analyst on our Workforce Management team you will be working on our ground-breaking solution that helps companies increase their efficiencies through tracking time and attendance and intelligent scheduling of their employees.
You will use your knowledge and expertise to help research and add machine learning capabilities to the Dayforce product.
Your impact will be evident through your effective participation in the entire lifecycle of our software including design, analysis, prototyping, development, testing and support of our products.
You will work closely and collaborate with clients, prospects, implementation partners, and Dayforce personnel to envision and deliver the required functionality.

Qualifications:


Experience implementing machine learning models either as a standalone system or as a service
Knowledge of SQL and an understanding of relational database systems
Highly organized, disciplined self-starter, capable of working independently and in close collaboration within an agile development team
Passion for experimentation and analysis
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills required
Experience with Python is helpful
Experience working with Azure is helpful
 We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com or follow us on LinkedIn to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you! 

 Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. 

 We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.
 


   Job Title: Business Analyst Intern
 


   Location: Mississauga
 


   Who We Are
 


   At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software.
 

   To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done.
 


   What We’re Looking For
  
 Reporting to the Manager Reporting and Analytics, the Business Analyst will get an opportunity to be an integral part of the Business Planning and Analysis team as they will utilize data and provide insights that will help shape the overall Business Strategy.
 

   Experience with modeling, data analysis, mining and reporting including Microsoft Power BI along with a strong understanding of overall business operations is a definite plus.
 

 What’s in it for you?
 


 The People - From our humble origins in our founder’s basement, to our industry leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation and fun.
 


 The Growth - Our environment fosters new ideas, fresh perspectives, and the ability to take them over the goal line. SOTI is a fast-paced environment with a global reach that encourages you to make your mark and be part of something big!
 


 The Technology - You’ll get the chance to work with leading edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects, as part of highly collaborative and agile teams. You will work alongside SOTI’s partners which include leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies.
 


   What You’ll Do
 



     Proactively manage data quality and integrity issues to ensure accurate and timely reporting
   


     Identify areas of process/data improvement in partnership with all relevant stakeholder groups, and work with internal stakeholders to implement process improvements
   


     Liaise with the Business Intelligence team on generation of sales reports, system fixes and master data updates
   


     Assist quarterly quota setting process
   


     Discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision making by inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modelling data
   


     Create and update process documentation on process workflows
   


     Support team transformation projects
   


     Ad-hoc reporting and analysis, as required
   



   Experience You’ll Bring
 



     Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
   


     In depth knowledge of Excel is required, with a specific focus on reporting and dashboards
   


     Superior time management skills, including the ability to effectively multi-task, prioritize workflow amid multiple interruptions and work under pressure to meet concurrent deadlines
   


     Previous experience with software companies and SaaS business models is an asset
   


     Strong interpersonal, leadership and communication skills
   


     Able to work well independently and within team environment
   



   #LI-MV1
 


   About SOTI
 


   SOTI is the world's most trusted provider of mobile and 
  
   IoT management
   solutions, with more than 17,000 enterprise customers and millions of devices managed worldwide. SOTI's innovative portfolio of solutions and services provide the tools organizations need to truly mobilize their operations and optimize their mobility investments. SOTI extends 
  
   secure mobility management
   to provide a total, flexible solution for comprehensive management and security of all mobile devices and connected peripherals deployed in an organization.
 


   At SOTI, we celebrate the uniqueness of our global teams and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are curious problem solvers who are committed to bringing the best mobile and IoT management solutions to market. We offer careers with #EndlessPossibilities.
 

   What are you waiting for? Apply today: 
  
   https://www.soti.net/careers
  



   If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today.
 


 We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the requirements under the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at 

careers@soti.net

.



 Please note that SOTI does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with agency/recruiter, SOTI will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst - (Remote)
Description:
Mattermost is an open source platform for secure collaboration across the entire software development lifecycle. Hundreds of thousands of developers around the globe trust Mattermost to increase their productivity by bringing together team communication, task and project management, and workflow orchestration into a unified platform for agile software development.
 


 Founded in 2016, Mattermost’s open source platform powers over 800,000 workspaces worldwide with the support of over 4,000 contributors from across the developer community. The company serves over 800 customers, including European Parliament, NASA, Nasdaq, Samsung, SAP, United States Air Force and Wealthfront, and is backed by world-class investors including Battery Ventures, Redpoint, S28 Capital, YC Continuity. To learn more, visit www.mattermost.com.
 


 We value high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on customer success. If these values match who you are, we hope you'll learn more about working at Mattermost and apply!
 


 Mattermost is seeking a passionate data enthusiast to lead our Marketing data analytics. As a data-driven organization, Mattermost relies on our data team to drive marketing insights, ensure accurate data across systems, iterate on current key business metrics, and dive into complex datasets to answer business-critical questions.
 

   In this role, you will work closely with the marketing, sales, product, and engineering organizations to deeply understand customer trends, analyze marketing activities, product adoption, and sales results in order to surface insights that impact the health of the overall business. If you are data-obsessed, love connecting the dots, thrive in an iterative environment, and aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty with data, this is the role for you.
 


 About Our Tools


   Tool Stack: Marketo, Salesforce, Wordpress, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Optimize, Snowflake, dbt, Stitch, Hightouch, Looker, Google Sheets/Excel, etc.
 

   Coding Languages: SQL, Python, LookML
 
 Duties and Resonsibilities:

 Work with the Marketing team to quantitatively understand problems and potential solutions; analyze disparate data sets in creative ways to generate new understandings of our business.
 Maintain and enhance analytics infrastructure including data models and visualization tools at Mattermost in cooperation with analysts across the organization.
 Analyze the performance of campaign launches and experiments using analytics tools, data platforms, and internal databases.
 Ensure the highest levels of data quality, organization, and reliability.
 Examine funnel performance, identify issues before they become problems, and suggest solutions.
 Use historical data to forecast future performance in real time.
 Surface analytical insights: proactively investigate root causes of aberrant data, and identify opportunities for optimization.
 Support design and implementation of experimentation necessary to improve channel efficiency, drive growth, and inform marketing investment decisions.
 Build and maintain dashboards that will capture the Marketing team’s performance against our success metrics.
 Participate in the definition and measurement of KPIs that will drive the company’s success.
 Assist in training new hires and colleagues on the workings of Mattermost’s data and what it means to be a data-driven culture.
 Lead strategic cross-functional data initiatives to stitch together Mattermost customer journey data for internal analytics consumption.
 Partner with the Data Engineering team to ensure relevant data is centralized into our data warehouse and modeled for performant analytics, while meeting our high data-quality standards.


 Required Background and Skills:

 4+ years experience with complex data analysis, visualization, and dashboards as part of full-time work, college coursework, personal projects, internships, or research
 Extensive experience with SQL
 Demonstrated experience using a data visualization tool such as Looker or Tableau to visualize and model raw data sets
 Able to proactively engage, communicate, and collaborate with cross-functional business stakeholders
 Deep understanding of marketing tactics, including campaigns and marketing channels such as SEM, SEO, Social, Events, Display, Content, and Email
 Knowledge of digital tagging methodologies and tracking. Expertise in new/emerging technologies in digital tracking (URL, cookies, cookie-less approaches).
 Experience applying probability and statistics to real-world problems; applied experience in experimentation design, A/B testing and/or probabilistic modeling a plus
 Passion for data and analytics
 Logical and analytical abilities to help solve problems and derive insights from data
 Resourceful, self-motivated, and able to successfully complete multiple competing projects under tight deadlines
 Experience using dbt or other data transformation tools
 Python experience
 Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Business, or related discipline



 Mattermost is a remote-first company with staff living and working across the globe. We are currently hiring staff in these countries/regions:
 


 Australia - Bangladesh - Brazil - Bulgaria - Canada - Chile - Colombia - Finland - Georgia - Germany - Greece - India - Ireland - Mauritius - Mexico - Norway - Pakistan - Philippines - Poland - Portugal - Spain - South Korea - Suriname - Turkey - Uganda - Ukraine - United Kingdom - United States



 We are constantly working towards adding more countries/regions to this list, but first we need to make sure we are compliant with local laws and regulations, which takes time.
 


 Mattermost is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people from all walks of life. We don't discriminate against staff or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

Title: Business Analyst I
Description:
Department: Parks & Environment Employee Group: Teamsters Local 31 Location: 4515 Central Boulevard, Burnaby Salary Range/ Wage Rate: PG 28 $3,246.55 - $3,835.98 bi-weekly
 Our Parks & Environment Department is seeking a Business Analyst I who will manage existing and future Air Quality, Liquid Waste and Solid Waste Bylaw software applications (custom and vendor), which includes tracking the development of new bylaws and bylaw amendments, developing priorities, scheduling and submitting IT work requests and support officer in the use of implemented solutions – trouble-shooting issues, managing user accounts (new and existing), “how to” assistance, tracking requested improvements.
 You are: an experienced IT professional who has a keen interest in helping protect the environment as well as the health and safety of workers and the public. You have the ability to deliver against pre-set deadlines, able to work with senior management facilitating meetings and provide IT information to them they need to know.
 This role:

Assesses business plans or coordinates business systems planning, in client departments; provides advice regarding MVRD technologies; identifies priorities, resource requirements and opportunities for application of technologies; gathers and analyzes data; documents current and alternative business processes using CASE tools.
Acts as project manager regarding the development of information systems and implementation of technology; conducts fit/gap analysis; defines workflows and functional and system specifications; prepares project schedules and deadlines; documents requirements, prepares business cases, conducts feasibility studies, and analyzes cost effectiveness; prepares requests for proposals, selects suppliers and monitors post-implementation system performance.
Acts as a liaison between client departments and contractors; communicates with software vendors regarding enterprise software updates; coordinates with technical staff to implement approved changes in enterprise systems; collects and creates business requirement documents; translates business requirements into technical specifications and configuration requirements; tracks and follows up on requests and product deficiencies; assists in the resolution of service problems and issues; participates in the development of disaster recovery plans.
Leads and participates in User Acceptance Testing; coordinates releases of new versions, communicates enhancements to users; provides easy to understand supporting documentation to users; develops and implements training programs for various user departments in the use of new or revised systems.
Supports implemented solutions by managing user accounts, trouble-shooting issues, configuring, tracking requested improvements and providing “how-to” assistance.
Prepares reports and makes presentations related to the work performed; conducts product and market research to maintain up-to-date knowledge of developments in the information technology industry.
Performs related duties as required.

 To be successful, you have:

University graduation at the Bachelor’s level in computer sciences, business or engineering plus sound related experience in business systems analysis; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
A minimum of five years of related experienced considered an asset.
Certification from the International Institute of Business Analysis considered an asset.
Recent experience working in an agile environment and experience working on custom development projects considered an asset.
Considerable knowledge of problem definition and analysis related to business processes and systems planning.
Considerable knowledge of the principles and practices of administrative management and project management.
Considerable knowledge of information technology components, processes and developments.
Considerable knowledge of the functions of departments served and their requirements in information technology.
Considerable knowledge of departmental policies and procedures.
Ability to document, analyze and assess a variety of information, identify priorities and resources and propose alternative business processes.
Ability to act as project manager regarding the development and implementation of systems.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal contacts and to provide advice and assistance on matters related to the work.
Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing and to present proposals in non-technical language.
Ability to perform assigned duties under minimum supervision.

 Able to proactively engage, communicate, and collaborate with cross-functional business stakeholders

Considerable knowledge of information technology components, processes and developments.
Considerable knowledge of the functions of departments served and their requirements in information technology.
Considerable knowledge of departmental policies and procedures.
Ability to document, analyze and assess a variety of information, identify priorities and resources and propose alternative business processes.
Ability to act as project manager regarding the development and implementation of systems.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal contacts and to provide advice and assistance on matters related to the work.
Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing and to present proposals in non-technical language.
Ability to perform assigned duties under minimum supervision.

Title: Data Analyst
Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Company Profile
Home Capital Group Inc., together with its operating subsidiary Home Trust Company, has developed a track record of success as Canada’s leading alternative lender, employing nearly 800 people in our Toronto headquarters and branches across the country. Building on the demonstrated strength of our core residential and commercial mortgage lending business, the Company and its affiliates also offer complementary lending services and competitive deposit investment products. Our culture has been shaped by the passion and integrity of our people. Home Trust is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Home Capital Group, trading on the TSX under the symbol HCG.
Position Responsibilities

Data Profiling and Quality Analysis – This role is responsible for the development and maintenance of automated data quality rules, both in detail and with dashboard metrics and KPIs.
Validation and Troubleshooting – Ensure that data quality rules are accurately built using validation tools (Informatica Data Quality) and develop an in-depth understanding of source systems and EDW data structures to further define rules.
Root Cause Analysis – Track, investigate, and analyse root cause of data quality issues, ensuring data quality issues and remediation plans are communicated to all necessary stakeholders.
Data Issue Remediation – Assist and support the DMO team and the D&A Team overall, as required, to correct and/or remediate data quality issues in systems of record (e.g. ERP applications) based on business priorities.
Ensure data quality management and lineage processes adhere to related Home Trust strategies, policies, standards, and guidelines.
Participate in Risk, Audit, Compliance and Regulatory requests for the D&A team as required.
Develop and implement data quality test scripts, DQ reports, and identify defects using DQ rules based on prescribed DQ dimensions and Data Steward direction.
Investigate root causes of data quality issues and resolve/remediate data quality incidents by working with Data Stewards, the business and IT teams as required.
Work closely with business and IT to ensure new data quality requirements are understood and documented effectively.

Formal EducationPost secondary degree or diploma required (University degree preferred) in Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalentCertification(s)/Designation(s) preferred in related areaRelated Experience
Must Have: 1-3 years of related Data Management or Business Intelligence experience1-3 years of experience analyzing, profiling, reporting and managing data issues for large data sets.1-3 years of experience with SQL, Python, JavaScript programing and/or equivalent technical skills.Demonstrated understanding of data management principles and practices.Experience with data quality and data governance procedures and practices
Nice to Have: Experience with Informatica data management software.Experience with SAP data management software.Proficiency in Power BI.Familiarity with Azure Cloud Modern Data Warehouse architectures.Knowledge of and experience in the Financial industry.SkillsSecurity Incident and Event ManagementStrategic/forward thinkingAnalytical thinkingAttention to detail/ accuracyMulti-tasking in fast paced, deadline driven environmentCommunication (verbal and written) - excellentCollaboratingQuality focusedPosition ComplexitiesBilingualism an assetSome work beyond standard hoursAcknowledgement
All employees of Home Capital Group Inc. must comply with all applicable Home Capital Group Inc, Home Trust Company, and specific Line of Business policies, standards, guidelines and controls. Additionally, all employees are obligated to become familiar with Home’s risk management framework and understand the operational risk management requirements within their specific business. Employees are also expected to understand and comply with the Company’s Code of Business Conduct & Ethics Policy at all times and escalate any issues or concerns through various reporting channels (i.e. Ombudsman, Compliance Hotline, Whistleblower Policy, etc).
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Analyst - Chapter Lead - Up to $160,000

Business Analyst - Chapter Lead
Structure: Permanent Full Time
Location: Toronto, Montreal, Ottawa, Moncton
Fluent French & English Speaking Required (Ideally)

Title: Data Analyst, Health Surveillance - BC Centre for Disease Control
Description:
Data Analyst, Health Surveillance


   BC Centre for Disease Control
 

   Vancouver BC
 



 As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.




   This position supports Data and Analytic Services initiatives. The scope of this role and assignments varies and may be focused on COVID-19 surveillance, integrated administrative datasets, public health lab surveillance, infectious disease modeling and other priorities and initiatives. Strong programing skills in R, Python and/or SAS preferred. Experience with data science/machine learning, visualization or infectious disease dynamic modelling tools desirable.
 


 What you’ll do




Perform data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, transformation, and documentation.
Develop and maintain data collection and recording systems such as databases, spreadsheets, and web-sites, including designing ad hoc reports.
Write computer code and data queries to capture and edit data, and/or liaises with information systems department for same.
Create analytic reporting tools to allow internal and external users to analyze data.
Receive and respond to ongoing requests to evaluate data, systems, processes and procedures.
Automate routine data management tasks using standard programming tools.
Perform descriptive analyses and produces summaries and analytical reports using statistical software and coding, identifying all data limitations that apply.
Identify issues, trends, and developments.
Communicate findings to Centre staff and external stakeholders at the local, provincial and federal level.
Automate routine analyses using standard programming tools.
Monitor data quality in the information systems like the Public Health Information System and disease databases, proactively identify and communicate anomalies that indicate data quality issues, and ensure that data used for analysis purposes or distributed to stakeholders is of the highest quality possible.
Follow up with regional health authorities on missing, erroneous, and duplicate data to achieve high quality data.
Correct data errors in a timely manner.
Document processes for these procedures.




 What you bring




Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Science or Computer Science or equivalent.
Three (3) years’ experience as a data analyst/scientist, preferably in community health and/or the health information field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.




   You also have the ability to:
 



Write data management and analysis programs using data programming tools such as SAS or R.
Manage and querying data in large relational or multidimensional databases and data warehouses an asset.
Create data visualizations.
Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
Operate related equipment
Carry out the duties of the position.
Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.




   You have knowledge of:
 

Standard software packages, spreadsheet, statistical, graphical, database, communication and web software.
PC systems and applications.
Descriptive statistics
Health-related terminology.




 What we bring




   Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
 

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.




 Job Type: Regular, Full-Time
  
Wage: $36.41 to $38.49 per hour
  
Location: 655 West 12th Avenue, Vancouver BC, V5Z 4R4
  
Hours of Work: Monday-Friday; 0830-1630
  
Requisition # 128325E
 



 What we do




   The BC Centre for Disease Control (BCCDC) is dedicated to preventing and controlling communicable diseases and promoting environmental health for the province of BC. BCCDC is part of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA).
 



   The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.
 



   Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
 



   PHSA and BCCDC are committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.
 



 ATTN: PHSA Employees:




   To be considered as a PHSA employee (internal applicant) for this position, 
  you must apply online via your internal profile at http://internaljobs.phsa.ca
 



   Please note the internal job posting will no longer be accessible after the expiry date of
   July 14, 2022. If the internal job posting has expired, please contact the Internal Jobs Help Desk and advise that you would like to be considered as a late internal applicant for this position. 
  Please do not apply for the external job posting.




   If you have not registered your internal profile, a password is required to log in for the first time. To obtain your password, please contact the 
  Internal Jobs Help Desk at 604-875-7264 or 1-855-875-7264. Please note regular business hours are Monday – Friday (excluding stats), 8:30am to 4:30pm. For inquiries outside of regular business hours, please email the Internal Jobs Help Desk at internaljobshelpu@phsa.ca and a Help Desk Representative will contact you the next business day.

Title: Technical Business Analyst/ Data Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 156361  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team 
Scotiabank’s Financial Crimes and Operation Risk Engineering is responsible for running global services that provide the design and delivery for AML technology solutions to meet our Financial Crime regulatory requirements in the different jurisdictions that Scotiabank operates in.

 The Role 

The Advisory Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for designing data mapping solutions, data profiling and data analysis and working closely with the AML business partners to implement AML data solutions


 Some of the key accountabilities include:

 Works with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies
 Takes requirements and does some data analysis work using SQL
 Gathers requirements from business units and translates those to programmers and developers
 Translates requirements for developers by creating out the mapping documents
 Work with QA to address comments and concerns and relay requirements and goals
 Demonstrates an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities
 Supports one or more highly complex business processes
 Works on multiple projects as a project team member
 Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs
 Create business solutions that increase competitive advantage
 Exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions


 What You Will Bring to Succeed
 
Must have skills:

 5 years of experience in a similar Business/Data Systems analyst background – preferably within a FI or related large enterprise
 3 years of experience analyzing data using SQL
 3 years of experience working in data projects
 3 years of experience in AML/KYC


 Nice to have skills:

 Basic knowledge of programming languages in order to comprehend reading code and basic functions
 Ability to analyze complex situations and problems and do the necessary research using multiple sources of information to arrive at innovative solutions
 Self-starter that actively engages issues seeking resolution, ability to meet dynamic changes on prioritization
 Ability to manage assigned tasks and expectations without direct instruction or oversight
 Fast, adaptable learner who can hit the ground running
 Ability to work well under pressure while demonstrating strong professionalism
 Excellent communications skills to coordinate with high ranking individuals internally (Director, VP level and up) 

Strong investigation, prioritization, and organization skills 

Candidate must have an open mind when it comes to approach, and be able to assess each situation separately
 Must be able to collaborate closely with a team at times, while also being capable of holding themselves accountable to meet individual deadlines without hand holding


 The Workplace

 We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work 
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! 
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world 
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
 We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results 
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation

 
Scotiabank
 As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

 Is this Role not the Exact fit? 
Sign up to stay in touch; we’ll let you know when we have new positions on the team.

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: BUSINESS ANALYST
Description:
Do you enjoy working with data and analysing information to solve problems and identify opportunities? Are you able to create data visualizations using a variety of tools? Can you work with large data sets and help identify how to integrate them to find new insights and ask new questions we hadn't thought about before? Are you interested in modernizing our use of data analytics and how we visualize information for better evidence-based decision-making? If so, consider this opportunity with the Strategy and Results Management Branch (SRMB).
  

About us
 The Strategy and Results Management Branch (SRMB) works with program areas and as part of an integrated corporate team to create greater transparency and accountability and promotes working in the open. Within SRMB, the Strategy and Delivery Unit (SDU) is focused on supporting MGCS executives by leading strategic planning activities and providing results management information to help manage the successful delivery of ministry initiatives.
  

Why work for the Ontario Public Service?
 The Ontario Public Service (OPS) is one of the largest employers in the province, employing more than 60,000 people. We have a wide range of meaningful and rewarding career opportunities in communities across Ontario. We welcome new ideas and new people, encourage learning and development, and reward achievement.
  

We offer:


Competitive compensation and benefits
Collegial and professional work culture 
Career growth and development opportunities across multiple business areas 
We provide on-the-job training to support your success in the role

 OPS Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Anti-Racism: We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.
  
 We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.
  
 Visit the 
  OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the 
  OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.
  
 We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's 
  Human Rights Code. Refer to the "How to apply" section if you require a disability-related accommodation.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role? In this role, you will:
  

assist in data analysis as well as the creation and management of data and information management tools created with Excel, SharePoint, etc.
create interactive dashboards and data visualizations to communicate key data and findings to senior leaders and key stakeholders using tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, etc. 
provide analysis and recommendations on initiatives, operations, and services
participate in the design and implementation of a results management framework, service delivery strategies and business solutions
assist with project plan development, monitor projects and establish work/project priorities.
liaise with senior management, clients and business consultants to advise on programs, service delivery, and priorities
assist in the preparation of research reports and business cases
support governance, oversight, and results management tables across MGCS

 How do I qualify?
 Data Analysis, Visualization, and Problem Solving Skills:

You have the ability to create dashboards and reports that succinctly summarize data and information so insights are easy to communicate, leaders know where to focus their attention and are able to make data-driven decisions
You have experience creating data visualizations and interactive reports using PowerBI, Tableau or other similar software 
You have experience analysing and reviewing data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities (i.e. potentially identifying the data set, key performance indicators, and/or other measures that may be required for the analysis)
You have experience providing analysis, establishing priorities, and monitoring multiple projects often with conflicting work demands, timelines and deliverables
You have experience conducting research and analysis and providing recommendations that address client needs and program requirements
You have analytical and problem solving skills to ensure business processes, tools and techniques are aligned with business standards, current trends and best practices
You have experience integrating, consolidating, and creating reports using data from different sources, in different formats, and of varying degrees of quality; as well as working with stakeholders on simplify data management and improve data quality

 Communication, Relationship Building and Consultation Skills:

You have consultation skills to effectively exchange information with stakeholders, convey priorities, identify issues and emerging trends
You have the ability to design and create presentations, reports, and dashboards utilizing data visualizations to clearly and easily communicate information to senior and executive audiences
You have written communication skills to prepare a variety of reports and draft materials utilized in decision-making as well as in communicating broadly to large audiences
You have collaboration skills to obtain understanding and consensus on new and proposed business processes, tools and solutions
You have experience managing and building relationships while managing a portfolio of clients

 Computer Skills:

You are proficient with spreadsheet tools (e.g. Excel) – with the ability to create templates, trackers, and other documents to support data gathering, consolidation, and analysis
You are experienced with data analysis and visualization software (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
You are proficient with word processing, spreadsheet, database and presentation software to prepare reports, presentations, briefing materials and to conduct research

 Technical Knowledge:

You have knowledge to assist in the preparation of dashboards, reports, research reports and business cases
You have knowledge of business process development and improvement
You have knowledge of performance measurement methodology and practices. 
You have knowledge of project management standards and methodologies
You have the ability to interpret and apply knowledge of legislation, policies and procedures to assist in strategic planning and business development
You have the ability to gather and create technical and business requirements
You have knowledge of strategic planning and policy development processes, tools and techniques to contribute in discussions on strategic planning




Additional Information:



Address:



1 Temporary, duration up to 18 months, 777 Bay St, Toronto, Toronto Region








Compensation Group:


     Association of Management, Administrative and Professional Crown Employees of Ontario 
    







      Understanding the job ad - definitions
     
Schedule:


     6 
    






Category:


     Consulting and Planning 
    






Posted on:


     Tuesday, July 5, 2022
