Title: Business Analyst
Description:
REW is delighted to be looking for another Business Analyst to join our team of phenomenal employees. Our Business Analysts are enthusiastic go-getters who love to collaborate with their peers and stakeholders and can inspire action in those around them. They have a knack for creating valuable partnerships by building meaningful relationships and help ensure the success of everyone they work with. As part of our high tech, high performing team, we move fast and love to keep things exciting, so there's rarely a dull moment.What you bring: A great team starts with the right people. You are great at collaborating and building relationships with project teams and stakeholders. You lead by example, are willing to be hands on when necessary, and are always looking for ways to improve and deliver the best results possible.What you will get in return: REW values excellence and recognizes achievements. Results are rewarded by competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and amazing opportunities/projects. From time to time, we may ask for you to step in and step up to support your team, working business hours and then some. We appreciate and give back for your extra efforts. As a hybrid workplace, we understand flexibility is important, and offer the opportunity to work remotely. You will work with an amazing team (REW team members are the BEST), who always strive to make a difference, and consistently live our core values: Always be Awesome, Customer Success, and Innovation.Key Responsibilities: 

Collaborate with CEO and VP of Product to translate business requirements into user stories
Work with VP of Product to build and communicate the Product Roadmap with teams and stakeholders
Ensure that the VP of Product have the data analysis necessary to make informed decisions during the product delivery life cycle
Conduct cost benefit analysis to prioritize queued requirements, issues and tasks on the product roadmap
Lead ongoing reviews of delivery processes, and help develop optimization strategies
Build business cases and conduct sessions for stakeholders to introduce new products, processes and tools
Gather feedback from stakeholders and customers (through REW forums) and share with the product team in an understandable format

Preference will be given to candidates who possess: 

5 years' experience in business analysis or a related field
Understanding of different Project Management methodologies (specifically Agile) is desirable
Familiarity with project management tools (JIRA, GITLAB, Trello etc.)
Data driven approach for decision making
Excellent facilitation, organizational, communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills
Proven track record of solving complex problems with a natural analytical way of thinking

The competencies required for you to be successful in this role are: Adjusts thinking and behavior in order to adapt to changes in the job and work environment to demonstrate* Flexibility and Managing Uncertainty*. The Business Analyst will be skilled at managing uncertainty in an unstructured environment, and relied on to encourage the Product team to embrace and contribute to change.Considers, prioritizes, and takes action on the needs of both internal and external customers to demonstrate* Customer Focus*. The Business Analyst will be relied on to build strong relationships internally and externally, creating an environment where employees are empowered to put customers first.Organization and execution to meet objectives on time, with high quality and process follow-through are expected to demonstrate the Planning and Results Orientation competency. The Business Analyst will be relied on to inspire the Product team to meet stretch goals by taking initiative to set priorities, ensuring focus remains on achieving the most positive outcomes possible.Thinks beyond the confines of traditional models to recognize opportunities and find new and better ways of doing things to demonstrate the* Creativity and Innovation* competency. The Business Analyst will be relied on to explore different opportunities to creatively tackle challenges, building an environment that empowers the team to champion improvements.Do you enjoy bringing order to chaos, keeping your peers on track, and making a difference for your team? If so, we'd love to learn more.Real Estate Webmasters: Real Estate Webmasters knows what it takes to create a phenomenal online experience and achieve incredible results. With 16 years' experience working exclusively within the real estate sector, REW has partnered with top brands, elevating their digital presence and increasing their success.
Client products & services offered by Real Estate Webmasters include Websites, CRM, Databases, Apps, Property Listing Data Integration, Lead Generation, Search Engine Optimization, and Pay Per Click Advertising. REW's Clients include individual agents, brokers, teams, and enterprise brokerages; all of whom may choose to have Property Listings data displayed on their websites.Our Values: You care about delivering great service to your Clients whether they are internal or external. That's how you contribute to our Customer Success value.You are open minded and are curious to learn. Doing things more efficiently and better is how you could demonstrate our Innovation value.Even when the days are tough, you remain positive and helpful. Treating your colleagues in a supportive way is how you demonstrate our Always be Awesome value.Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please advise when submitting your application.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: IT Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description Block is one company built from many blocks, all united by the same purpose of economic empowerment. The blocks that form our foundational teams — People, Finance, Counsel, Hardware, Information Security, Platform Infrastructure Engineering, and more — provide support and guidance at the corporate level. They work across business groups and around the globe, spanning time zones and disciplines to develop inclusive People policies, forecast finances, give legal counsel, safeguard systems, nurture new initiatives, and more. Every challenge creates possibilities, and we need different perspectives to see them all. Bring yours to Block. 


 Job Description
  The IT Logistics team at Block is responsible for helping to provide the necessary equipment & devices to our team members, across all business units, to help them maintain productivity and creativity. The scope of our services include IT hardware and software procurement, asset management, vendor relationship management, including, but not limited to laptops, desktops, monitors, and all supporting peripherals/accessories. We help to manage the entire product lifecycle of these corporate engineering devices, from vendor selection, vendor onboarding, asset database management, inventory & storeroom management, forecasting, procurement, receive/deploy, and end of life.
 Our mission is to enable our global customers to get the tools they need quickly and easily, while also looking out for Block’’s best interests as a business. Deliver hardware and software to new hires and existing customers as a seamless experience. Protect the business through vendor and asset lifecycle management. Constantly examine and evolve our practices to scale with the needs of our rapidly growing company.
 You will:

 Quickly immerse themselves in the daily operations of IT Logistics program to identify the key measurable performance data points within each of the processes (~50+)
 Collaborate within IT Logistics teams and relevant supporting teams to document business requirements
 Engage with cross functional internal partners to gain access to available API’s and data sets.
 Build relationships between data sets across multiple systems to enrich and validate available data
 Model analysis in Google Sheets and/or Excel to vet analysis and prove proof of concept
 Mature regularly required analysis to migrate from manual efforts to self-service dashboards, automated reports, and build triggers/notifications within the environment to push information, rather than pull it
 Vet the available tools within the environment for workflow automation, and apply / implement to the repeatable tasks to simplify daily operations for the IT Logistics team
 Focus on high impact results and scalability, while attempting to improve wherever possible
 Prepare analysis in an easily consumable format, appropriate for the audience, with ability to communicate the narrative behind the data
 Learn and maintain comprehensive knowledge of the operations that drive operational data to contribute to data-based decision making
 Understand high level goals with the ability to break them into smaller, more manageable tasks to contribute to gaining efficiency as an ongoing effort
 Ability to shift priorities quickly, as the business environment evolves, and deliver results on daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly cadence
 Engage with external partners, as needed, to assist in normalizing data from the source and creating long term, self service solutions
 Lead & support ad-hoc inquiries related to pricing and contract negotiations, component quality, forecasting, vendor selection, relationship management, product lifecycle management, IT Logistics operations performance and supply assurance
 Leverage (and develop) best practices in business intelligence from the existing Square hardware practice (and other relevant teams).
 Work with operations on capacity planning, new product introduction readiness, product lifecycle management, forecasting and issue resolution.
 Communicate to the team and senior management about all ongoing efforts, and any potential disruptions which can affect our ability to support our teams
 Travel ~15%, mostly within the US, California




 Qualifications
 
 3-5 plus years experience in supply or inventory planning or business operations
 2 plus years experience in dashboard development and workflow automation using scripts
 Expertise in Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets, Tableau/Looker or relevant platform that can be easily translated to current available dashboarding/business intelligence tools
 Experience translating consumer demand into supply plans
 A persistent attention to detail
 Curiosity, and the ability to work independently on defining and achieving specific outcomes based on team’s goals
 Experience translating data into actionable information to drive results; proficiency in retail math
 Bachelor's degree in business, operations, or other relevant field or equivalent experience

 Additional Information
 
 We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
 We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.
 Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.
 Perks
 We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:

 Healthcare coverage
 Retirement Plans
 Employee Stock Purchase Program
 Wellness perks
 Paid parental leave
 Paid time off
 Learning and Development resources

 Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Title: PRICING ANALYST
Description:
Pricing Analyst is responsible for compiling data from various systems, performing variance analysis on costs and pricing, and preparing specialized reports to support the sales function.
 Responsibilities:

 Audit prices entered on orders ensuring compliance with established guidelines.
 Prepare order variance report.
 Compile data and prepare profitability reports by customer by product.
 Prepare future price lists.
 Prepare monthly sales reports.
 Perform costs comparisons and analysis
 Complete customers’ questionnaires relating RFI and third party database.
 Prepare performance tracker / scorecards for customers.
 Update costing system with price information
 Complete ad-hoc reports as required

 Qualifications:

 Must have Bachelor degree in Business or Commerce.
 Proficiency in MS Office with intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
 Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize.
 Ability to work independently and with little supervision in a high volume fast paced environment.

 Atlantic Packaging is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process.
 We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Quality Credit Analyst
Description:
Address: 100 King Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Business Management 
 
The Data Quality, Credit Analyst will be responsible for supporting the NA Commercial Banking team on the Data Quality Initiative. This person will be accountable to provide data quality oversight over inputs to the Commercial Lending Systems. Complying with current risk rating model methodology, policies and guidance to ensure risk ratings are replicable and that high quality data is being utilized for modeling and Bank's capital calculations. 


Supports the business/group leader in the effective implementation, maintenance and administration of first line of defense (1st LOD) programs. Contributes to a strong risk management culture through collaboration with other first line employees, and second & third line functions to ensure compliance, or operational risks are identified, mitigated, monitored and reported on an ongoing basis. 
Provides data quality oversight over inputs to the Commercial Lending systems. 
Provides direct feedback to the multiple business units, communicate clearly any issues in reference of policy and guidance. 
Assists with the implementation of risk management programs/ frameworks while identifying and minimizing negative impacts to the business. 
Acts as a subject matter expert in the evaluation, development and implementation of an internal control system. 
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. 
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues. 
Builds awareness, knowledge, and skills and, as necessary, provides communication, practical tools and ongoing support including making presentations, to promote a culture of risk identification and management. 
Supports the management of 1st LOD program for the business/group in compliance with appropriate principles, standards & direction from the second line of defense groups. 
Works with assigned business/group leaders to implement 1st LOD programs and frameworks, developing and maintaining an in-depth understanding of the applicable regulatory and internal risk management requirements. Interprets and provides advice on the application of the requirements for the business/group. 
M aintains an understanding of the business/group strategies and objectives, products and services, internal and external stakeholders and business processes as well as the underlying infrastructure to identify and manage implications and risk exposures for the business/group. 
Identifies, investigates, analyzes, documents & mitigates program risks, taking into account jurisdictional issues, and raises any issues or concerns to senior leaders and other stakeholders. 
Recommends adjustments to the overall program, policy or processes within the business/group in accordance with the Risk Appetite Statement, Governance and Corporate Policy. 
Supports the business/group through internal/external audits or regulatory examinations and assists in development of action plans to resolve any identified issues. 
Provides support to the development and delivery of training and awareness programs within the business/group to increase awareness of and compliance to risk management requirements. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. 


Qualifications: 

Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience 
Undergraduate university degree, with a focus in Finance/Accounting or another Business-related field 
Credit underwriting and/or financial spreading/analysis background is required 
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth 
Influence skills - In-depth 
Data driven decision making - In-depth 
Bilingual English/French Preferred but not required 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.
 By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.
 With over 3,000 employees and 60+ offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.
 At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.



 Job Description
  The Information Systems Data Analyst will be part of a design and development team that includes data analysts, data base developers, data architects and process automation team. The mission will be to develop and maintain data analytics tools using Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Apps, Microsoft SQL Server and other data management tools.
 Most of the Things You’ll Work On:

 Assist in designing and developing data analytics solutions using Microsoft Power BI
 Creating analytics models which consume data from different sources like relational SQL databases, Sharepoint, and other Microsoft tools
 Manage system and data tool security based on industry best practices
 Participate in reviews and enhancements of analytics tools developed by peers [QA / QC]
 Assist in the process of improving data analytics models with adherence to best practices related with performance and reliability
 Properly document functionality and technical specifications of the analytics products under their scope
 Capable of delivering full life cycle development of analytics tools, including identifying user requirements, processing and preparing the data by connecting to various data sources, building reports or dashboards to address the user requirements, testing and deployment, maintenance, user support etc
 Participate in and contribute to the design and development of best practices for data analytics models
 Research new products and technologies to enhance the process of development, testing and deployment of data analytics models
 Understands the interactions and dependencies among data and process components
 Communicates with various stakeholders to understand their requirements, share the results and findings
 Works collaboratively with Manager and team to forward plan workload
 Maintains awareness of multiple asks / competing priorities and proactively requests input from others (specifically immediate team / manager) to speed up or slow down various Epics within workload




 Qualifications
  You'll Need To Have:

 1 to 3 years of experience using Microsoft Power BI building dashboards and visualizations
 Strong knowledge of data warehouse concepts and architecture
 Strong proficiency in SQL with the ability to write complex queries
 Exceptional analytical skills
 Strong communication skills; able to communicate effectively with various stakeholders and with both technical and non-technical audiences
 Advanced Excel skills: pivot tables & Power Pivot. (Experience in macros and VBA is an asset)
 Previous working experience with data from an ERP application is highly preferred

 Additional Information
  We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.
 IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.
 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.
 We request applicants submit their RESUME highlighting relevant work experience. Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.
 #LI-PS2

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – Cognos Analytics
Description:
To help in our planned growth, we are pro-actively recruiting for a Business Intelligence Analyst for upcoming opportunities specific to the Cognos Analytics platform. The BI Analyst will be a key member of our IT Professional Services team. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers.
 Key Responsibilities:

 Conduct business requirements gathering and analysis, identify datasets to support analytics initiatives and expand the existing data warehouse.
 Collaborate with the BI team in detailed design including dynamic reports, executive dashboards, and information portals.
 Work with client stakeholders to support a BI environment that is critical for future decision making and evaluation.
 Review the existing architecture and data feeds and investigate the best approach to incorporate direct calls to source databases.
 Create reports in Cognos and provide Cognos Analytics support & training to data management staff.
 Ensure solutions meet the information, functionality, and performance needs of targeted users through testing

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst


 Job-Type- Full time

 Job Responsibilities



 Deliver flexible reusable and well maintained core data repositories

 Develop and maintain expertise in the Investment domain as well as expertise in accessing querying testing and validating data content to drive quality and consistency within solutions Partner with the Data Governance group to establish appropriate standards and methodologies template and tools related to documenting analyzing and testing data work with management to implement these standards within the IS and Data Governance organizations

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Pharm3r is a risk analytics company. We specialize in providing early insights into complex and interconnected drug, device, and supply chain risks. Pharm3r enables our clients to maximize patient safety and minimize financial exposure
 Our firm ingests large, healthcare related data sets, which are refreshed daily. We clean, map, and overlay this data with client specific information. Clients use our software for industry insights, risk ranking and data exploration.
 We are seeking a person, physically located within Halifax and surrounding areas, with interest in the healthcare sector, to join our Product and Consulting Services team. The position requires extensive research into medical device and medication databases. It involves locating accurate data, extracting key information, and generating engaging dashboards and visualizations.
 The ideal candidate has deep curiosity and is relentless in pursuit of solutions. This person:

 Thinks creatively and flexibly
 Communicates clearly
 Enjoys working with data, from finding new sources to solution-oriented analysis and visualization
 Possesses solid analytical and technical skills with a keen sense of accountability, ownership, and commitment to accuracy
 Familiarity with medical terminology, healthcare regulations and drug and medical device data sources is a plus.

 Pharm3r is based in New York with offices in Halifax. This hybrid position, based in Halifax, requires occasional face-time, COVID restrictions permitting, with team members in the Halifax area.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
At NRG, we’re bringing the power of energy to people and organizations by putting customers at the center of everything we do. We generate electricity and provide energy solutions and natural gas to millions of customers through our diverse portfolio of retail brands. A Fortune 500 company, operating in the United States and Canada, NRG delivers innovative solutions while advocating for competitive energy markets and customer choice, working towards a sustainable energy future. More information is available at www.nrg.com. Connect with NRG on Facebook, LinkedIn and follow us on Twitter @nrgenergy.
 Job Summary:
 The Business Analyst will work with both the Go-to-Market and Retention & Customer Management Teams focusing on the Direct Energy Regulated Services business.

 In supporting the Go-to-Market team, this role will support a wide range of commercially focused activities including contract lifecycle management, financial planning and reporting and the creation of strategic communications for internal stakeholders.

 In supporting the Retention & Customer Management Team, this role will support the development and delivery of the customer experience strategy along with planning and execution of all customer lifecycle, retention and acquisition activities. You will spearhead key initiatives and strategies for customer retention based on your analyses, launch proactive programs & campaigns, and perform post-mortem analyses to continuously learn from and improve results. The optimal candidate will be extremely organized, able to understand and organize analytics of retention campaigns as well as help develop, execute and deliver customer lifecycle campaigns from start to finish.

 Key to this role is a strategical and analytical mind, a passion for supporting our customers and can combine this with a strong commercial awareness to bring solutions to strategic issues and drive to completion.

 Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
 Go-to-Market:

 Financial modelling
 Presentation building
 Data and business analysis
 Contract review and drafting and timeline management
 Project management (able to manage multiple deliverables, familiar with Gannt style reporting and tracking)
 Other duties as assigned


 Retention:

 Develop and execute a lifecycle marketing strategy to build loyalty, increase lifetime value and reduce churn
 Help develop and support acquisition strategies by customer segment
 Strategic focus on churn reducing activities through the call center, process improvement and customer touchpoints
 Work across marketing, sales/digital, operations, campaign management, and analytics peers to define test plans and key objectives, help develop marketing strategy and ensure timely and accurate execution of all campaigns
 Ability to assess and analyze the results of a campaign in order to drive continued improvement
 Utilize customer feedback initiatives to drive and support improvements
 Generate performance reports and conduct campaign audits
 Analyze data to develop actionable insights that can be measured and reported
 Other duties as assigned


 Working Conditions:

 Hybrid: Open office environment + working from home
 Some overtime required as special projects arise
 Some travel <10%


 Minimum Requirements:

 A post-secondary degree in Commerce, Marketing, Communications or a related field coupled with 2-5 years of relevant industry experience.


 Proven experience developing strategies, initiating campaigns/projects and executing to completion
 Excellent analytical, problem-solving and trouble -shooting skills
 Experience with customer journey development
 Demonstrates superior organization and timely execution of initiatives
 Excellent communication skills, ability to lead projects and initiatives and collaborate with multiple teams
 Flexible and able to comfortably operate in an ever-evolving & changing environment
 Experience in a customer related area within the energy industry is preferred
 SAP experience a strong asset


 Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

 Strategic focus, able to see the big picture when planning
 Comfort dealing with cross-functional teams
 Strong organizational abilities and attention to detail
 Strong written & verbal communication skills, including influencing, advocacy and facilitation
 Demonstrated problem solving & analytical skills
 Expert in MS PowerPoint, Word and Excel
 Autonomous, self-starter
 Positive attitude and desire to create change


 Physical Requirements:

 Occasionally requires lifting as appropriate to perform duties and responsibilities/Position requires employee to work using a laptop/computer screen

 NRG Energy is committed to providing broad access to employment opportunities so that diverse job seekers can apply to positions, and to ensuring our workforce represents the diverse communities we serve. We abide by human rights legislation and accommodate applicants and employees in accordance with applicable law.
 Any information you provide through this form will be used and disclosed for the purposes of considering your application and, if you are offered a job, in relation to your employment (including post employment activities). If you have provided references, you consent to us contacting such references and obtaining your personal information from them. Do not submit references if you have not obtained the consent of such references. Your personal information will otherwise be handled in accordance with our privacy policy.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
COME GROW WITH US!



 ABOUT US:



 McDougall Energy Inc. (“McDougall Energy”) is a Canadian, privately owned, family business serving energy customers since 1949. McDougall Energy is a marketer and distributor of heating oil, propane, gasoline, diesel fuel and commercial lubricants, as well as an Esso™ and Shell® branded retailer. McDougall Energy is proud to be a Platinum Club member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, having retained its designation consecutively since 2011. Now in its third generation of ownership, the energy company serves communities across regions of Ontario and Western Canada. The company is headquartered in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario.
 


 Our success is driven by an uncompromising commitment to provide the highest quality customer service to each and every customer. We recognize that our employees are our most valuable resource and offer opportunities for development for personal and career growth.
 


 Position could be in one of our following locations:
 

 Sault Ste. Marie, ON
 Goderich, ON
 London, ON
 St. Thomas, ON
 Kingston, ON
 Brantford, ON



 ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:


   McDougall Energy is looking for a high energy, results focused individual as a 
  Business Analyst, reporting to Project Management Office and Continuous Improvement Manager. The Business Analyst will facilitate business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of functional business specifications. The Business Analyst will help assess, understand, and improve a wide variety of operational processes and system solutions to help the organization meet its goals and objectives.
 


 Manages requirements development process through elicitation, analysis, specification, and verification of requirements and works to develop technical specifications and test plans that will ensure the delivery of high-quality outcomes
 Develops supporting data analytics and decision support elements of projects, to enable successful business process improvement outcomes
 Consults with management and staff to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current and future state operational processes and procedures, issues, input and output requirements
 Engages with all stakeholders to validate and clarify requirements and desired outcomes
 Acts as a liaison between departmental end users and PMO & CI in the analysis, definition, design, configuration, testing, and maintenance of application systems to ensure optimal operational performance
 Analyses the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing applications, and ensures the solutions being delivered meet the needs of the business and other stakeholders
 Participates in and/or leads Continuous Improvement activities
 Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information system and/or non-system changes; assists in the preparation to develop new system and/or operational changes
 Facilitates the creation of user stories and use cases, acceptance criteria, test plans, testing, and training guides
 Develops analytics dashboards to support project and solution objectives
 Helps transform data into information that stakeholders can use to make informed decisions



 ABOUT YOU:



 The ideal candidate will have:
 


 Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role with direct experience working with Information Technology; Business Analyst certificate an asset
 Bachelor’s degree in Business Analysis, Business, Information Technology, Operations Management, Engineering, Science, Accounting or related field
 Business process re-engineering experience
 Excellent communication skills; both verbal and written
 Project Management experience working as part of a project team and/or Team Lead in project
 Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement, process mapping, IT Controls (ITIL, COBIT, SDLC, etc.), and Lean Six Sigma
 Effective problem solving and research skills
 Experience working with data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI
 Demonstrated ability to make timely, informed decisions; in realm of accountabilities and authority, and in consultation with functional groups and Information Technology
 Experience working with SQL an asset



 WHAT WE OFFER:



 Competitive Compensation
 4 weeks paid vacation
 Company paid Health & Dental Benefits
 Group RRSP
 Employee Assistance Program (EAP)



 Apply on-line at www.mcdougallcareers.com
 


 Confidentiality of all applicants assured. Only those selected for interviews will be contacted and we thank all other applicants for their interest.
 


 McDougall Energy is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you require any accommodations, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
We believe that everyone has the right to DEFINE themselves and their future.
That includes YOU.
How would you like to do it in a fun, high-performance culture that’s truly one of a kind – on a team that appreciates you for being you, helps our members retire with confidence and makes Canada better, all at the same time?
If that sounds like your thing – and you’re an exceptional Data Management Analyst– we’d like to hear from you.
We’re CAAT Pension Plan, and we’re growing. We innovate defined benefit (DB) pension plans. What are they? Unlike other pension plans, they specifically define the lifetime benefits our members will receive in retirement. This means that our members know exactly what they’re getting every month – for life! Because we provide that certainty, we help more Canadians retire with greater financial security and priceless peace of mind and take pressure off the social safety net at the very same time, which frees up those resources for other Canadians who really need them.
Reporting to the Manager, Data Management, this position is responsible for the integration of data from various sources. The Data Management Analyst will assist users, and other stakeholders, by extracting and interpreting data from various systems, providing management reports and statistics to enable business decision making. By using various automated data mining, data analysis/interpretation and ETL methods, the Data Management Analyst will extract, analyze, and evaluate information that is stored across various systems in order to provide support for decision making as well as support for various business processes. The Data Management Analyst will work closely with pension system stakeholders to evaluate business requirements from a data perspective to support enhancements to the pension administration system as well as other systems that interface with it. The Data Management Analyst brings expertise in automated methods of data analysis using various enterprise systems.
We are looking for someone with the following attributes: 

Experience in Integration with external data sources including Oracle databases, Flat files, XML files, Excel files, various APIs.
Good comprehension of financial data.
Expert knowledge of Structured Query Language including experience using Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server database.
Experience in at least one high level (either 3GL or 4GL) programming language.
Experience using various automated ETL methods including scripting and programming familiarity.
Proficiency in the use of various Business Intelligence tools.
A high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
Experience with the following programming languages / tools is desirable: Oracle, Python, Informatica Cloud and/or Power BI.

A University or College Degree in related field(s), with good communication skills and expertise in data automation methods and data analysis using various business systems methodologies, along with at least (5) years of proven experience in a similar role help to make you an ideal candidate.
Once here you will: 

Analyse data from different sources in various formats, gathers requirements, develops strategies and executes applications to integrate data from various systems and formats.
Provide data analytics to users ensuring that data is properly interpreted.
Extract information from data management systems as required by users or external consultants and regulatory bodies.
Respond to queries regarding data issues.
Maintain documentation and creates processes for bulk data operations such as batch processing.
Develop and executes programs to ensure that data integrity and quality is maintained.
Uses various systems and tools, developed, or purchased, to create a comprehensive view of the organization’s data assets.
Design and executes data queries to support year-end processes such as COLA, LTD PA and Annual Statements.
Keep up to date on various methods and technologies related to data management.

What does CAAT offer you and what should you know about us?

Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their whole, authentic selves to work. That’s what drives our high-performance, fun culture – one that’s truly one of a kind. In fact, we have been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2019 and 2020, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020 and 2021, and by Canadian HR Reporter as one of the Best Places to Work for 2021.
We provide (no big surprise here!) membership in CAAT’s defined benefit (DB) pension plan, a flexible and friendly work environment, a comprehensive health and dental benefits package, life insurance, and an array of wellness programs
Everyone is a leader at CAAT, so we invest in our people and enthusiastically support your career development goals, regardless of your role, with access to tuition aid and learning opportunities like our ground-breaking CAAT Academy
We are conveniently located at the Eaton Centre in downtown Toronto, next to Queen Subway station, with ready access to multiple TTC routes, GO Transit, and the PATH.
We are working remotely at present due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and in the future will be offering a flexible, hybrid work arrangement.
You can learn more at www.caatpension.ca

If you are interested, please apply by July 7, 2022, with Data Management Analyst in the subject line.
We recruit and select the most qualified candidates and thank all applicants for their interest but only those considered for an interview will be contacted. All interviews are being held remotely at this time.
CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer that supports abilities and diversity of all kinds. If you require accommodation during the recruiting and selection process, please contact us at 416-673-9000.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-07-07

Title: ISU Research Analyst
Description:
Staff - Non Union
 

   Job Category
  M&P - AAPS
 

   Job Profile
  AAPS Salaried - Research and Facilitation, Level A
 

   Job Title
  ISU Research Analyst
 

   Department
  ISU Administration | Department of Family Practice | Faculty of Medicine
 

   Compensation Range
  4,688.67 - $6,754.00 CAD Monthly
 

   Posting End Date
  July 12, 2022
 

   Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.
 


   Job End Date
  Mar 31, 2023
 


    Additional Job Description
  






       This position is located within a health-care facility, therefore, the successful candidate will be required to provide verification of full vaccination against Covid-19 provided prior to the start date, as required by a provincial health mandate.
     


       This is a full-time, term position until March 31, 2023, with possibility of extension.
     






   Job Description Summary
 

   The UBC Department of Family Practice (DFP) has established the primary care Innovation Support Unit (ISU) to connect, engage, and partner with those who are actively involved in innovations in primary care. The ISU is initially focused on supporting innovations in community-situated, team-based care (TBC) in BC, which includes initiatives in primary care transformation such as the Patient s Medical Home (PMH) and Primary Care Networks (PCNs) as these are key provincial strategic elements in achieving a sustainable and high-quality community and primary care system in BC. We are working with collaborators at UBC, the Ministry of Health, BC primary care communities and several other groups.
 

 The ISU has several interconnected 
  workstreams related to specific aspects of TBC transformation in Primary Care. Workstreams are a collection of applied, multi-method projects clustering around a particular pressing issue or need in primary care in BC. Workstreams focus on different areas such as: supporting transformation in the primary care system (e.g., designing, testing and deployment of new methods to support change), development of a team-based care evaluation framework and evaluation methods for team-based care; or support for the team based care advisory.
 


   The ISU has been established as a small but nimble and highly networked team, working with many stakeholders. We are currently, looking to hire 1-2 more Research Analysts to support the workstreams.
  
 Analysts will work with workstream leads and ISU faculty, to perform a range of activities including: reviews of literature, support for the Primary Care Transformation workstream in the implementation of primary care transformation tools (e.g. Team and PACC mapping).
 


   We are specifically looking for experience in:
 



     Action Research
   


     Multi-method evaluation (planning and execution)
   


     Quantitative methods to measure changes in behaviour and outcomes in primary care practices
   


     Data visualization
   


     Developing online communities of practice
   


     Coordination
   


     Academic literature reviews
   



   Some of our work will require more familiarity with action research and literature reviews, as well as quantitative and qualitative analysis. Other parts of our work focus more on design thinking, engagement of stakeholders and facilitation.
 


   As the ISU has a Teal organizational structure, the Research Analysts will be responsible for engaging across workstreams as required and as fits the skills of each of the team members. In this way, the ISU works very collaboratively and seeks to match team members to projects / workstreams that build on their strengths and skills. The ISU has opportunities for people with a range of skills and experience to broaden the team’s views as we tackle the complex challenges in primary care. We are looking for diversity and a broad range of experiences to complement other members of the team.
 


   In the ISU we value justice, equity, diversity and inclusion (JEDI) and are working to develop and apply this lens as we work to support primary care systems change. As a team we engage with learning related to the decolonization of research and healthcare systems; team members are expected to have a willingness to learn, unlearn and engage in this work.
  
 Organizational Status
   The Department of Family Practice supports researchers and faculty throughout the province. The ISU is a core unit of the department whose goal is to bring an applied academic lens to the changes that are actively occurring in primary care across the province. The ISU’s initial focus has been on team-based care. The ISU collaborates with the Ministry of Health, Health Authorities, Divisions of Family Practice, communities, and other provincial organizations to develop and link evidence to change initiatives. The ISU seeks to inform new models of care, test assumptions and gather data to inform system changes.
  
 Work Performed
 

   1. Work with TBC projects in communities (PMH or PCNs etc.) that have engaged the ISU with the ISU manager to develop relationships, and develop and implement plans and activities relating to Team Mapping and/or Evaluation support.
 


   2. Support Team Mapping Activities including:
 



     Preparing for Team Mapping Activities, reviewing partner documents, drafting Team Mapping materials, etc.
   


     Overseeing and facilitating Team Mapping Sessions
   


     Drafting the Team Mapping Activity analysis and reports
   



   3. TBC Evaluation Planning / TBC Evaluation:
 



     Review relevant literature and evaluation tools to refine the ISUs TBC evaluation framework
   


     Development of evaluation plans
   


     Manage activities to build local evaluation capacity in partner sites
   


     Perform on-site evaluation
   


     Analyze mixed methods evaluation data (surveys, interviews, EMR queries)
   


     Develop evaluation reports for partner sites
   



   4. Other:
 



     Preparation of academic articles and other knowledge dissemination products (e.g. webinars, videos).
   


     Development of materials and resources to be shared on ISU's website
   


 Consequence of Error/Judgement
   The Research Analyst will be dealing with data that is sensitive in nature and confidential and as such will be required to exercise discretion. The Research Analyst will be a representative of the Dept. of Family Practice and ISU and thus will be required to demonstrate a high degree of expertise and professionalism.
  
 Supervision Received
   The ISU Research Manager will provide direct supervision. The analyst will work with considerable latitude with research work reviewed against achievement of project objectives The successful candidate will report to the ISU leadership and steering committee.
  
 Supervision Given
   May be asked to provide guidance to student employees.
 


   Minimum Qualifications
   Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. Minimum of two years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 

 Preferred Qualifications
   At least a BSc in a related field (e.g. Health Information Science, Life Sciences, Public Health) and ideally an MSc, preferred. Experience in evaluation methods - qualitative or quantitative - and group facilitation (of focus groups and/or other community engagement strategies) is also desired. Work in primary care or clinical experience in primary care an asset. Experience with data analysis (e.g. health data analysis) an asset.
 


   The successful candidate will be an enthusiastic and resourceful team member, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and oral) in order to interact effectively with colleagues, clinicians and stakeholders.

Title: Regular Full-Time Geographic Information System Analyst
Description:
Job Snapshot



Employee Type:


      Regular Full-Time
     



Location:

Oshawa 
    


Job Type:


      Information Technology
     



Experience:


      Not Specified
     



Date Posted:


      7/11/2022
     





Job Description


 City of Oshawa, located just a short 30-minute drive from Toronto, is a progressive city of 172,000 people and is the economic engine of the eastern Greater Toronto Area. Our strategic pursuit of sustainable growth, excellent community service delivery and co-operative partnerships have enhanced our quality of life advantage, while maintaining a strong commitment to fiscal restraint. 
Job Title: Regular Full-Time Geographic Information System Analyst Posting Number: 003801 
Department: Corporate Services Department Branch: Information Technology Services 
Location: City Hall
 Posting Start Date: 2022/07/11 Posting End Date: 2022/07/26 by 4:30pm
 Employment Group: CUPE 251 Salary Grade: 09, $37.60 - $41.77 Standard Weekly Hours of Work: 36.25 Shift Work Required: No





Job Description


 Reporting to the Manager, Business Applications, or designate, the Geographic Information Systems (G.I.S.) Analyst is responsible for collaborating with city wide stakeholders to evolve and maintain the geospatial data and by creating spatial and non-spatial data in ESRI ArcGIS.
 Responsibilities 
The following responsibilities and duties of this position includes but is not limited to:

Creating, managing, maintaining, and updating core G.I.S. products and data for corporate and external use;
Researching, acquiring, creating and maintaining spatial and non-spatial datasets used for dissemination of information within the enterprise ESRI platform;
Performing analysis & geoprocessing services to produce cartographic and analytical products that support reports, maps, and presentations for internal and external clients;
Creating customized spatial layers for corporate projects or special studies;
Preparing digital data requests, maintaining base map inventories and responding to standard map requests;
Designing and developing ESRI G.I.S. applications, tools, technologies, concepts and methodologies;
Managing and coordinating third party sources of data and ensure conformance to City requirements;
Providing technical and administrative support for G.I.S software solutions including, participation in upgrades & software patches, troubleshooting performance issues, and managing user security access; and
Supporting of Oshawa Emergency Operation Center (EOC).



 Job Requirements

 The successful candidate will possess:

Post-secondary degree in Geography, or related discipline, and a post graduate diploma in Geographic Information Systems or equivalent education and experience
Successful completion of ArcGIS I & II and/or any related ESRI-related training/certificates
Minimum of three years of experience in the application of ArcGIS software and spatial database creation and maintenance.
Advanced Proficiency in ArcGIS Desktop/ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online and SQL.
Analytical thinker, with a keen interest in data analysis Ability to communicate courteously, tactfully and effectively, both orally and in writing, with internal clients, consultants, and vendors.
Demonstrated ability to work on own initiative in order to meet deadlines. Able to work under pressure.
Strong interpersonal, organizational, and project coordination skills.



 Please be advised that position location as noted is at the time of posting and is subject to change, as required due to operational needs.
 We would like to thank all applicants however, please note that only those selected to attend an interview will be contacted and all other applicants will be kept on file. Applicants are advised that written, oral and practical testing may form part of the selection process.
